text: Long wait, didn’t put ice in our drinks, chicken sandwich was so overdone it was inedible. Should have put a Chik-fil-a here. We won’t be back.

name: abdiel acevedo
text: Chicken was burn and hard like is been cooked 4 hours ago. Drinks tasted like water.

name: John Free
text: Just bad service ordered  Mac &cheese  I get to the window they said it was not ready yet should  have told me that at the window over priced

name: benny gray
text: False advertising slow service worker's playing food was cold

name: Amanda Rippy
text: Went on 5/25/21 and the manager was so rude and disrespectful. So loud while she was being rude that my mom on the other end of the restaurant heard her. Probably never returning to this location as long as she’s there.

name: Rufus Berdeaux
text: Long line and I ordered the ten piece tenders and got regular ten piece chicken bummer if didn't live so far away I would go back.

name: Greg Harkins
text: Clean facility and a friendly staff.

name: TMoore Leonard
text: Worst customer service ever!!!

name: Rebecka Montgomery
text: Small little place. It does look closed  but the food is delicious.  I got the Philly cheese steak and corn nuggets. Amazing.  Highly recommend this place. Help make them popular! I wish I would have discovered it sooner while I was here for work.

name: Timothy Gilley
text: U drive by u would think it was closed , but great food , great service will definitely be back, they said sat night was blues night, cant wait

name: Bert Gives, Jr
text:
Food is great, first time here visiting from South Carolina.  I saved this establishment in my Google maps. I will be back.
The shrimp I'd gooood.

name: Jonathon Davis
text: Food is delish.  Staff is very friendly.  Everyone greeted us. Will definitely come back.

name: Gentry Danzey
text: Very warm and inviting! Family all up in there! I love supporting small black businesses!

name: Bernice Massey
text: Great food and relaxing atmosphere

name: Patrick Moran
text: Food was good service was friendly

name: Jerome Womble
text: Awesome place to eat!

name: Tomeka Thomas
text: I always  get the catfish nuggets! On occasions they are fried too soft but overall they are very good. Very polite staff.

name: Angela Pittman
text: The hot bar had some good food! I highly recommend this place.

name: Randy Tennyson
text: The foods pretty good. The burger needed a little more seasoning but it was above average. Expect a wait as they cook to order

name: Akiliah Wright
text: Fried chicken and green tomatoes oooo yeah sweet potato casserole

name: JaQuiese Owens
text: They're like family up there. I love the service and the food is amazing🌠🌠

name: Hunter Kenya
text: Great customer service and the fried green tomatoes....OMG!! They taste homemade

name: Linda Williams
text: This excellent service and food and the people are great.

name: Juicy
text: I had 6 wing combo lemon/garlic pepper with fried mushrooms omg it tasted like back home in Michigan!! Keep doing ur thang

name: Michellè Michelle Michellé
text: Vegetables are the best and the people are so friendly

name: Raymond Harkins
text: Great food for the price. You will have to wait for it to be cooked.

name: Moe Taha
text: Very tasty food. Reasonable price. Long waiting.

name: Keith Smedley
text: Food is just what you ordered. Always fresh and hot. The grill chicken salad is tops.

name: corey brown
text: Good food, decent prices nice employees

name: Glenn Speigner
text: You get what you ask for and plenty of food for the price and it's great food

name: Amanda Bell
text: Great food but it takes some time to get your order

name: DeBran Sudduth
text: I love sharks best fish in Bessemer

name: German Aguilar
text: Service was good but we're a little slow, was well worth it.

name: Tim Ashley
text: There is absolutely nothing healthy coming out of this joint, but it is fast and good!

name: Valerie Jackson
text: THE FOOD IS GOOD, BUT THEY NEED SOME MORE HELP

name: S D
text: Great fried chicken wings

name: Jennifer Moeller
text: Great food. Hate they closed

name: Shirley W. Hill
text: Fast food more choices

name: Big D
text: Its now called 3 ways restaurant & is fantastic!!!

name: Big Bucks
text: Took 32 minutes from the time I order to get my food. Staff in no hurry whatsoever. Will never eat there again...

name: Jeff Marks
text: Limited menu. Fresh. Hot. Food is too salty.

name: Maxwell W
text: Deep fried everything made hot to order.

name: Antonio Hooper
text: One of my favorite places to eat

name: Lea Pickens
text: Good food long waits better call your order in

name: Rodney Burnes
text: Food is always hot and delicious!

name: Matt Holland
text: Use to like it new staff sux

name: RME REACTIONS & Gaming
text: Great workers. Great food.

name: Patrice Edwards
text: Teriyaki is 100% awesome

name: Jerry Booker
text: Nice spot good service

name: Kiarra Mayes
text: I will not eat there no more my rice was burnt and my shrimp don’t have no flavor and my chicken and they was out of egg rolls!! 🤦🏽‍♀️

name: Arika Kapri
text: They’re no longer open, even though it listed open😞

name: Tynisha Gaines
text: The whole catfish is superb

name: Necole Shante
text: I waited 30 min for my food only to find out that it hadn't been cooked. They lost my ticket which I don't understand, because I saw the guy stick it up top. I will not go back!!

name: Carla Mc
text: Great jumbo shrimp!!

name: Erric Beasley
text: Good food

name: Tha Sarah
text: Food is delicious

name: megan lee
text: Horrible wont be back

name: Angela Pittman
text: Great Food!

name: cynthia adams
text: Good food

name: Ricci Creger
text: Love Sharks!

name: Antoinette Pitts
text: Was not open.

name: K West
text: Great Chicken Wings

name: Cheretta Wellman
text: Nice

name: M B
text: Yum

name: Michael Vanhook
text: Yummy happy hour drinks and a pound of lightly battered crab claws. Everyone loved it. Best pick on this trip. Our kid enjoyed the mac-n-cheese and fried corn on the cob.

resp.text: Thanks, Michael! We appreciate the review and hope to see you again soon!

name: Alyssa Wagstaff
text: Food was great but the restaurant itself needs a little TLC

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your visit!

name: Kimberly Graham
text: Casual dining with great food. I was looking for a restaurant at the beach that we hadn't tried. Researched Fiddlefish and decided to give it a try. Crab and corn chowder was excellent. My sons each had steak and raved about how good it was. My niece tried chicken Alfredo and loved it as well. Hubby and I had shrimp and fish combo. I do believe this was the best meal we've had all week. The place was very busy and the servers were running like crazy!  Everyone working there was very nice and very accommodating. We will be back next summer!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Kimberly! We appreciate the visit and the review! We are very glad the whole family enjoyed their food. See you in 2017 if not before!

name: M Wright
text: The food is the best on the beach. Best place we have ever ate in Orange Beach or Gulf shores. Service was awesome! From the appetizer to the shrimp and fish food is amazing. Prices are great as well

resp.text: That's what we like to hear! Thanks for taking time to leave a review. We appreciate your visit and hope to see you again soon!

name: Ben Dillow
text: Almost a week in Orange Beach now and I've had quite a bit of seafood. Most of it has been good but nothing I'll probably remember. Fiddlefish changed that. The crab cakes were delicious. This is the best seafood restaurant in the Orange Beach area.

resp.text: Wow! Thanks for the great review. We sure do appreciate you taking time to share your experience. Don't be a stranger! Hope to see you again soon.

name: Greg perkins
text:
Family vacationing at the beach from South Louisiana. Saw free appetizer coupon in local booklet and liked the menu options. First time here. Great food, great service, casual atmosphere. Serving Community Coffee and iced tea.
We had the fiddle shrimp as appetizers (similar to bang bang or firecracker shrimp) for app. Enjoyed the blackened grouper soft tacos and crab cake entrees. Finished off with Community Decaf. From the music playlist, to the crushed ice in the drinks, to the coffee mugs, this place is perfect! Will be back.

resp.text: We're glad you notice the details! Thank you for your review! We hope you enjoyed your visit to the Alabama Gulf Coast and look forward to your next visit. :)

name: Monica DY
text: This place is awesome!  The food is great!!!  We had a party of 5 and had the hush puppies with cheese dip, crab & corn bisque, seafood potato, fried corn, fried okra, kids popcorn shrimp with fries, and mac & cheese.  Every single item was delicious! Very laid back environment, great staff!  We're native Louisianan's and we approve this place!!!!!

resp.text: Wow! Thanks so much! Glad you enjoyed!

name: Rob P
text: Great, fresh seafood. Had some good beers on tap as well. The outdoor seating is right next to the road, so it can get a bit loud. But it was a great stop for lunch

resp.text: Thanks for stopping in! We're glad you enjoyed your visit. Hope to see you soon!

name: Stephanie Casida
text: Food was amazing. Fiddlefish sauce is da-bomb. Highly recommend this place. Our server Tasha was wonderful and sweet. Definitely will be back here to eat if we ever come back to Orange Beach. I had the Grouper Tacos and they were fantastic. One satisfied lady right here. :-)

resp.text: That's what we like to hear! We are glad you enjoyed your visit. Thank you for taking time to write a review!

name: Brian Griggs
text: 10 of us seated in less than 5 minutes.  Great service!  Average steak. Fair price.

resp.text: Thanks! Glad to have your group in and hope to see you again. We strive for excellence so please let us know if you feel something is only "average". We'll be happy to do whatever we can for you. Thanks for the review.

name: Joe Kennedy
text: Second time here and the fried fish is perfect. My wife loved the grouper tacos. Do NOT waste money on a chain or Shrimp Basket when you can eat here. Service is excellent, too.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We appreciate you coming back to see us and helping spreading the word!

name: amy laudun
text: Absolutely love this restaurant, it has now become a family tradition when we come to orange beach. The fiddlesauce is delicious 😋. The atmosphere is low key, and the service is great. Also, the shrimp & grits, and seafood potato are our favorite

resp.text: Thank you! We ❤️ family traditions that include us!!

name: Joshua Haney
text: Most amazing food I've had down here on this vacation. This is a small place but man is their food good. Everything is perfect and tasty! Will visit here again in the future.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! So glad you have us a try and we look forward to seeing you again. 😊

name: Amber Rowland
text: We LOVE Fiddlefish!  Their food and service is the BEST and the ambience is amazing! It's like finding that little spot that the locals eat at bc the food is fresh and delicious and the staff treats you like family.

resp.text: Thank you! We are so glad that you feel that way. We love having you and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Danielle Woods
text: Great atmosphere! Amazing food! Good service! Fair prices! I defiantly recommend going here!

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your visit and are glad you enjoyed it. :)

name: Holley Grainger
text: We weren't sure what to expect when we stopped in this morning but were beyond pleased with our delicious food and dining experience. The Oyster Sampler was one of the best we've ever had- especially for the price- and I loved my blackened grouper tacos. We definitely plan to go back to eat again next time we're in town and will ask be hitting up the half price happy hour cocktails. The drinks at the table next to us looked divine!

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed your visit! We look forward to having you back!

name: Robert McRaney
text: Really good place.  Great fried seafood and the breeding isn't too filling for fried. I had the seafood platter which was way too much for me after an appetizer of six oysters. It was a great experience and the manager gave us a free strawberry daqurie.

resp.text: We're glad you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for the review. 😊

name: Caroline Woods
text: Even my impatient husband had to admit the shrimp and grits were amazing.  My 11-year-old loved his shrimp poboy.  I loved the decor and atmosphere.  I imagine it's packed in peak season.  My only complaint was the slow service, but Melissa did well being the only one serving.

resp.text: Thanks for stopping in and for the review! We're glad you enjoyed it. 😊

name: Trey Hellums
text:
Great food and great service!  Still can't figure out why the place wasn't packed. We were seated immediately and enjoyed several appetizers. The hush puppies are incredible!  Also enjoyed the gumbo and the shrimp. All the entrées were delicious and very reasonably priced. My wife got the Pasta Jubilee which was my favorite. The sauce was out of this world and the fried eggplant was just right.
This is a really cool place and we will definitely be back.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting! We'd love to see you again!

name: Randy Mingo
text: Great food and service, had stopped at another place before finding this little gem. Owner noticed we were from Arkansas and gave his personal recommendations for the food. Our group had the fiddleshrimp, burgers, fried shrimp, and the Cajun pasta, all of it hot and fresh like it should be. Will definitely come here again on our next trip!

resp.text: Thanks for taking time to write a review. We are glad you found us and hope to see you again! Enjoy your visit to the Gulf Coast!

name: Valerie Salazar
text: Stopped in on a whim one night while sightseeing. Shared the oyster sampler with my mom. This was on the last night of vacation and we had tried many places in Gulf Shores and were looking for something different and special. Boy did we find it. The oysters were the best we have ever had, the atmosphere was perfect and service was on point. Our visit to Fiddlefish definitely ended our trip on a perfect note. Don't ever drive through Orange Beach without giving it a try! The key lime pie was great also. This is a place I'll dream about for years to come.

resp.text: So glad you found us before you left the area! We do hope you'll be back. Thank you for the very kind words and taking time to leave the review!

name: Steve Horowitz
text: The food was awesome. Just plain awesome. Seriously... Awesome. We came on a busy day and our waiter was on his 2nd day on the job.  Had to wait a long while as he had trouble getting the orders in, but the food was so good we came back again 2 days later. Fast service that time.  Will be back next time we're in town.

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed the food! We appreciate your return visit and look forward to seeing you again next time.

name: Lyndsey Mcclour
text: Everything we had was wonderful.  I enjoyed the alfrado. It was probably the best meal I  had the whole time I was at the beach! Such a cute little place as well..

resp.text: Thanks Lyndsey! We appreciate your visit as well as your review. Come back to see us on your next trip to the beach!

name: Robyn Buxton
text: From the awesome huge cheeseburger, oyster po-boy, and even the seasoned perfectly fries. Hands down the best food we've had all week! Highly recommend and reasonably priced!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Robyn! Many people don't know that our burgers are amazing! Thanks for spreading the word. So glad you joined us and look forward to serving you again!

name: John Vogt
text: Great seafood at a good price. The staff was very friendly. We loved the shrimp and the hush puppies are amazing.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review! We're glad you found us and enjoyed your visit!

name: Tim Boren
text: Okay, we ended up at Fiddlefish because Florbama was a 2 hour wait.  I'd never been here or even heard of it.  WOW!  We've been coming to Gulf Shores for years and I can't believe I just discovered this place.  Just awesome...all of it.  The sampler platter of grilled oysters rocked! The fish, shrimp, crab balls and seafood stuffed baked potato were perfect.  Don't waste your time waiting in line at other places.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to write a review. We sincerely appreciate it. This is just the 3rd summer we have been open in OBA so folks are still discovering us. Sure glad you did! Hope to see you again!

name: M Hale
text: Walked in and waited 5 minutes waiting for a host or hostess to appear or someone to acknowledge us.  We were aggressively ignored. Very strange. We left, didn't bode well for service after that.

resp.text: M. Hale, We welcome you to call and speak with a manager or owner so that we can better understand the situation. We would like clarification on exactly what happened and when it took place. Thank you for your time.

name: S W
text: My family (me + 5) just waited 15 minutes once we were seated, and nobody came to even take our drink order. Turns out, there was only one server working by himself. My family and I left, and we will not be back. It's not his fault, but the restaurant should be staffed appropriately.

resp.text: Steve, we are sorry that you had this experience. Unfortunately, we were shorthanded and did not manage to serve you properly. I assure you that this is an anomaly and offer our sincerest apology.

name: Andy VanCleve
text: We came here on a Friday about 5 PM. It was surprisingly empty, which took away from the experience a bit. The atmosphere could've been better. The food was not as hot as it should've been when it came out. But overall, the taste was excellent. The fried fish, the fiddleshrimp, the mac and cheese, the crab cake and hushpuppies were all delicious! The gumbo wasn't great and the ice water was gross. Other than that, a nice experience.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. If you bring all your friends next time, you can help us fill the place up! Come early, as it gets packed toward the dinner hour, especially during the summer. :)

name: Shirin Odar
text: Was so excited to try this place after all the great reviews. Food was ok, service was horrendous. Our server was argumentative and rude.  Will never come again. There are so many better options on Orange Beach--do not waste your time or money here.

resp.text: I'm very sorry for your experience and am checking into it. As you have mentioned, we normally receive excellent ratings for both our food and service and strive to maintain a standard of excellence in all areas. We sincerely apologize that you did not enjoy your visit.

name: Rosie Dillow
text: Me and my fiancée drove a long way (10+ hours) to find him good seafood and here was the best place we found it in a week long stay. The service was amazing a nice relaxing place to dine.

resp.text: 10 hours! Wow! We are really glad you enjoyed it! You picked a beautiful area. Hope you'll return and thank you for the review. :)

name: Frank D.
text: Yummy shrimp & oysters.  Great , friendly staff.  Will be coming back.

resp.text: Thanks for your visit and your review! We look forward to seeing you again. We're so glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Rebecca Land
text: Nice atmosphere, fairly priced, large portions, and great tasting seafood pasta! Plus it's within walking distance from Perdido Beach Resort!

resp.text: Thanks Rebecca! Glad you found us. Many of the guests at PBR find their way to us. We appreciate your visit and hope to see you again soon. :)

name: Jesús E. González
text: The fiddleshrimp were the stars of the night. Our nightmares began after the cocktails and the appetizers were brought and we ordered the entree. They had us waiting for a period of about 35 min to tell us that they ran out of potatoes to stuff. After we order something else and waited about 45 mi more when we see that the table besides us had the same potato we ordered. The explanation was not tottaly credible. Good food, fair service... very bad experience with the order.

resp.text: We apologize for your inconvenience. The stuffed potatoes are popular items and we occasionally do run out. However, you certainly should have been notified of that when you ordered. Please accept our apology for the delay and for the apparent mixup in your order.

name: Dorothy Weaver
text: Decent prices for the usual seafood fare. Restaurant could use a good cleaning though.

resp.text: Thank you for your comment. The restaurant is cleaned thoroughly at night and then checked in the mornings. In addition, it is spot cleaned throughout the day. However, if something was overlooked, we apologize. We strive to maintain and exceed proper standards for cleanliness.

name: Kaitlyn Jones
text:
Maybe I just came on a bad day, but I did not have a good experience. Service wasn't great. drinks took forever. I ordered the Seafood Potato, and was told it would be an extra 10-15 mins. My table asked for coffee, and the server gave us an attitude saying she would have to brew it. My server refilled my drink with the wrong drink. Once the potato came out,  it was hard and cold. My friend ordered the Alfredo, and it tasted like straight butter and noodles. The shrimp in my whole tables plates, were all bland. We can all agree that it wasn't worth the prices at all. The only good thing was the music.

Overall, I just expected more. I don't think it was worth it. Very overpriced.

resp.text: We are very sorry that you did not enjoy your dining experience. We will certainly address the issues and we hope that you'll give us another chance.

name: Maxwell Bulloch
text: Great Grilled Oysters...Oysters Jubilee was my favorite followed closely by the buttered parmesan garlic. Did not have to wait long either.

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed! Our grilled oysters are the best! It sounds like you tried our popular Sampler Oysters. Everyone loves them. Thanks for the review and hope to see you again soon!

name: Kristin Fitzgerald
text: I went with my family for dinner. We shared the Fiddleshrimp as an appetizer and ended up ordering another one because it was so good. The Fiddleburger was excellent as well, and the staff were extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend it and actually can't wait to go back!

resp.text: Thanks for visiting and we'd love to have you back! We are a seafood restaurant that is very proud of our burgers--glad you got to experience one!

name: Wes Lamon (Wes L)
text: Great food at a great price. It is very relaxed, so it is a great place to bring the kids.

resp.text: We love hearing from our guests! Thanks for the review. Kids love our food as much as the adults! Bring 'em!

name: Rita White
text: I think that was some of the best fried fish I've eaten.  Everything was delicious!

resp.text: We agree! It hits the spot! Thanks for your visit and we hope to see you again!

name: Brittany Sloan
text: Amazing food, great drinks, and good atmosphere! The staff was so friendly and fast.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate you coming in and we're glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Chris Ryder
text: No long lines and very reasonable price.  This was the best food and best service in Orange Beach. This place is seriously underated.  Shrimp is the best on the island.  Yes we tried Cosmos and Desotos etc but I will definitely come back to fiddlefish and Stacey was a great  server.

resp.text: Wow! Thanks for the kind review! We appreciate your visit and are so glad you enjoyed it. 😊

name: Aubrey Glen Yeager
text: Visited here on vacation...It was so good, we came back again the next day! The crab cakes and okra are especially good.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We're glad you enjoyed your visits! :) Have a great vacation and hopefully we'll see you again next time!

name: Keith Brasher
text: Great food, great atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for your review and recommendation! We appreciate your visit. Come back soon!

name: Schuyler Powell
text: This is by far the best food I have ever tasted. I have lived in San Diego, Pensacola, North Carolina, South Carolina, Bahrain, India, Hawaii, and I can't believe the greatest food was right around the corner from my hometown. It is an hour drive to fiddlefish and I plan on going there at least once a month. To the people that gave this place one and three Stars I don't know what's wrong with you. You need help and then you had the nerve to do it and not see why you did it which leads me to believe that you are haters, or restaurant owners that are close to fiddlefish.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice review! We are glad you discovered us and hope to see you again soon! We strive to keep the food delicious and the service excellent every day.

name: Alexis Romero
text: Fiddlefish is very good and even though they are getting sold to another place it is very good. If you would like to come up recommend one of the sides

name: Christian N
text: Grouper tacos are great, fiddlesauce is mandatory so both a doing sauce for fries and on the tacos.

resp.text: Thank you! We completely agree...the Fiddlesauce makes the tacos! And great on the fries too!

name: Patrick Landry
text: Nothing fancy but really good fried shrimp and fried fish. Great service.

resp.text: Thanks for the review. Our fried shrimp is definitely a favorite! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Paul Gallenstein
text:
Shelby and Mary are awesome!!!!!

I had the rid I with Fiddlefish butter.

It was Awesome :-)

resp.text: Thanks for the review! Glad you enjoyed. :)

name: clinton bell
text: Food was good overall that is the reason for 2 stars. Service was not. The staff we experienced Sunday night seemed as if customers were bothering them and cutting into their cell phone time. Very unattentive, no sense of urgency or care except when the bill was to be paid. No refills no upselling on any specials. An 8 person group got up and left a few minutes after getting there and the people behind us were complaining of the lack of attention by the staff. My pregnant wife had to get up and ask for a water as it took literally 5 minutes to be acknowledged. This was at 5:30 pm hardly anyone was there. This is going to kill this business if the owner doesn't step in soon.

resp.text: We do apologize for Sunday night! We unfortunately had several members of our staff call in with various emergency situations, a perfect storm for us. (The cell phone usage was trying to call in subs.) We are sincerely sorry and assure you that our level of frustration exceeded yours, as we strive for every customer experience to be exceptional.

name: j z
text: We gave this place two chances during our vacation.  The first visit was just after a lunch rush, so we didn't judge the slow service or the little mix ups. I understand; I've worked a lot of food service. The second visit was just disappointing. The highlight of the meal was the side salad. I had a fish Poboy that was decent, but nothing special. My girlfriend ordered a dozen raw oysters and was severely disappointed. They seemed to be pre-shucked and refrigerated, they were full of sediment, and a good half of them were puny. She had to fight every single one out of the shell. It's so disappointing because there is a seafood bar in our hometown in Arkansas that serves oysters that are fresher, better prepared, and more equally sized.

resp.text: We are sorry that your experience did not meet our standards or yours. Any time you aren't satisfied with the food, please let the manager or owner know. We will always do our best to make sure you leave happy.

name: Chrystal Jones
text: Great service and very good food!  Definitely recommend!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking time to write a review! We appreciate you and are glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Bradley Joyner
text: This is the best kept secret in Orange Beach.  The pasta jubilee is the best!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We appreciate you taking the time to comment. 😊

name: Sherry Webber
text: Crab cakes were excellent!! Collin was a great waiter!! Highly recommend it!

resp.text: Thank you for your comment! We appreciate your recommendation!

name: Holly Sharp
text: Good blackened grouper taco and huge shrimp poboy. Fiddle sauce is good addition to both.  Had hush puppy and jalapeño cheese dip app. Good too.  Frozen seasoned crinkle fries disappoint. "Fish" here,  without menu clarification is SWAI!!! This should be a sin for a beach restaurant.  Overall good.

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed your grouper and shrimp po boy.. We always have a fish of the day as well as the whitefish. It is prepared differently every day and is delicious!  Always a favorite! It's listed on the menu as "Fish of the Day". Thank you for stopping in and taking time to leave a review.

name: Tiffany Cleckler
text:
My teenage son, daughter and I visited this evening. We entered through the front and stood for several minutes before the guests at the table near the door told us to go to the other end to be seated. I didn't understand this as the sign at the front entrance said see a waitress/hostess to be seated. However no one ever came. We stood there at the back entrance several minutes before anyone even approached us, though 3 waitresses were in the dining area. Finally, Rebekah (she ended up our waitress and never told us her name, but I saw it on our ticket when I paid), asked if we wanted to be seated (Duh!) and took us to our table. She was not the friendliest, like I said, didn't introduce herself just asked our drink orders, but she seemed so unhappy to be there. Our not-so-friendly waitress was the downside to our night and why I rated 3 instead of 4 stars. On to the good stuff.

We ordered the Fiddlefish Shrimp app bc I saw a pic online and it looked delicious. IT WAS. My son ordered the pick 2---fish and shrimp. I ordered shrimp and grits. My daughter had a cheeseburger. We all enjoyed our food, except the slaw seemed to have onions and my son really disliked that and didn't eat it. He said the fried corn on the cob was just ok, but his fish was wonderful. I tried it, but not the shrimp. The shrimp and grits had chopped sausage and a very tasty cream sauce. It was really good, but different from others I have tried. Didn't try my daughter's hamburger but it was huge and looked Delish. The food was good portions for the price. It was very reasonably priced. It was a low-key casual environment and besides our waitress we had a good experience. I left her a $10 tip even though she didn't really deserve one because everyone has bad days, right? I hope Rebekah comes to work in a better mood on her next shift. I do want to mention that the waitress that brought our food was SUPER FRIENDLY. We are staying directly across the street from the restaurant in Grand Pointe and it was nice to walk to dinner. I would give this place another chance as we did enjoy the food, just not the service today.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We are glad you enjoyed the food and appreciate the opportunity to meet your expectations on service in the near future.

name: Bizzy Schorr
text: We had really good service. The food was nice, and affordable, though not exceptional.

resp.text: Thank you for your visit and for your review. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Nathan Land
text: Very good food. If possible get the shrimp Alfredo.

resp.text: Yum! One of our favorites! We make the sauce for each individual order, never pre-made. Thanks for stopping in and for taking time to submit a review!

name: Lee Adams
text: The fiddle sauce is awesome and the kids loved their food

resp.text: Glad everyone enjoyed their food! Thanks for your review! 😊

name: Mike Wersching
text:
I'm not sure why or how this place receiced any 5 star reviews. We came here on one of our 2 nights out for dinner while we were on vacation, and what a waste. We came in last night with a party of 10. We were seated immediately on a Saturday night (first red flag).
After being sat our drink orders were taken and came out great.  We ordered our meals, of which included a dozen raw oysters. After some coversation and curiosity at the table, we realized that we wouldn't have enough oysters for everyone to try so we ordered more, to which our server became visibly flustered over the fact that we were adding to our order.
The oysters came out with watered down horseradish sauce, aweful. How can you screw up raw oysters? This place did.
Our meal came out a plate or 2 at a time over a 20 minute period. Some of us felt uncomfortable eating while others didnt have their food. The food runner told us that she was sorry and that some of the food orders didnt get put in. So we ate our food as it came out so it didn't go cold.
I had fish tacos with coleslaw which was terrible. My girlfriend had chicken marsala, to which she said "I think you make better marsala sauce."
The seafood potato that a friend got looked like the only decent food on the table. In the end no one could finish their meal and we boxed it up to possibly stomach for lunch today.
This review may sound a little harsh but our experience was no where close to the types of reviews this place has. There are a couple other resteraunts in the marina that i would try before ever goinf back here.

resp.text: Mike, I truly am sorry for your experience. As you indicated, this is certainly not typical. Be assured that we will check into the issues you have mentioned.

name: Renegade BS
text: We're from Louisiana and this place impressed us!  Everything was perfect and the Fiddleshrimp were awesome!  We'll be back!!!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed your visit! You'll have to try the gumbo and the Cajun Shrimp Pasta next time! 😊 Thanks for taking time to leave a review. We truly appreciate it.

name: Robert Knox
text: I had thefried fish and shrimp and my wife had the seafood stuffed potato and it were delicious! We got the fiddlefish shrimp appetizer and it was similar to bang bang shrimp from Bonefish (it was awesome). Everything was fresh and the staff were nice. Of all of the places we ate at Gulf Shores/Orange Beach, Fiddlefish was our favorite. We will definitely be back next year. We went in the afternoon and it was a pretty relaxed and welcome departure frome some of the other, overpacked restaurants.

resp.text: Robert, thanks for the nice review. We are so pleased that you found us and enjoyed your visit. Thank you for your patronage and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: David Davis
text: Thursday February 24, 2016 , the Fort Morgan Supper Club  met for dinner at Fiddlefish in Orange Beach at 6:00. Our table was ready upon arrival , and we were seated and greeted by our server Daniel Nowosielski. Excellence in every way from hello to come again. The unique appetizer was the variety of Chargrilled Oysters. Unequivocally better than baked... Grilled to Perfection! For me, they were some of the Best of the South! We also tried the Fiddlefish Shrimp,for $7.99, they were fresh,  spicy , hot , lightly breaded and fried. Delicious! One other particular dish not to be denied is the Shrimp n Grits! Not to be denied... It rates right up there with , if not better (I won't name) than some 5 star restaurants! Happy hour features $3.00 Bushwackers. Which anywhere on the beach is $8! We  sampled a small one with 8 spoons! It was very good! $3.00 during Happy Hour. The full bar also had other specials.     The good presentation , quality, and quantity of all entrees was EXCELLENT. Comments about each can be seen under that particular picture. Finally we shared the hot Molten Fudge Brownie and ice cream dessert, and the Key Lime Pie. They were both incredible. At the  end , Chef Ashley, made time to come out and greet the guests, make sure we enjoyed our meal and was there to answer any questions and in our case, take our compliments! Again see more comments under the pictures.Excellent Food, Fellowship, fun, and new friends along with reasonable prices, accomodations clean and comfortable, parking safe & well lighted.  As wonderful as our Supper Club's experience. Fiddlefish might just be The Place to find the best good right here on the beach in Orange Beach!                               Come join us next week at Ivey's in Robertsdale !!

resp.text: We are so pleased that the FMSC joined us tonight. Thanks so much for the wonderful review. It was our pleasure to serve you! We look forward to visiting with you again next time!

name: Aaron Gray
text: One of only two Mexican restaurants in Birmingham with food from the Nyarit District of Mexico. Delicious, authentic food. The El Rey Ceviche was killer, which was octopus, tilapia, shrimp, and scallops, soaked in lime,  cilantro, and seasonings. We also had the empanadas, which were the best I've ever had. The chips and salsa weren't anything special, but the other food more than made up for it. Two thumbs up.

name: Ted Darby
text:
Oh my Gosh! This place is out of the way, not to crowded and treats each customer great! Wish more places took this attitude. The food is true Mexican cuisine and top notch. No short cuts here and you will leave comfortably full and satisfied. We have found our go to place when we have a taste for true south of the border!
Thanks!!

name: Mark Johnson
text: Went with my wife who is NOT a big fan of Mexican Food. She thought it was great. The margaritas were excellent (happy hour 3-8!). The food was authentic and wonderful. Extensive menu and quite a diverse selection of seafood dishes. We'll be back!

text: Very authentic Mexican seafood dishes. I ordered the crab cakes. Very tasty and generous portions. Highly recommend.

name: Amy Druschitz
text: I love this place.  Get something with shrimp and you won't be disappointed.  My favorite is the tostada ceviche and shrimp taco.  For lunch, it's so much food for only $7.  And on Fridays all of their lunches are $6!  Their guacamole is fresh and delicious (if you like chunky guacamole).  And their salsa is fresh and yummy as well.

name: Ben Haase
text: I have returned here 3 times in the past two months. I have tried something different each time, and everything I have tried is delicious and authentic tasting. The ceviche is excellent and the variety of seafood entrees keep my wife and I coming back to try more.

text: Me and my husband went here tonight and this was a first and last time. The server did not know what things went on what food. When my husband ordered his soup it only had the meats and CALDOS have corn potatoes and other vegetables. It had no flavor to it. Then my plate had a thin piece of fish and some small shrimp. The best thing there was the bread but should have been tortillas. Was very high priced for what we got. Will not be returning.

name: Jessica Penningtom
text: It was our first time eating here . We started out with cheese dip because my six year old just loves cheese dip  but when they brought it out my daughter wouldn't eat anymore of it  and that's not like her it's her favorite thing. So I tried it to see  what the issue was and let me tell you the cheese dip tasted like it wasn't even cheese dip at all not even a slight taste close to cheese dip yes it looked like cheese dip but the taste not so much it was so gross I had to spit it out myself. I ordered the shrimp scewers with scallpos and rice and beans and salad well when that was brought out and I tested it I had to spit that out as well the scallops were raw and the taste / flavor of the meal didn't even taste right might have been the cooking oil or whatever seasoning they use but that was awful. My husband ordered ceviche to start out and when that was brought out the flavors of that was awful it had raw shrimp pieces in this plate it's supposed to come with shrimp but I wasn't expecting it to be all raw and the pieces of the shrimp was cut way to big for this plate it had way to much salt and when we ordered the ceviche we wasn't told or asked which type of ceviche we wanted so they just brought out whatever they wanted my husband and myself didn't like this plate at all I had to pick out all of the raw shrimp which makes over 90 percent of the plate which wasn't fun. So then lastly just to make sure we wasn't over exaggerating my husband ordered something simiple which all Mexican restaurants offer and is so easy to make which was carne asada with a side of rice and beans and side of tortillas  let's just start off by saying whatever meat that was they used couldn't have been real beef the flavor and texture of the meat was just awful and disgusting didn't even taste like beef  and the meet was so tough couldn't even cut or chew the meat. And the side of tortillas that were brought out  everyone.knows what tortillas are supposed.to look and taste like but these tortillas something was definitely wrong with them they didn't even taste like tortillas  and the color of them didn't even look right . And to sum up this my husband and myself are not picky eaters by all means we love every type of food  and will try anything and eat anything I'm American and my husband is Mexican I've been. To many different Mexican restaurants with different dishes and authenticy not to mention eating the real deal authentic Mexican food at my mom n laws house. But by far I've never been to a restaurant like this and I will never go back there oh and not to mention I had told the waiter about my scewers l plate that I didn't like them I took 3 bites and couldn't eat anymore she aasked me if I wanted to remake the dish or get something else I felt it was safer to choose something else  so I told her that she can pack it to go cause it was taking awhile and I'll be Damned soon as I get home I took one bite and about got sick gagging  had to spit the food out I ordered empanadas which should be very easy to make. But these empanadas didn't look like empanadas at all the outside which is the dough Its supposed to be a light tan color the color of the maseca/ flour. This dough was orange like a sweet potato and the shape looked like a half of a banana  on the inside they put that gross  so called cheese dip and shrimp on the inside another dish wasted I had to feed it to my dogs I just can't get over the disappointment of 5 meals and $60 later  that not even one of my dishes had even the slightest bit of hope and I hate to be blunt but I want to let people know of my experience here and would hope they not waste that amount of money on something you can't even eat. The only thing I will give credit on was the service is good  the waiter is super sweet and the sweet tea was decent. Hopefully in the future this restraunt will get some help I would hate to see it close down we need this type of restraunt in the area. So good luck

We waited another 7 minutes, no service.  When we walked out,  3 servers were standing at the bar watching tv.  Hope the owner has deep pockets because this place will not survive.

Finally, the several people behind us left and so did we. The Blind Tiger won’t be in business long with that kind of service and definitely with that attitude...completely ruined the atmosphere. dont waste your time. whoever owns this place obviously doesnt care about how its being managed.

As we drove around, there were two or three cars waiting near the window. One was past the window as if waiting on a part of their order. In another car, a convertable, the occupants were literally sunning themselves.  I looked in the store and saw folks and someone who appeared to be the manager standing around.  Given that I am a fried chicken junkie, you have to know that I waited a good bit, and it hurt to b leave as I really wanted fried chicken.  Won't stop there again.

Then my mother said as she was walking out, she heard the supervisor talking about me to a customer.  How is she the manager?  Popeye needs to hire individuals with customer service experience.  Maybe she needs management training, customer service training, among other trainings.

name: Michael Montgomery (Jokertech)
text:
Scammer selling you lower weights than you paid for and rude management staff. If you are sold something at a certain weight you expect to get the weight  you paid for.

Absolutely horrible first and sadly last experience to Decatur's new seafood joint. I ordered a fried basket for myself and my daughter; and a lb of King Crab Legs for my wife.

The King Crab Legs are sold by the lb for $45 at the time of this writing. Though the food looked good we were really disappointed that for $45 dollars she only received 2 legs so we decided to weigh it. The total weight 0.6lbs, closer to half what we actually paid for.

We called the restaurant to discuss with them the situation and was passed along to a manager who showed no concern for our situation essentially saying we were lying and told me to provide photo evidence of the discrepancy. Thankfully we had taken a picture of it on the scale and provided the photo. They responded with a completely different picture of a scale from their kitchen of a crab weight they had just weighed? How does this make sense as a defense of giving us less than we paid for?

Ultimately even after they said they had spoken to the owner of The Moody Crab they decided to go with the line that "a lb of crab legs is 2 pieces regardless of weight" and that is what they sold me.

name: Marvin Ramsey
text: We enjoyed the experience. My mom recommended your establishment since it was her birthday. A group of patrons who were visiting from out of town even sang to her. Nice.

text:
Great service

snow crabs were perfectly cooked and were not too salty
Avocado lobster dish was just ok
Overall bb

name: The Watkins World
text: My husband and I decided to try Moody Crab out this evening for dinner. (we like to give new places time to work out the kinks first before going) We arrived approximately 5:50. We were greeted with a smile asked to wait just a minute, the young lady came back and proceeded to take us with menu's to our table. We waited several minutes before our server came over. I would guess 7-10 minutes. Our server came and greeted us we then ordered our drinks and an appetizer. We sat and waited, and while we waited for our drinks we watched how tables were cleaned and others received refills and their food. We continued to wait. Then here comes our server with our appetizer. Still no drinks. She then comes back to drop off ranch that was for the wings we ordered as our appetizer. Still no drinks. A table was sat next to us our server greeted them and proceeded to get their drinks. Once we seen they received their drinks before us we got up to leave. I did ask to speak with a manager I made her aware of the situation and our 1st time experience. She only said she was sorry and hopes we will give them another chance. Your chance was NOW! You could have easily taken care of us from that point. But you let us leave hungry and unsatisfied. Unacceptable

text: Best drawn butter I have ever had whatever you get get the money special seasoning it is so good  no liquor on site yet  they said 2 weeks the bar would be open

name: Gene Boshell
text:
Food: Delectable
Service: Detestable

I was there before the dinner rush; the service shouldn't have been that bad.

*** Management did discount our bill acceptably***

name: Kayla Tillman
text: Great food, great ppl to be around. Had a blast 😜 only thing was missing is the beer, but it's coming soon!

name: Ken Thompson
text:
I ate there for lunch - it was not crowded and service was OK.

I thought the food was great. I had the shrimp and sausage bag with hot cajun sauce. It certainly seemed to me that I received the amount specified on the menu. I really enjoyed being able to get a spicy sauce that really was spicy (so many places advertise spicy and don't produce it). The only regret I had was that the bag only contained one piece of corn - it was the best corn on the cob I've ever had in a restaurant, next time I'll get an additional side order of it. My wife ordered the fried shrimp basket - it contained only 6 shrimp but they were large ones so she was pleased also.

Just a word of advice. Do not dress in anything you don't want stained. Trying to peel shrimp and not get sauce splattered on you isn't easy. But overall considering food and the price, I think this might be the best restaurant in town. I plan to return often and hope my initial impressions hold up.

name: JD Thorne
text: Excellent seafood. I really liked the lobster mac & cheese. The combo meals have a very nice garlic butter that adds a great flavor.

name: Crowned
text: Been here twice since opening! Staff has improved, the food has remained amazing through and through, and the prices are relatively cheap for fresh seafood so far away from the gulf!!!! Honestly I'm very impressed. The atmosphere of the place really takes you away and makes you feel like your shore side! Nothing but compliments for here, it is 5star worthy!

name: Catherine Cosper
text: Service was awesome they kept or stuff up made sure we didn't need anything else frequently. Now the food was even better it was more no than any other place and still got a lot of food and some awesome flavor I will be back real soon. This is my new seafood spot. The other person I came with got chicken tenders and he said they was fresh food came out hot and fresh keep up the wonderful work. Our host was great she was friendly and always had a smile on her face

name: Cocilla Hubbard
text: Good food, but order never right always something missing or when you say what you don’t want in your seafood boil bag. I understand it just opened but getting the order right is very important and it cost to much to be messing it up. You order online or over the phone it’s still a long wait then once you get it, it’s not what you ordered. You can order 2 pounds of shrimp and still get one small cup of garlic butter come on now MOODY!! I’m gone have to start driving all the way back to Huntsville for Juicy Crab!!!

text: The food was good but over priced. Service was excellent but the Cooks do not speak English so no special questions for the kitchen. I have a real problem eating a pricy meal with cheep plastic forks. The crayfish are too off tasting bull all in all the food was good. There is still room for improvement.

text: Service was horrible out of the gate. We walked in and hostess had to ask the waitress if she wanted a table of two. Her response was “sure I guess”. No refills offered on drinks and she was never around to ask. 20 min wait on the food then a 10 min wait to get the sauce that didn’t come out with the food that we ordered. Food was good but not great. Shrimp was over cooked in the boil bag making it hard to peel sometimes. I asked for a to go box and got it promptly but then didn’t see her again for 15 minutes. She then come over with my ticket and said she would be back to get it, I took no chances I threw my card in there and handed it back to her…. 10 min later she came back! I will try it again and hope for a better experience!

The waitress we got was not very attentive and was chatting with co workers at the bar instead of checking on us. There is nothing more frustrating than having to chase down your server. The food was decent.. but we have had better seafood. The shrimp and sausage was overcooked. We were willing to give it a chance but we’re disappointed. hopefully things will improve.

text: Really excited about this new restaurant...  Well the food was fresh and pretty good.  Service was awful and it took over half an hour to get our food.  They don't seem terribly shorthanded in the front, but maybe are in the back.  We will try again after some time to get settled in.

name: Ashtynn Lamp
text: Our area needed a new hero! Thank You Moody Crab! Lunch Specials were an amazing deal and the food was the best seafood I've had in years! Service was great even with the areas staffing shortages. No complaints! Will be making a few return trips!

name: Kate Terry
text: Corey was our waitress. She gave exceptional service!! My husband and I got the “choose your own steamer” with shrimp, crawfish, snow crab, and sausage (with corn, potatoes and added eggs) and got it with the Moody Special Seasoning - Mild. We’re big boiled seafood fans and would say it’s better than Pier 88 in Huntsville. This spot is a MUST TRY!

name: Charles Lamp
text: This is just the place we needed in this area.. the Shrimp, crayfish, and sausage were outstanding. The Moody Sauce is a must try. I am 100% satisfied with the food and the services provided. Thank You!

name: Brooke Lindsey
text: The food was not only good, but different from other restaurants in the area. I absolutely loved the ability to customize my boil 100% (meat, which seasoning, and spice level). They were out of blue crab when we got there (which was disappointing). The kids chicken nuggets, fries, and apple juice was nothing special. Being new they were busy and ran out of clean crab crackers (getting into my crab legs was a challenge) and sweet tea. Overall enjoyed eating the food, few problems that I don't think will always happen.  As for price I would say it can vary, which I like. If you want to keep it on the cheaper side you can, if you want to go all out you can.

name: Holley Padilla
text: This place is the most awesome service is great the food is most excellent best I've ate yet in the USA it's a great seafood restaurant so if your in the area and you want the best seafood come on over and enjoy dine in great atmosphere. Great sweet tea.

name: Nanci Greene
text: Great service and food

name: Tish Hazel
text: We were seated immediately, which was nice, however we noticed there we lots of full tables but no food on there tables.  This was our first time so we did not know the menu.  My husband and I eat only keto and carnivore.   There are no options  at all to eat this way.  After speaking to the waiter asking for suggestions, we found out there was nothing we could order.  We decided to leave. 😒

name: Jeannabeanna Stephens
text: Oh my, oh my!! The shrimp basket (6) was absolutely delicious. Yes, service was slow, but everywhere we've been to eat it's slow. There are not enough staff anywhere. Definitely will be back. Good to have great seafood place in Decatur!!

name: June Bartlett
text: One and only time we'll  eat here. My husband got the entree grilled sea scallops which only had 4 of them, it was a good think he had gotten an extra meal for tomorrow because he had to eat it too.

name: S.R.SKustomTshirts &More
text: Restaurant conditions are horrible every time you walk  in it’s no clean tables , my friend work here & they told me they barely clean the seafood before serving & they have rats & roaches . Would highly recommend for the health department to come & inspect the place . I ate here twice & felt so sick afterwards. I will never go back here & I heard they show favoritism to employees, I would not recommend working here either

resp.text:
We are very sorry that you feel that way and we hope that you give us another chance. Since we have opened the Health Department has came to our store three times and every time we passed and got a high score, also we have contracts with a pest control company and we have never seen any kind of rodents or roaches in any part of the restaurant. I don't know what employee has told you that but our staff here is like a big family here at The Moody Crab! Since Covid it has been hard to hire on anybody because of the economy at this time.

-The Moody Crab

name: Isabella Espe
text: I got different food then I asked for, I told our waitress Amber, she complained the whole time and when she was bringing out my new correct food I saw her spit in it. After that she kicked me in the leg on “accident”. Never will go here again.

name: Shenia Sadler
text: Don't want to give them any stars at all Well I'll agree with most of reviews on here SCAMMERS it was HORRIBLE our service was awful! went with my son and his family for lunch on his birthday they got one of the bags to share I got the catfish basket without the Cajun seasons my catfish wasn't done when she ask if we wanted refills on our drinks she brought me the wrong drink waited 15 min before she brought me the right one and when they brought me another order I didn't get all my catfish and it all had the Cajun seasons on it so still didn't get to eat and now my stomach hurts I guess from the two hush puppies and the few fries I got to eat so I agree they are scammers BIG TIME!

name: jlw
text: I love this place.  It's your style or it isn't.  My wife isn't keen on the messy dining but I love it.  Very good food.

name: Tony T
text: Service was good..Food wasn't prepared well at all....Ordered the Crab legs no meat inside of them....Shrimp to tough to enjoy...NOT a good experience at all...

name: Marshall White
text: This was an awesome treat and the waitress Sequoyah really made our first visit good with awesome service. The food was delicious and the restaurant had a nice ambiance...

name: Felisha Gail
text: We loved it our waitress was amazing stayed on top of our drinks and food. Absolutely no complaints the food was amazing service was excellent can’t wait to bring my parents soon.

name: Jackson Landers
text: Great food pretty good prices, but  the manager amber is really rude and stand offish to the customers as well as the staff,

name: 1 Vic
text: Been twice so far the food is pretty good besides it takes 5 mins to peel one shrimp. Little over cooked in my opinion. But the service here sucks. I mean we made a reservation and sat down immediately but 20 mins later a server came and got our drinks then hour after that we got our food. They wasn’t that busy either as 75% of the seats was open but people was waiting outside to get in. Could be that no one wants to work? Hopefully they get their stuff together we need a good seafood place in Decatur.

name: Kyshell Frierson
text:
My friend and I went there and was told there was a 30 minute wait so we agreed to that, well that 30 turned into over an hour wait. I gave a one star rating because the lady who was “ the hostess “ seated a couple before us.  My friend is white and I’m black, the couple the put in front of was white and to add insult to injury, she claimed that she called our phone to be seated. We sat on those hard log in the lobby that they have to seat waiting customers. She never called us, then told us that we would have to go back on the waiting list. I’ll never eat there and I’m going to tell others not to eat there as well.  I’d rather drive to Huntsville or Birmingham.
Sloppy front service

name: zachery johnson
text: Went to enjoy some good food with friends, service was very slow ,and I tipped accordingly, after reviewing my card activity later on that day, I noticed my waitress had given herself the tip she felt she deserved, tried to contact the business and speak with a manager, never got an answer. Not a good vibe for a new business, hopefully they resolve the issue.

name: Kesha Audacity
text: The food is sooo good!  I tore them crab legs up haha!  I would definitely go back I like that they have a diverse staff!  Very friendly!

name: Billy Johnson
text: The service was great. I had the shrimp and sausage and it was amazing. The Cajun flavor was great. My son loved the chocolate cake.

name: Youngbenjaminmain aka JeDaCrook
text: Food was spicy but I didnt taste the garlic seasoning ..overall it was good

name: Tommy Reynolds
text:
I had been dismayed by the other reviews I'd seen for this establishment.  Since they had opened just a few weeks prior, I waited a bit longer to give them a chance to settle out and get their process kinks ironed out.

Regrettably, this did not happen.

Up front, know their prices are high for this area.  My lunch entre was about $18 before drink and tip.  I'm willing to spend that for high quality but what I was served was akin to a Captain D's drive through after a long ride home.

Maybe I went on a bad day, they certainly seemed short-staffed.  To be fair, this was about 1:30PM so their A-team may have been taking a break.  My waitress was everywhere at once, doing a bang-up and dandy job.  Kudos to her.

I ordered scallops.  My waitress warned me this would be plated as 4 medium-sized scallops and two sticks of asparagus.  Well, gulp, OK; I've eaten at fancier restaurants where they charged you by the amount of food they left off the plate.  I was determined to press on and gave her the go-ahead on the order.

The plate came and had one (1) plastic spoon as the sole tableware item.  Ever try to cut asparagus with a plastic spoon?  I wound up stabbing the stalk and biting off the top as I ate the mouthful.  Yeah, I could have asked for a plastic knife as well, but one must have one's standards, mustn't one?

The scallops were indeed scallops, that was about all I could say about them: not rubber, not raw, just cooked right so yeah, scallops.

Now, with all this meh prelude I can finally get to the sauce served on the scallops.  I have never had anything so heavenly delightful.  It looked to have a 1-beer roux base and something that seemed fizzy as it hit the tongue.  The result is that you got a splash of favor and then the hit-and-run sauce simply disappeared.  It seemed magical.  If they'd sell just the sauce, I'd buy a case.

N.B.: Don't worry, the sauce didn't have any alcohol; a 1-beer roux has been cooked long enough to drink one beer; a 6-beer roux is cooked the time to drink a full six-pack and then through the roux out just to be safe and start again.

Calculating the tip was tricky.  The waitress had performed solidly and came close to offsetting the other problems.  The kitchen staff nailed cooking the scallops, the asparagus, and that nectar sauce.  However I did not want to encourage what I perceived as a poorly thought out restaurant concept.

Then I decided to quit being so much of an engineer and just tacked $3.50 on the bill, then quickly left.

I'll probably go back in a few months because I'd love to help these folks get this venture going.  The city needs a good, solid, really-cooked-here Cajun restaurant, I gar-on-tee, to channel Justin Wilson.  (If you're a teenager and have gotten this far down the review, you've surprised me: good on you.  Now go google Justin.)

tl;dr: good restaurant idea, too expensive for what you get, not everything is fried.

name: jason muse
text: Dont deserve 1 star, after waiting to be seated in an empty restaurant,  we waited 30 minutes and still never got acknowledged we were there. The waitress walked by us at least 20 times and nothing. This one needs to shut down faster than it opened. When I explained to the hostess why we were leaving she just said that waitress was bad.

name: Suzanne Johnson
text: Who serves lobster in the shell to eat with a plastic fork? Server got one order wrong. Served our dinner and said our appetizer would be ready soon. I guess appetizer concept has taken hold yet.

name: H. R. Howard
text:
Met a couple friends for lunch, 1;00, on Sunday 06/13/21.  Service was fine. Shellfish, not so much. Both crawfish & shrimp in my boiled combo were overcooked.  Sausage and potatoes were ok. Corn a little mushy. Flavor was pretty good.
Wife had lobster mac & cheese. In a word, Lame.  Basically was a bowl of average mac & cheese with 1/2 a small, overcooked lobster tail (still in the shell and very difficult to remove) tossed on top. No lobster flavor in the mac.  $18 bowl of meh.
Buddy had the fried sampler. He had no complaints.
They got my money this time, but this time only.

name: Eric McDonald
text: Terrible customer service. The 3 girls standing behind the counter didn't acknowledge for a few minutes because they were too busy on their cell phones. I had a to go order. My food was soggy and unedible. I asked for ranch with my fried pickes and tartar sauce with my food. I only got ranch even though I asked if the tartar sauce was there and was told it was. Will not go back.

name: Janice McClellan
text: Rude manager! Could care less about the customer or service. Take your own food scale with you to make sure they are not ripping you off on their $45 pound of crab legs!!!

name: braxton guthrie
text: Hailey was awesome she's a great and made the experience quick and easy, great food I personally enjoy the moody crab special seasoning. IMHO management is the only thing lacking and that's based of multiple experiences.

name: L Marie
text: Oh man. Service is bad....REALLY bad. Food was OK but for the price, I expect more than ok. Frozen shrimp from Walmart that I steam myself would have tasted just as good but for waayyyy less.

name: Kim McNatt
text: Yummy food the mild boil was just tje right amount of heat for me

name: Nix
text: Great service for how busy they got! The combo meals and options to pick how spicy you're ok with!

name: Jordan Lybrand
text: Food was great...service was HORRIBLE!  They also charged us for an extra drink, chicken tender plate instead of kids meal, and $17 for a plate of plain noodles...said they don’t serve plain noodles so we were paying for the shrimp spaghetti and offered no way to fix it!  Ridiculous!

name: Michael Weeks
text: Good food and service for lunch. Prices were pretty reasonable on the lunch specials menu.

name: Robert Smith
text: Seafood and bar well they have seafood don't know why you get shrimp and fish and they give you catfish oh well I tried it wasn't impressed so I will mark that of my list. Had big hopes for a good seafood place but it's not worth it

name: Jeffrey Wheeler
text: Food was amazing and so was the service. I had the lunch special either shrimp and sausage.... couldn't finish because I was stuffed.

name: Chad McClellan
text: Poor management, quality of food was okay. Portions to price are way off. Expensive compared to other seafood restaurants.

name: Victoria Scott
text: Food was okay.  Service was not.  But I think they are still working out the kinks, so I'd be willing to give them a second chance.

name: Joshua Johnson
text: Really good and service was fantastic

name: JohnJ
text: 45 minute wait to get cool food served on paper plates with plastic utensils.

name: Jasper Kyle
text: Food was good but the service was slow.

name: Martina Hamilton
text: Food is GREAT!!!! Best place in this area for seafood….  This place is a must try !!!

name: Djemmox Carrasquel
text: Wish I would give ZERO STARS. Just went in and the manager rudely said there was a wait of 30 minutes and took my name down and number, my family waited patiently and watched as several families who came after us went in ahead of us. Still we figured they had called ahead or had a reservation so we still waited, when we asked after we were the only ones in the waiting area left and more people were going on ahead of us, the very rude women up front and the manager who you can tell hates her job grabbed the paper with the names on there and said the didn’t know what we were talking about and they didn’t have our name on there and if we wanted to give ANOTHER name we would be placed at the end of the line! Needless to say we will not be back. If you require a reservation or are going to pick and choose who is going first this place won’t last long, poor service...

text: Not authentic Cajun food. Awful will not go back. Shrimp was overcooked and crawfish was not good!

name: Barbara Mabrey

name: sam smith
text: Instantly sick after eating.

name: Theresa Groves
text: Great service and good food.

name: Sam P

name: Gary Owens

name: Amelia Rodgers
text: I get so many bad vibes from this place.

name: Barbara Porter

name: James Truffa
text: Good place to eat

name: Greg Mccarty
text: Great seafood

name: Mely Acosta
text: Good 👍

name: Paul Cowan

name: Yuno Yukki
text: Bad

name: Kristi Williams
text: Food is pretty good, but twice visiting this location, we have received the absolute worst service both times.

name: Henry Singleton
text: Must try this spot awesome

name: Kristy Waddell
text: The food was great and my server was also good but I don’t like the fact that they add their own tip into the bill. I had 3 people on my bill and they forced the tip. Food is already high priced as it is but to force me to tip what they thought was fair I don’t appreciate. Won’t be back anytime soon.

text: Customer Service is really nice and organized. Food was delicious and well portioned. The sauce on my seafood had me sucking my fingers it was out right delicious. Trina is trusted with all my seafood needs, I don’t go anywhere else.

text: She gives you your moneys worth and then some. Flavor, always on point. Portions, sometimes more than you can handle and that isn't a bad thing lol. 10/10 and would definitely recommend.

name: Delena Perry
text: Wheeewe where do I start?! The sauces are amazing! Good variety for Spicey lovers to the sweet lemon butter lovers. I can guarantee you she has a sauce you’ll love! Plates don’t close and the prices are affordable! Menu is top notch even if you don’t want the boils, the fried seafoods, burgers and other dishes are also seasoned to perfection! Yea I’m that customer! You ain’t eating good if you haven’t tried it!

name: Andrea Lewis
text: I refuse to eat anyone else’s seafood. She excellent. Plate be overflowing. 1 plate is enough for 2 ppl, but I guarantee that when u get a taste of Trina’s Seafood, u will holla GET CHA OWN.

name: Jessica Perry
text: The portions will have you full and the flavor selection is amazing.

name: Laniece Grayson
text: Great customer service don’t get me started on the food it’s delicious and you get your money worth can never close my plate all the way down but I’m not complaining love Trina seafood

name: Tamalieta Moore
text: Best food in town I must say

name: Keeshia Smiley
text: Great customer service

name: Russell Perrin
text: It was a good, not as good as it should have been for the price that I paid though.

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text: You can't beat the New Orleans Transfer for a traditional Cajun dish or just a good ol' poboy (if opting for the latter, the Louie and Pontchartrain are strongly recommended). No frills -- just consistently outstanding food. Roomy little dining area. Been eating here for many years...I always leave happy.

name: Heather Voss
text: Food is delicious, my husband and I tried it today and everything was well worth the drive from moulton. The service was excellent and the owner was very friendly and even gave a sample of the gumbo to try (though by this time we were so stuffed, we could barely move). It was just as delicious as all the rest and probably the best gumbo I've ever tasted. We will definitely be returning and if u haven't ever seen it and stopped in then u most definitely should. Well done to everyone there.

name: Armus Skinofevil
text: The gumbo is good but the red beans and rice are excellent. Service is great. Decor is nice and clean. This is an excellent family restaurant. My only knock is the prices are a little high. I'll have to eat here every time I'm in the area.

name: Ken Humphries
text: I am a huge fan of this restaurant. The food is always top notch and the service is about the best I have experienced. You can't go wrong!

name: David Mullen
text: Best Cajun food in the area! My family and I have been going here for years. We love Mitch and his restraunt!

name: Brian Rodgers
text: Excellent service. I love eating where I get treated well.

text:
I really don't know why this place isn't packed every day...  I wish I could give it 6 stars!

Seafood Gumbo - perfect!
Red Beans & Rice - perfect!
The Transfer (Muffelatta) - perfect!
The Ponchartrain (Shrimp Po Boy) - perfect!
Bread Pudding w/Bourbon Sauce - OMG perfect!
Praline Pie - perfect!

Good Lord! This is too good!

text: Good food and such nice people. It's kind of hard to spot from the road unless you're looking for it.

Suuuper delicious catfish, slaw and baked beans! I now know where I'll go if I'm ever craving catfish! The service was quick and incredibly friendly, as I would fully expect from a business operated by such a kind person!

text: Great food and great service. Some of the best fish I've ever ate. If you try then out you won't be disappointed

Big disappointment when you order them and then there not there when you get there to pick up.

Will come back again and again!  Will tell everyone, there is no place better to eat in the Eastern Shore!

text: The food was so good. Thank you to the guy who took my order that also took the time to socialize with me and tell me about other types of food to try. Thanks for talking me into the Kroean bowl I ate it all by myself and was purely glutoness miserable afterwards, but it was worth it!!! I will be back.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, it was very nice meeting you. sorry about the gluten, i didnt know.

name: Jasmine
text:
Great food. HORRIBLE staff. I stopped coming for a while because of it, started back and still experience the same rude attitude or lack just general common courtesy from the employee who’s generally at the register. Again great food but service and attitude, is below bare minimum and I won’t patronize with a business that continues to show that they don’t value everyone.

UPDATE: staff calls (2x) after seeing review (not to apologize) to tell me in so few words tells that he in fact does treat me the way he does because “my mother and I always have orders that are too complicated for him and should do it the way he says”. MY MOTHER is deceased and has never eaten here & not even buried here and I just moved here a few months ago. So he admittedly treated me unkindly (when I’m nothing but polite because that’s how I want to be treated) because i obviously share the same skin tone/resemblance as another customer.

name: Alfreda Jeffords
text: Awesome little place to grab a quick bite. They also have boba tea thats fantastic.

resp.text: Yes we have great boba tea , lots of different flavors and thank you very much Alfreda for the review.

name: Charity Parazine-Moncada
text: Amazing food! Fresh, beautiful and absolutely delicious! We had the Korean Beef bowl and terriaki shrimp bowl (both with fried rice), krab wontons and the milk tea, all of which were amazing! I just wish this restaurant was in Pensacola, so that, we could eat there often! Don't let the shopping center vibe scare your away because you will be missing hard-to-find, amazing, fresh, beautiful food!!!

name: Austin Sena
text: Fast, delicious, with lots of options! Boba tea is excellent as well with variable sugar amount options

resp.text: Thanks for your 5star. greatly appreciated looking foward to seeing you again!

text: I stopped by there for the first time today and got a chicken teriyaki bowl.. Super fresh made to order, i ate every bite of it. I will be going back for sure. 👍

text: Had a friend recommended this place and wow I am sure glad we stopped in ! Definitely on the “list” now . The food was extremely fresh. I would HIGHLY recommend to anyone in the area. From the Poke bowls to the kitchen menu items everything was absolutely delicious.

resp.text: Sorry for the late reply. Thank you sooooo much for supporting us!

name: Blake Bishop
text: Loved it so much. New favorite place. Will be there a few times a week from now on

name: Tara
text: I LOVE this place. The build your own bowl has so many options and their poke sauce is amazing. Serving sizes are generous and the staff is so nice. Food is always so fresh and delicious!  I like that you can order ahead on their website when in a rush too. I still need to try their Boba teas but so excited they have them here now!

resp.text: Thanks Tara, your reviews is greatly appreciate and yes please try our boba tea its for sure authentic!

name: Jill Arnold
text: The food was amazing.  However, this was my first time there and had questions about different things.  The girl up front was nice but  didn't quite answer my questions.  The man who I assume is the manager or owner didn't speak or acknowledge that i was there and I was the only customer.  I tried the Boba tea.  It was good but would have been nice to have been spoken to.

resp.text: Im so sorry about that, i will make sure u feel welcome next time you visit and thank you for the review.

name: Angela Rivera Salicrup
text: After an 8 hour drive with issues this place was perfection!! The food was fresh and delicious. The staff was very helpful, patient and we're very protective of keeping everything sanitary. The Thai tea was on point. Love it! Great first meal in Alabama.

resp.text: Thanks Angela for leaving us a 5star! Glad we made you happy and rollllll tide!

name: Lovely Pink
text: The boba and the bowl were really good!!! Definitely a must try

name: sheshe berdos
text: Delicious poke bowls... especially The Salmon Lovers poke bowl.  They make the Boba teas RIGHT!!!!  And the egg rolls are the best.... very similar to Filipino egg rolls (Lumpia).  2 thumbs up!  Definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review!  You gotta do it the right way!

name: Andrea Dickey
text: The most authentic "bubble" or "boba" milk tea you can get. Egg rolls are amazing. Pricing is very fair. Excellent and friendly staff. I highly recommend eating here.

resp.text: I would give you a 10 Star for your review!! Thank you so much Andrea. We now have jasmine green tea also made in taiwan, come check it out sometime.

name: Lindsea Bishop
text: Gained 5lbs and lost all my money. AND I'D DO IT AGAIN 😤😩❤

name: Marella Porter
text: Tried this place for the first time today! I got the Salmon Lover poke bowl. It was incredible! So much flavor and “topping” variety! It all went so well together and the entire bowl was so flavorful! I underestimated the size of the bowl too! It will definitely keep you full! However, I was not so impressed with the Milk Tea/Boba. I got Thai tea and boba, both had somewhat of a “sour” taste. Overall I would visit again! Food was excellent.

resp.text: Sorry for the late reply, and sorry you didnt like the milk tea. thank you for the review very very much!

name: Forrest Koppersmith
text: Love this place! Great bowls and hibachi. Quick service awesome staff!

resp.text: Thanks buddy! greatly

text: Food is pretty good, but I called in a to go order wasn't even prepared until I arrived.

resp.text: Im sorry you had to wait for your food. Our establishment is base on a fresh food or cook after you order system. We serve the same quality food you get at a dine in restaurant.(we dont pre-make anything) So for the same quality food at a more budget price we have to cut labor and add to the food cost. So with less labor sometimes its overwhelming when mutiple orders come in. Hope you understand, and again we dont want anyone to wait.

name: brian denton
text: Always great. So fresh.

resp.text: Thanks for the five star!

name: Crystal Clemmons

resp.text: Thank you guys very much!
