text: This place have really good bubble tea and lots of flavor 😋

resp.text: Thanks for the five star.

name: Maysun Marino
text: Great place to eat for authentic poke bowls! Immaculate staff and customer service. 10/10 would eat there again

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great support.

name: Doug McNutt
text: Very fantastic. Extremely fresh tuna and salmon that is not stringy at all (the cardinal sin for Poke joints!). After that everything flows very smoothly. Create your own bowl and they do have the carb-free salad option as a base which is very nice.

resp.text: Thank you, we are looking forward your next visit!

name: Frank Fletcher
text: DELICIOUS! I did a make your own poke bowl and it was absolutely loaded with fresh tuna  and salmons. All the other ingredients were fresh and plentiful including avocado, pineapple, cilantro, edamame, crab meat salad, seaweed salad, etc! I didn't try the teriyaki yet but a couple of coworkers did and it looked delicious as well.

resp.text: Thank you! Try the Teriyaki, you will love it ,too

name: Brendan Abel
text: Great love this place, Try the bubble tea. Chen will set you up right

resp.text: Thank you for the support Brendan!

resp.text: Thank you very much Carey. I notice you came back the following day, that means greatly to us!

resp.text: Thank you, Will! Serving the healthy food is our goal, we are so glad you enjoyed the food here.

name: Sockmnky
text: The food is fine, little expensive for what you get, but it was worth trying.

resp.text: We are looking forward to serve you again!

Terrible customer service and an even worse sense of urgency from a fast food place.

text: Came for a spicy chicken sandwich at noon. Asked for one with No pickles. Cashier said they couldn't do that because they already had them made with pickles and they weren't making any more right now. Then proceeded to give me a cold sandwich with pickles.  Worst experience I've had with Popeyes OR AAFES.

text: A couple of the employees there have terrible attitudes. My wife and I are regulars and we usually use a deal from the app. These 2 employees in particular give us attitude for using it because their system apparently doesn't allow them to just put in the codes from the deals. Well one day my wife and I go there and they immediately start saying to one another "Aw no, you'll have to take them. I can't deal with them." Not even trying to make sure we didn't hear them or anything. They have no sense of customer service and always act like they hate their jobs.

name: Wayne Chai
text: The server was very attentive and the take out experience was good. Ordered Shrimp Poboy and Fried Okra on the go. The poboy's french bread was excellent; slight toasted for the crusty texture, however the fried shrimp was tad under-cooked inside along with bland sauce. The fried okra was so so. It had the fried crispiness on the outside but the okra itself was too soggy. It tasted like mini soaked up sponge with crispy fried breading. I didn't try the buffet but it sure looked good, will definitely try it next time. This is a go to restaurant if you're looking for some fast, cheap and asian food.

text: The management is rude and unprofessional. I worked here for several months and had very inappropriate and rude things said to me by my employer. I finally left after never receiving pay even if I didn't make at least minimum wage from tips. I finally finished schooling and got offered my permanent job. The only thing holding me back from starting is the fact the owner/manager will not talk to the department to verify my employment. I will never recommend this place to anyone; the food is not worth the management's attitudes.

Our bill was 75.06 added a $5 tip to the car for the server looked at our statement the next morning we were charged 91.06 from the restaurant and they said it wasn't there problem that it was our card I talk to the bank they said it was from the restaurant will never go back to this place !! Do not recommend this is not even close to authentic Louisiana food by no means

text:
Food was very tasty.  All three in my party enjoyed their meals.
The time to get the food was a little long.  But would rather have slow, good food than fast, bad food!
Service was GREAT.   Everyone, everyone was smiling and friendly.  Everything we asked for was attended to promptly.
Only downside was the music.   Not my kind of music.  But I went there to eat, not dance.  Music was NOT too loud.
Would go back in a heartbeat!

The only reason it’s not 5 stars is due to the service, the servers don’t seem to have a good system in place for greeting and seating and their attitude left a lot to be desired. Not the worst service I’ve ever had but far from the best. However, the food, atmosphere, and prices are unbeatable. Do yourself a favor and stop by.

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

I will definitely be visiting frequently

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

text: Crab Du Jour is a great place for seafood of all types!  My wife & I have had King Crab Legs, fried fish, shrimp, oysters & the fried calamari.  Their food beats any other seafood restaurant that we’ve visited hands down!  The booths & tables are cleaned well & restrooms are also clean. We always feel welcomed here!  The only thing that we dislike a little is that the hip hop music is sometimes too loud.

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

text: My daughter and I have tried several places with seafood boils throughout the AL and GA area and we must say this is top 2 on our list of many! This is the first place we did not have to peel the shrimp so that was definitely a PLUS for us and the shrimp were deveined (yes some places don’t have that sadly). We had the Du Jour special mild seasoning and it was so good!! Other places seem to just throw the food in some liquid with minimal to no seasoning but this was perfect! The price is right, not as high as some places but to me you get more of your money’s worth and it’s in a good location in the Galleria. They were fast and the customer service was awesome. We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

name: Brittany Burney
text:
If I could leave less than 1 star I definitely would. This was the worst seafood I have ever had. We got a boil bag and there was so much butter that the seasoning wouldn’t even stick to the food and you couldn’t taste the seasoning. We ordered a Cajun spicy boil bag and all you could taste was butter and garlic. No Cajun in sight. I also ordered a separate order of corn and potatoes and had mild du jour sauce on it and it was corn and potatoes floating in butter with wet seasoning sitting on the top. We had the fried fish basket and it was okay compared to the rest of the food, but definitely not the best. We spent $80 on a bag of butter. I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
However, I would give our server 5 stars. Her name was either Dez or Dee I believe. I’m not 100 percent sure. But she was a delight!

resp.text: We will pay attention to your comments, thank you

name: David Hand
text:
Hey guys , I have never in my life wrote the company about how we was treated tonight. First our food was delicious.  We ordered the all you can eat catfish. Our server name was Clint.

Ok first we got our order in and the food was delivered at a pretty good time. After that we got no more service. My 11 year old son after 30 min waiting had to go to the bar to ask for more tea. I ran out of water and was never asked for a refill. We finished our two pieces of fish and waited 35 min and we was never offered any more fish. When Clint finally brought the ticket, I asked him "why was we never ask for more fish" his answer was we are out of fish. So I ask what could he do toward the price since we was not serverd what we came to eat. That was the All you can eat. He said they was nothing.  Please have a Manger contact me. Like I said I have never complain about nothing . Just thought the owners should know. But I saw people after people walk out tonight never being served.

Have a Blessed day,
David

name: David Cocherell
text: Happy hour was pretty good until the checks came. Apparently not everyone was on the same page. When I called the day before it was all alcohol drinks and apps half price from 330 to 7. They were out of the two beers that we ordered and After reviewing the checks the beers were $1 off. Not a big deal, just frustrating after verifying the day before and when we arrived.

name: Besther Dubose
text: LOVE Jesse's!!!  Went there two weeks ago. Chuck cooks the best Delmonico Steak in the universe. And the service was great. Can't wait to go back.

name: Louise Czapala
text: Service was good, but disappointed with the food.  Ordered the cod plate and fish pieces were extremely thin and dry. Only one small piece was actually juicy enough to enjoy.  Truthfully have had better at Captain D's!  6-8 pieces of accompanying asparagus were tasty, but not as big around as a pencil. This visit was on Friday, September 4.  Had much better experience on previous visit. However, due to recent experience & after taking note of some other reviews, it seems management may not take customer complaints too seriously.  Several friends & I will not be returning!

name: abby stiff
text: Went to eat there the other night. It took a few minutes to get out drinks. Service was prompt and food was great. Then desert came out. I ordered a slice of chocolate cheesecake and after taking a bite I noticed something green on the side of it. It was mold. Once I got the servers attention she was way more apologetic than the manager was. Our meal should have been compted in total, but the manager felt taking the desert off was good enough. I do not recommended this place. I will not be going back. The manager stood behind the out server as our server clearly cared more and understood that food was brought out with MOLD on it. If I could give it negative stars I would. So disappointed.

name: J T
text: The best kept secret in Hoover. I really enjoy this place. From the appetisers to the deserts, everything is top notch and they have options for most every palate or dietary preference. My favorites are the nachos, French onion soup, the French dip sandwich, the Jesse's special and the prime rib. They have specials all week like happy hour and ladies night.. They also run a lot of specials during football season. Great proximity to the movie theater, an excellent compliment to a movie for date night. Seriously, give this place a try. It is excellent.

name: Kenneth Wallace
text: Took my sister in law there for a drink and birthday dessert. Absolutely loved it. Very nice restaurant.  Our server Brett made our first experience there a wonderful night. I recommend you try it out and ask for him...BRETT.

name: Holly ballish
text: It was my anniversary and I wish they offered some sort of thing for celebrations. Which is fine that they didn't because we still chose to eat there, but our waiter was very rude. He would ask us if we needed anything but never stopped walking so it was very hard to talk to him. I was upset that he didn't even seem that busy and treated us like we didn't matter. If I went out all the time I guess this wouldn't have been as bad as I am making it but we have a baby and don't get very much time alone and I was really looking forward to this dinner and it wasn't great nor was it even good.

name: Derma Laser Clinic
text: Great steaks and seafood!  The building inside is beautiful and the entrees are really unique to Birmingham.  We loved it!

name: choon heo
text:
Today, we went to this place at 6:00pm.
The bread was cold so, another one was served by our request. Then we ordered a nacho chilli as an appetizer, I was more disappointed on this than on bread because it was wet and tastes like it was reheated from left over. We always had a good experience here and order almost same one every time along with steak. But today after I lost my appetite from my cold bread and messy nacho, I ordered a sandwich and took home. I miss that crispy nacho with cheesy one.

resp.text:
Hi Choon,

I'm sorry you had a bad experience recently.  We try our best to give all of our customers a great experience, though we know we do make mistakes occasionally.  If you're open to it, we'd love to take care of you on your next visit.  If you will reply privately we can arrange something for you.  Email 360businessreviews@gmail.com with contact information or a name and we'll let you know what to do next.  Again, we apologize for the problems you experienced and we'll do our best to make it up to you.  Take care

text: My wife and I had dinner (if you could call it that) at Jesse's in Hoover last evening.  I ordered the mahimahi fish.  First the salad was brought out that look and tasted like it was made the day before, then the fish which was served, ordered Greek style, it tasted like frozen white fish with seasoning sprinkled over it.  What a disappointment!

name: Will Mauz
text: 5 of my friends and I went to eat here October 17th. It was 35 minutes before we got our orders placed, several drunks were arguing at the bar LOUDLY, and that, sadly was not nearly the worst of it. After waiting for our food, now into an hour and a half, (We arrived at 8 :30 pm, our food hit our table after 10:30) we come to find our food had been dropped and was being "remade" When it hit our table, my friends Chip and Sara noticed their steaks were wrong, my shrimp was cold, and my buddy Seamus's burger was prepared incorrectly. After a few minutes, the meal went further south. Chip's steak had a distinct chemical taste to it, like it had been sprayed with oven cleaner. Sarah's had so much grit it was like they just picked it off the floor. Think that could be it? Nope. We began readying to leave at 11:30, only for Sarah and Chip to start puking, and me to have severe bowel discomfort. (I had one bite of her steak to test it, and I'm grateful for only that one.) They were sick until Sunday, vomiting and diarrhea. THIS was a $40 per plate place? THAT'S not even the end. Chip actually CALLED them to talk to the DM, and you know what the Manager told him? We shouldn't have complained about the time they were taking. REALLY GUY? NEVER EAT HERE. Go to Longhorn or somthing, because THESE morons might kill you.

text: I come in pretty regularly and usually get soondae guk. It’s not a dish for everyone, but I’m glad that I can get some without having to go to Korea. The rest of their menu is great too, and their sashimi is awesome. The service is good, and the food is fantastic. It’s a bit pricey, but I always left feeling like I had a great meal. One of my favorite places around town to get some good korean food.

name: Jessie Kong
text:
Great atmosphere--the restaurant was full of oriental decor and our waiter was very accommodating. Our table was equipped with a panel of buttons, conveniently located on the wall, to call for assistance.

The dressing that glazed the salad appetizer was deliciously tangy, though I wish it were a smidge thicker. There was a myriad of course options, and each either met or exceeded expectations.

Shrimp tempura was addictingly crisp. Udong noodles were warm and filling. Sushi was balanced and flavorful. I will definitely revisit this place next time I round Alabama.

(Translated by Google) One line summary: It is clean and delicious, but the composition is disappointing compared to the price of a set meal.
I ate Donghae set meal B.
Sweet Pumpkin Porridge - It's been a while since I ate and I felt it was okay. soft taste
Sashimi - Salmon was okay and flatfish was very good Tuna was disappointing compared to the other two
Sushi + Rolls - The amount of rice was a bit large, but it was delicious. The second most satisfying course among set meals
Tempura (1 prawns, 1 sweet potato, 1 sweet pumpkin) - It was just... ordinary.
Grilled Eel - The eel was very large and delicious. It was a pity that there was only one
Meals (spicy soup, rice, grilled saury or udon, eel sushi) - It was a bit disappointing for the ending...
Sikhye - It was very sweet, but it was delicious.

It seems to be the most private among urban Korean restaurants.
Next time I visit, I will try the representative menu.

name: Joseph Previti
text: I ordered the seafood platter. The mashed potatoes were powdered, the veggies were clearly from a microwave bag, and the fish was chewy. We waited fifteen minutes for our beers. This place is disgusting.

name: Allison Virginia
text:
Food is really good and happy hour beers were a great deal. But the service was simply awful. Our appetizer was clearly left sitting a while. We only got one happy hour beer because it took half an hour to finally get, after which the server made some excuses and we hoped maybe she'd try to step up her game, but alas. She did not. My meal showed up incorrect, but she never came back to check in so I wasn't able to address it. It took the manager noticing me looking around bewildered for our phantom server to get it fixed. Then she finally appeared again and made some more excuses. When she brought the corrected order, she handed it literally over the back of the booth to avoid us, and sent someone else to deliver the check. When she came back for that, she made one last excuse (but never one apology).

Again, great food, and the manager was clearly working hard trying to take care of people all night. Would love to improve my review some day, but right now, I just can't.

resp.text: I'm sorry for that bad experience in service.. I don't believe in making excuses so I will say we will be better for sure..

name: Matthew Isely
text:
The good: The food that was eventually delivered did taste good. Manager is helpful.

The bad: The service. Waited a half hour for beers that never came, ended up having to go to bar ourselves to get beer. In addition our server failed to mention it was happy hour. Our appetizer of fried pickles came without any dipping sauce and was lukewarm after presumably sitting neglected under a heater lamp for a while. The seafood platter that was delivered was incorrect, but our server never bothered to come back to the table to check on us. Took a manager noticing us wondering where our server had disappeared to to get order fixed.

Also our server thought marinara = honey mustard.

Bottom line: Food is good. But good luck getting it delivered. Or fixing any problems. Or any human interaction with your server. Props to the manager.

resp.text: Wow that's not good.. I'm truly sorry for that experience.. Gotta get them to do better..

name: Lawrence Spellens
text:
We opened the restaurant at 3 p.m., the only couple present, just when food staff arrived. Superb, large, fresh raw dozen (13) oysters. The shrimp salad platter was good--but iceberg lettuce was an excessive filler and tomatoes were skimpy. The oysters, however, won the day.
The unusual request for a no-ice cola went unheeded. Translation: ice in the drink. (A restaurant ruse to cut their costs?)

name: Kimberly Riley
text: If I could give 0 stars I would.... I had a party 4 and we waited for 30 minutes for a water and appetizer... it took about an hour and 15 minutes for us to receive our food. As we were about to begin eating they started the live music and turned the lights down for a PRIVATE party. When we asked if the lights could be brought back on slightly and if the music could be turned down slightly we were told she would ask and then she never returned until she brought us our checks. We did not even eat our food in the facility. We all requested to go boxes and proceeded to leave. If there was a PRIVATE party going on the restaurant should of been closed off to others... or been pre warned that it is was taking place and only had one cook on the clock.

resp.text: That's terrible..  I will make it right

name: Becky Baskerville
text: Great atmosphere, great food, great staff! DJ Darryl played everything we requested. Awesome place to dance!

text: Best Oysters in town. Love the variety on Wing Night. Over All good atmosphere.

name: Angelo Andrews
text: Liked the live band. Food was good, but did not like the grits, not smooth enough. My preference.

name: Cameron
text:
Service was awful. We waited 15 minutes for water, the couple at the table next to us mentioned to the managament that we had been waiting for a while (because we weren't going to say anything). Darryl (management) said he'd give us 10% off for the wait. We finally ordered, the food took forever to come out (even the fried pickles appetizer took forever) and the order was wrong. I asked for Darryl's favorite which is fish in their New Orleans cream sauce on a bed of rice. I got fried flounder, with hush puppies and rice on the side and the waitress said "that's how it comes" despite the menu saying different. I thought okay whatever and mentioned that's not what I wanted then she said she could bring the New Orleans sauce on the side. So I said okay that's fine. I ate it, it was fine, fish was cold but the sauce was good. When the bill came she charged me 3.99 for the sauce (even though it should've came on my meal already) and there was no 10% off as Darryl said there would be. By this point I didn't even care and wanted to leave so I paid for it all. When the checks came back the waitress stood there and watched as we added tips. Literally just stood there as we were contemplating what to give.

Overall, terrible experience. Darryl I'm not writing this to be mean but because I think you care about the business and you could use it to help improve. We don't plan on returning and neither does that couple who was sitting next to us.

resp.text: I'm truly sorry.. see me next time I will make it right

name: Susan Johnson
text:
This Captain D’s is located on the Montgomery Hwy in Vestavia. The food is very reasonably priced; they give Senior Discounts, have delicious combos for $4.99 and as a VIP member, you can earn Reward Points with each visit. When the points add up, you receive a free dessert or other perk for being a VIP member.

I just got home from another awesome visit to Captain D’s! Rodrick waited on me in the drive-through and he was so pleasant, knowledgeable, and accommodating that I told him he needed a raise. He explained to me that the VIP membership now was by email rewards. I told him I had received an email reward and was there to get my dessert with my meal. He offered me a drink while I waited. I told him that I would definitely be back to see him!

resp.text: Susan – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Desmond Gray
text: Im sure the people that left good reviews about this place was coached or work there.. Service was slow. Food was undercooked and barely any was on my plate. Literally is the worst Captain D's I have ever been to. Will never return to this location.

resp.text: Desmond - We are sorry to hear that. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details on your experience and someone from guest services will reach out as soon as possible.

text: Green beans and coleslaw are really good but the fish just has way too much breading on it! And the dining room was pretty dirty when we were there...lots of dirty tables. Guy at the counter was very nice .

name: Malin Freeman
text: This location seemed to be WAY understaffed on my visit, especially considering how crazy busy they were. The employees were friendly, even cracking jokes with customers as they did their best to take care of all their customers. The condiments were almost non-existent: the ketchup dispenser was almost empty, the tartar sauce WAS empty, & the other 2 dispensers (cocktail sauce & D's dipping sauce) were jammed & wouldn't budge. There were several booths that looked as though they'd been swept over in between customers, & the bathroom was a bit untidy, but I really think it's likely due to a lack of help (too few workers). The food was great - cooked perfectly & served warm. The drink machine though, was behind the work counter, so when someone wanted a refill, they had to depend on an already busy worker to do it for them.

name: CJRavenFan91
text: The food is pretty decent but NEVER go through the drive way. It is the slowest driveway in the history of driveways. Whoever designed the building needs to be arrested. The problem is when you get to the menu where you order your good. There is exactly about 1 car space from the place where you order, and the window where you get the food. I have never seen a restaurant like this. Usually you order on 1 side of the building then drive around to the other side to get your food at the window. Because of this, the wait time in the drive way is extremely slow because they cook everything fresh. So you order your food, pull up to the window and wait abotu 5-10 minutes but the person behind you has to wait until you get your food before they can order because you are too close. ITS TERRIBLE. So just go inside and order. It's much faster. Food is good and always fresh.

name: Troy Piper
text:
Other Captain D's pale in comparison to this one. The fish was larger, the hushpuppies were freshly fried. They did as good of a job that corporate would let them with a Loaded Baked Potato (I'm sure the bacon and cheese are pre-weighed) The sides were plentiful. I had exactly how much I thought was fair for the price.

This location KILLS the downtown location at 5th Ave. South. They;re very friendly there, but the fish is TINY and they skimp on the sides and sauces.

text: Nice seafood house with fantastic oysters, friendly staff, fast , fresh food & cold beer.

name: Brooke Graham
text: Love this place!  Always get the oyster sampler (pictured) and a side salad with the spicy ranch (best salad dressing ever).  They make their own croutons.  Good happy hour deals too!

name: Lisa Evitts
text: Me and my husband stopped by for dinner as we were passing through as we are not from the area, and some locals recommended Wintzell's. We were greeted the minute we walked in, and seated right away. The waitress was very nice, kept drinks refilled and always asked if we needed anything when she passed. The food was hot, fresh and great. Maybe the decor could use some updating, tables and floors could use a good scrubbing  they seemed a little sticky.

name: Kimberly Christmas
text: Celebrated my birthday there with friends. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Food was good; I had the Shrimp and Grits. I've had better at Connors. Could use some decor updates.

name: Grumpy Kitty
text: Service is terrible!  I've gotten food from here twice and had to wait 30 min both times.  The food here is incredible but get it together people!  The prices are kinda high but they are unique and worth it to me.  Every time I go to Mobile I go to the one there.  I am working in Huntsville, and so happy to see Wintzell's!  We need one in Birmingham.

name: Jacob Chancery
text: I got a dozen raw oysters and a creamy crab soup.  The oysters were only $10.99, so it's worth it to ask what the "market price" is for that day.  I wouldn't pay $21 for a dozen like Blaine did.  The oysters were good, no grit in them.  And the crab soup had plenty of chunks of real crab meat.  I could tell because there were one or two pieces of that thin shell membrane that's almost impossible to dig the meat out of.

name: Sarah Mosley-Webb
text: The best seafood that I have ever eaten. Portions are wonderful and so is the staff. The staff are very knowledgeable.  The restaurant is quant place which I will come back to over and over again.

name: Schyler West
text: Whimsical atmosphere was nice. Food was so so. I had shrimp and grits, which were edible but nothing to write home about. A dozen oysters came to about $15. They were on the small side, so we got a couple more than a dozen.

name: Chuck Miller
text: Just rolled in from the Bay Area, and I wanted a couple beers and a place to watch playoff hockey.  I was staying at the Hampton, and checked Google Maps...low and behold I find this place just behind my motel!  Wintzell's was just what I was looking for;  a nice Sports Bar, and very good service.  I agree with Lee's post on the food, especially those jerky nachos.  I'll be back for more tomorrow!

name: Michael Edwards
text: In town for biz. Against a local's recommendation, went to Wintzell's. First, no local or craft beer. Second, ordered 1/2 doz of grilled oysters. Worst oysters I've every put in my mouth.  Waitress was very nice and insisted I not pay. Left her an appropriate tip for what the oysters cost.

name: Justin Malone
text: Always good food.  The J.O. Platters are a safe bet for first timers, as well as the fried green tomatoes.

name: PJ McPhearson
text: Ate near the one in B'ham. It was great start to,finish. Love the crab claws. Awesome. Nicolette was a great waitress..

name: Michael Tomsik
text: Great fish and chicken basket. Mild on the tartar sauce and cole slaw. Great service.

name: Lee Wood
text: Great lunch menu. Friendly staff. Great food. Carolyn was my server and she rocked.

name: Sara Harris
text:
I'm not one to usually leave a negative review and it takes A LOT to piss me off about anything. However,  mine and my boyfriends experience tonight was worth the bad review. Took 15 minutes just for anyone to take our drink orders, took even longer to get them and the food was a joke.  The cups of gumbo were not the same temperature,  mine was good but my boyfriends was almost cold when he got it. We ordered the broccoli and cheese,  when they brought it to us, it literally had a slice of craft cheese on top (not melted), it looked like something a child tried to put together.  The baked potato was not even on a plate,  just wrapped in aluminum foil and flopped on the table.  The oysters were overcooked and a bit rubbery.
Very disappointed because we don't have many places to eat seafood in Huntsville. Was hoping this place would be the new go to.

name: Barry Allen
text: The food was okay but the three giant cockroaches that joined us at our table were not, I also could have done without the kitchen staff screaming obscenities. The server was great but clearly over-worked and abused by the management. Honestly I'm surprised that place is even still open.

name: Michael Robison
text: Food was great, but the service was horrible. It took 10 minutes to get a beverage, 40 minutes to get an appetizer, and over an hour to get raw oysters and a soup. I had to go to the bar to get a second drink after waiting 30 minutes. I asked to speak to a manager and after waiting 10 more minutes no one came by our table. Needless to say I will not be back.

name: Bob Stell
text: Good seafood. Lots of sports TVs. Prices a little high. Updated. ....restaurant is now closed! !

name: Jeff Estes
text: Good food and service. Casual. A little pricey.

name: Larry Cain
text: Marylin the serve was wonderful and the food exceptional some of the best fish tacos I've had and the oysters were really good as well.   Will eat here next time I'm in Huntsville!

name: Daniel Rivera
text: I was hoping for better. The waiter worked with me to find something healthy, which was a challenge. Spicy streamed oysters should be called death-by-salt oysters. Chilli and mahi where ok.

name: Blaine Simpson
text:
Maybe their fried fare is better, but for people looking for the real deal, they suck.

$21 for 12 whole oysters at lunch time!  That is with no drink, vege,  bread, or anything, and before tax and tip.  Seriously.

6 raw on the half-shell.  Tasted fine, but there were considerable scales of shell mixed in with the oyster in 4 of the 6!  Couldn't have a less competent oyster shucker back in their kitchen.

The 6 "grilled" oysters were over-dressed so that you could taste nothing but the cheese and salt.  Why pay neary $2 per oyster when you can barely taste them?

If raw oysters are important to you, at New China Buffet, about 5 minutes away, you can get a complete meal including all the oysters-on-the-halfshell you want, for about $12 (probably less at lunch time).

Like Tom Petty's runaway train, I'm never going back.

name: Anne Crandall
text:
When on vacation to the gulf, oysters are in order. This place was right near our condo, so we decided to give it a try Sunday, 6/2/13 around 2:30pm. We sat outside on the patio and were waited on by Chris.

Have to be honest, I'm not sure if it's a Southern hospitality thing, but the waitstaff we encountered in Alabama in general was just of very high caliber. Chris was the best of them all.

Before we even sat down, we noticed turtles swimming in the pond and stepped to an empty area of the patio to check them out. He appeared with crackers and asked if we wanted to feed them, and then told us all about them. Super cool way to start a meal.

We ordered 1/2 dz raw oysters and 1/2 dz Bienville, plus a cup of gumbo and some pineapple upside down cake.

Everything was amazing. The raw oysters were rather large, but then again I live in Colorado so large might be the norm. I remarked that they were the largest I've seen, and Chris went on to tell us about the giant ones they get there and seemed very engaged in his job.

The gumbo was fantastic and the pineapple upside down cake was 'extra caramelly' according to our waiter, which was great.

The manager even came over to check on us at one point and we had a really nice conversation about the Bienville vs chargrilled.

Top notch, one of our best meals in Orange Beach to be sure. I would highly recommend, and would certainly go back.

text: This is a Bizzarre place in the middle of a total industrial area. It is very close to coal mines and foundries. The whole parking lot was just littered with rocks. They had fallen out of trucks. It would be helpful to drive a four-wheel-drive vehicle here. I had a shrimp basket with fries and a Pepsi. The shrimp was just fried frozen shrimp, nothing special. The fries had a good seasoning on them. There are bars on the windows. Yes, it’s that kind of place. Many people working in the foundries have left their mark on the catch up bottles. I wish I could’ve tried to say is, but I probably won’t be back. Do you want to try something totally different, this is the place for you.

name: Mark Spurlin
text: LL is a very favorite destination of ours for our annual family beach vacation. Up to two weeks prior we tried booking a table for our larger party and it was declined and so the day of our dinner we arrived twenty minutes prior to open to learn that they could not seat us for two hours due to full reservations and staff shortage causing them to be operating at 70%. I got very frustrated at our attempts failing and the manager kindly and professionally explained to me that they were strained with the demand and lack of staffing. We agreed to wait despite having young children. While waiting they got together and figured out a plan to seat us within just 30 minutes. Once seated the service was professional, food was fresh and delicious, and we were treated like the only ones there. Kudos to this professional establishment for working hard to serve their guest as well as thinking smart on how they can be as successful as possible during these unprecedented times.

text: This is a excellent restaurant with great food and service - but not for folks who frequent Capt D's or Cracker Barrel - it's pricey. We had a friendly  waiter who explained the specials , brought our drinks and never wandered too far. We had a table of 6 and 4 got the "special" grouper that was incredible. I also had the baked oyster appetizer and no, I did not share. This is a really fun place to go with an upscale ambiance , great food and service. We all gave it an A+.

She told us she couldn't do take-out and they were too busy and so we asked to go ahead and eat in and then she said they gave our table away. After all of the back and forth she Finally got us a table but several people in the group felt like why spend money with people who don't want us in their establishment. So we left because it felt wrong, the entire experience. We're black and thats all ill say about that!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

name: Clark Marshall
text: Excellent service! Our waiter treated us very well. All the food options were very tasty. The view was spectacular. Just be prepared to wait for a seat. We used the waitlist option from yelp and planned accordingly. Highly recommend this place. All options were delicious.

name: Aaron Hatter
text: The blackened scallops were Amazing. Make sure you make reservations DAYS in advance.

name: Adam and Kristina Nis Dias
text:
For the venue, the portions were incredibly large--I couldn't eat but half of it.  A couple would more than likely be able to split the larger entrees.

The flavor was out of this world for everything we tried--appetizer, salad, entree and desert.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming--as was the atmosphere.  Classy and comfortable.

Elevator accessible and lots of parking with a boardwalk full of yatchs on the water.

As a local, I will highly recommend this place for anyone visiting.

name: David Markas
text: Great food and service. First time I tried Grouper Fish and it was amazing. Will return soon!

name: Merri Bass
text: Order the "special" fish. An exceptional dish! Service great,too!

name: Mandy Snell
text: Everything was fantastic  !! We got 2 appetizers and shared and then 2 different grouper meals  ! O... did I mention the Voo Doo Punch ?? I want to go back... Staff A+

name: Clark Marshall
text: Excellent service! Our waiter treated us very well. All the food options were very tasty. The view was spectacular. Just be prepared to wait for a seat. We used the waitlist option from yelp and planned accordingly. Highly recommend this place. All options were delicious.

name: deanna lane
text: Food was good but not sure it was worth the price tag.

name: Meredith Harmon
text: Great drinks and food. Chowder is to die for and the service was great too! Great views of the pier and sea lions.

name: jeff and lisa stockstill
text:
We had our annual Christmas party there in 2020,  along with our employees and some great friends.
Food was off the hook, chef Darren was amazing, we will definitely return
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

name: Aaron Hatter
text: The blackened scallops were Amazing. Make sure you make reservations DAYS in advance.

name: Becki Kohl
text: Amazing menu and wonderful service. Genie was a wonderful server that could answer any question and had the best recommendations for food. A festival of culinary delight!

name: Sara Cobb
text: Food is always fabulous and well plated.

name: Merri Bass
text: Order the "special" fish. An exceptional dish! Service great,too!

name: Kristine Brower
text: Had a friend's rehearsal dinner here. Food and drinks were exceptional as well as the service. 5 star first visit for sure. Thank you!

name: David Entrekin
text: Food was wonderful. Wait staff was stellar (one of the best teams I've ever experienced). Nice view of harbor. Main dining area was a little noisy, but that's just an indication of how much people were enjoying themselves. Our company had several grouper dishes. All were perfectly cooked with excellent texture and sweet mild flavor. To me the pecan grouper overpowered the tasty fish, but you can remove the excess topping to suit your individual taste. The grouper almondine was perfection. And my partner raved over the grouper Kevin.

name: Live And Local
text: One of the best tasting top 5 restaurants to dine at in the South. Amazing with a capital 'A'

name: Gia Akram
text: Food, service and ambiance all were fantastic. A must try if you are in the area.

name: Michelle Lindsey
text: We were very excited to try this restaurant!  However it was a less than perfect experience.  All the reviews talked about the attentive staff.  We did not find this true, we barely saw our waitress at all (delivered our drinks, delivered the food, and brought the check).  My boyfriends grouper had a 4 inch piece of plastic in it, she had no explanation nor concern (at least send manager over) My steak was under cooked (but never saw her to ask for correction). On a good note the bartender was great.  Probably would not revisit.  We found other places that had better service and more concern for food preparation.

name: Jerry James
text: Great food and well trained staff I only wish they would open up their outdoor patio

name: Josh Vanhuizen
text: Amazing food and the staff was awesome as well!

name: Daniel Ward
text: Got riblets. I dont even know what they are! Each one had a tiny flat bone. It was gross, but I like quality food, this was in a pinch.

name: Jason Z Guest
text: Always a favorite but high-fives to Chase F behind that bar who set me up with an asap order to go for blue crab sauté crab claws. Just had a can-do attitude and got it done. Excellent service. Thanks y’all!

name: David B. Peel (Peel Law Firm)
text: Wonderful evening. Food was great. Service was superb. Jambalaya was amazing.  Bisque is awesome. Gumbo was good if a tad over browned. Very enjoyable night. Nice place with good view of marina. Reservations recommended.

name: Martin Davis
text: I really expected (and hoped) this place to better than it actually was.  Ambiance and location are nice.  I had the Grouper Luisianne and wife had Shrimp Étouffée with  Lobster Tail.  My dish was mediocre.   The cut of fish was thin and served in small pieces.  The lump crab meat was not very tasteful.  The twice baked potato was very good.  Wife's dish was ok, but we have both had better for way less money.  This place is not inexpensive.  Service was ok, just ok.  We would not recommend this restuarant given the expense level.  I don't mind paying $100 for a meal, but I do expect it to be memorable at that level.

name: Morrelle McCrary
text: Exceeded all my expectations. Hidden off the beaten path but so worth it. Food and service was amazing and I will be back when I vacation next year. It was a little chilly so bring a sweater or light jacket if you are cold natured.

name: Leah Slaughter
text: We had the most amazing meal here tonight. Staff was incredible and the most attentive I’ve seen. View is awesome especially at night. Seriously cannot say enough positive about this place.

name: Em Saunier
text: Wonderful service and EXCELLENT food! Cannot go wrong here!

name: Jason Auld
text: absolutely amazing food you have to try the grouper papilotte. Beware it's quite expensive we were caught by surprise. Plates run about 30 dollars.

name: Travis Williamson
text: Outstanding! If you want fine dining and an over the top experience this is it!! You will not be disappointed. Had the blackened grouper, crab cakes and bayou grouper, excellent!!

name: julie gill
text: The food was amazing and the location is right by the harbor where you can see all of the boats. I had the lobster tails and twice baked potato and it was great!!

name: Mandy Snell
text: Everything was fantastic  !! We got 2 appetizers and shared and then 2 different grouper meals  ! O... did I mention the Voo Doo Punch ?? I want to go back... Staff A+

name: Stephen Taylor
text: Very nice place and excellent service.  Overall great experience and food was amazing.  This was my first time and will be returning.

name: Michael Brame
text: Didn't eat at LL.  But ate twice downstairs at Fresh Off the boat which uses the same staff and kitchen.  And it WAS fresh off the boat outside and fantastick.  Trigger fish tacos, 3 cheese grits, homemade pickled veggies.  Oh!  And a poutine that will knock your socks off.  Try this place.

name: Devin Anderson
text: Great food, excellent service!

name: Ayanna Thomas
text:
I went to this restaurant during a conference because it was highly recommended. The customer service was absolutely superb and the wait was not long. Our server gave recommendations on customer favorites as well as his own. I had the shrimp
and grits which did not disappoint because the shrimp was seasoned well and the grits were creamy. My colleague shared a piece of her grouper almondine dish which was good in taste as well. I’ll definitely be back when I’m in the area again.

name: Stewart Stewart
text:
Food was excellent atmosphere and customer service is really nice you can watch the Yachts come  in to Marina from your seat
the sunset there very nice place

name: Georgia Chestnut
text: The food was superb with excellent service, always a treat The BEST seafood in Orange Beach !!!

name: TJ Amadore
text: Delicious! I have been twice now. First time during busy season in the summer. Crowded but very good food. Second time was in November. Very good food and my wife and I had the whole restaurant to ourselves. Very nice and romantic.

name: Kay Oakley
text: Amazing! Sherri was our server along with support by Jonah and they were amazing, too! Definitely a place to eat while in this area.

name: Gary Piston
text: One of the best meals I have ever had and the service was exceptional. Highly recommend

name: Michelle Schmitt
text: The food and service were excellent! Waiter suggested a great wine 🍷 and the Cajun orange roughy was superb!

name: Yianni Ellis
text: It was ok. We came expecting white table cloth fine dining experience and we were disappointed. My wife and i both had grouper dishes. The blackened grouper was over seasoned and had too much cheese sauce. She had the bayou and the sauce was too much. Twice baked potato was cafeteria-esque. My voodoo drink was good. Hush puppies were awesome!  Bread pudding was very tasty. Wait aytag was very friendly and helpful. Over priced to recommend going again. I've had better dishes in perdido.

name: Andrew White
text: Pricey but worth it. Bisque soup is great as an app

name: Brenda Alleman
text: I arrived at 5:00 pm last night. The first to sit at the bar since I was alone! I have never in all my life been so disrespected! I was ignored for service, approached the manager letting her know everyone else after me was served! Obviously she saw me! Another lady foreign speaking approached me saying that they don’t wait on people that’s on their phone! I ordered my drink, then I thought  how disrespectful!!! I said I don’t want my drink. I will be going elsewhere for better service. I then went to Ole Francois Italian restaurant where I was treated like a princess! I told them my story! The owner was just dumbfounded how I was treated as a paying customer!!

name: Barbara O'Keefe
text: Delicious food and great people! This restaurant also has a great view overlooking the water.

name: G Calahan
text: The fish here is outstanding!  It’s always great!  You will not be disappointed!

name: George Sirmon
text: Fantastic food and service! Loved our server, Laura and the seafood was excellent  and the desserts also!!! The soft shell crab was to die for! So was the Key lime pie!!!

name: Patrick Simmons
text: Thoroughly disappointed in the quality of the food here. While the service was very good, the food was subpar to say the least. First, the stuffed mushroom appetizer that was quite clearly microwaved, mushy and not fresh. I ordered the grouper ponchartrain, a $40 dish, that was abysmal. Rubbery grouper, with a microwaved mashed potato, some canned corn/tomato mixture, and a soft shell crab that didn’t deserve to die for this dish. Not one thing was fresh. Red Lobster is fresher than this.

name: Stephen Como
text: A wonderful dining experience. The staff were very pleasant, ambiance was relaxing/pleasing, white table cloths,staff wore tuxedo shirts, food was amazing. It is a more upscale restaurant though dress was casual , if you want, it is a beach town. For dining I would suggest the fireplace room or a nice view at a window. Being seated in the inner dining area has a more crowded, dining hall feel. There also is outdoor seating on the decks with wonderful views.

name: Michael Daniels
text: Great seafood and wine!

name: Lance Eskridge
text: Great food w/ excellent views of the Marina. AJ and Ian were great hosts. You can tell that the entire wait staff is well trained from entrance to exit, you are treated like family. This is an upscale restaurant w/ the good beach vibe. Excellent drinks coming from the bar. We were fortunate to meet GM, Brett Dickey tonight. He was very supportive of his staff, while letting them do their jobs. Good portion size and value for the $$ for sure. Highly recommend a visit.

name: Anita Kupcho
text: Best seafood ever!!!  The shrimp and grits were amazing!

name: Georgia Day
text: I took a friend out here to celebrate her birthday while we were visiting from out of town and this place did not disappoint! Our waiter (Mike Crawford) was attentive, friendly, and helpful in differentiating the various amazing sauces. We tried the Eggplant Orleans, Bayou Grouper, and Blackened Grouper and they were all absolutely divine!! Dessert was bread pudding with a pecan topping and fruit mixed in to the bread! Can't stop talking about how delicious everything was!

name: Jack Rodrigues
text: Loved the place everything was great except the brussel sprouts were over cooked.

name: Mark Soublet
text: Pretty good. Good cajun flare. No catfish, tho. The bar is really nice and laid out.  This was during COVID-19 so we sat at the bar. We were the only ones there. Staff was really friendly. Manager was there. Sat at the bar with us whilenhe was making menus or something like that. Food is good. I would go again. And I recommended it.

name: Kim Anderson
text: We love Louisiana Lagniappe!  Great food and great service.  We always have dinner there when we visit Orange Beach.

name: Michael Raggio
text: Families food!  Some of the best on the cost.  We eat here at least once every time we make it to the beach.  Highly recommend!

name: Ari McCrary
text:
soo good, i got their fettuccine and it was so
yummy, it was a bit chilly so i would suggest bringing a sweater but otherwise it was amazing, great service, great food, great atmosphere, i will definitely be going back, and recommending to others.

name: Kristine Brower
text: Had a friend's rehearsal dinner here. Food and drinks were exceptional as well as the service. 5 star first visit for sure. Thank you!

name: Thomas Lanan
text: We went for the wine tasting and everything was very good. I had the fried shrimp and my wife had the fried oysters . I'm not a wine person, but enjoyed the Yuengling. Very good food, but bring your wallet.

name: Bill Stone
text: Good. Dinners for two a deal. Calamari needs worked. All batter. Should be light and crispy

name: Lauren Stevens
text: This place was recommended by some locals and it did not disappoint. We made a reservation and added a brief comment that it would be nice to have a table with a beautiful. We got just that. It was a nice romantic date and the food was amazing.

name: Tom Torgersen
text: Great food and service!

name: Nicole Danes
text: This place was very accommodating for our large group of friends on our vacation! Food was excellent & also the service was phenomenal! We will be back! Thank you!

name: George Astin
text: Stellar brunch. Good food great service. Unique menu. As the name says- lagniappe- a little extra something.

name: Ericka Gayle
text: Excellent place to celebrate a birthday! Seafood was fresh and prepared nicely. Nice ambiance..not stuffy at all.

name: Rick Hogue
text: Never had a bad meal here in many years. For what you get, the prices are reasonable.  The food is great. Place is a little high end but never disappoints.

name: Emery Mcnulty
text: I visited this lovely place again May 9, 2019. As always, it is a treat and I visit here every time I'm in the gulf. The atmosphere is relaxing, especially if you get seated by a window and can gaze upon the yachts while dining. The food is unmatched and never disappoints. I recommend the pecan grouper, which is excellent. The service is top notch. Our waiter was Nigel this time and he was very friendly, knowledgeable & entertaining. Cant' wait to return in 3 months!

name: James Kelley
text: Delicious seafood

name: Douglas Ennis
text: Excellent all around.  Many preparation choices for  grouper.  Anything that has shrimp added will provide you with plenty of gulf shrimp.  Good place for special occasions, groups or just a very nice night out with views over the marina.

name: Pat Garlikov
text: Great, professional service.

name: Aurelio Donato
text: Recently had a very nice dining experience at Louisiana Lagniappe. Matt was our waiter providing good service and a couple spot on recommendations. BBQ shrimp appetizer had great flavor and a bit of a kick. Grouper with crawfish was tasty and my wife's blackened grouper with crabmeat was flavorful.

name: Alex Brown
text: Good food and fun atmosphere. Great drink menu too! We came for a work retreat and really enjoyed it.

name: Steven Allyn
text: Excellent menu. Great food, good service.

name: Brandon Ford
text: Had an amazing time. Went here for a great evening and great food and wasn't disappointed. Definitely on short list to visit when back in town.

name: Duane Chumley
text: We have been to Louisiana Lagniappe several times over the past 3 years  - the food and service have always been exceptional.

name: ROBBIE Massie
text: Best place I have been for brunch in a while. picture perfect

name: akorch3356
text: Awesome customer service! Went here tonight, and the customer service was above and beyond. They were running behind in the kitchen, and ran out of certain items on the menu - so both the server and manager apologized profusely and gave us free desserts and drinks! We had coffee, chocolate cake and their absolutely delicious and in-house made bread pudding! Will definitely be back and highly recommend!

name: meow
text:
Me, my son and my daughter went here for our beach vacation. First thing we noticed is when we got out of the car, shady chefs smoking outside, staring at me and my children.

Me and my daughter got blackened grouper. The same dish. It tasted GREAT! It didn't taste great puking it up from 3-6 am. My daughter was perfectly fine. Won't be coming back.

name: Sara Cobb
text: Food is always fabulous and well plated.

name: Heather smith
text: Our server was Rena. She was great. Efficient,  friendly and knew menu. Food was great and we had a nice window view.

name: Leah Lynn
text: Service was superb. Highly reccomend their brunch on sundays and their eggplant dish.

name: Ruta Qureshi
text: Absolutely delightful. We stopped by after work for a few drinks and ended up ordering food and staying much longer than planned. Extremely comfortable and welcoming bar, friendly staff and the management is amazing. Definitely a great place to go in OBA.  And the bartender makes a mean Long Island Ice Tea!

name: Melinda Wilkerson
text: Delicious food.  Excellent service.  Great atmosphere.  Will return each visit to the coast.

name: Rick Mease
text:
Forget the tourist traps and check this place out! Well worth the price. The service was impeccable and the food was a revelation!

I had the Grouper Pontchartrain and it was quite literally the single best fish entree I've ever eaten in my forty years on this Earth!

My fiance had the Barbeque Shrimp and while I thought it was tasty, she loved every bite.

The stuffed mushrooms were something else and the crab cakes were utterly delectable! This is high praise coming from a table of three out of four diners born and raised in Maryland!

I can't remember what entrees my brother and sister ordered, beyond one of them being an alternate grouper dish. Regardless, everyone was raving over the amazing meal that we had at Louisiana Lagniappe!

We will absolutely be back!

name: Katy Trotter
text: This place is amazing. Our server mike as great. Our food was fresh and probably some of the best we have ever had. They were very kid friendly, mike even make a table side Sunday for our son. We will defiantly come back very soon.

name: Maggie DeGroot
text: Amazing!! Very nice for dining. My boyfriend and I loved it. Pricing was a little more than we spend normally but with it for the quality of food.

name: John Stice
text: Hosted 40 for me in the fire place room... truly amazing job for that many off the menu.. food was really really good across the board... scallop appetizer was my fave... service was A1+

name: Josh
text: One of the best restaurants in Perdido Key. Great service. The appetizers were delicious. A little crowded, so it was hard to hear each other from across the table. Scallops were absolutely amazing.

name: Steve Walker
text: Mike, our server was excellent. The food was delicious and well prepared.  A little bit pricey,  but all in all, a great meal. Try the bread pudding with the bourbon sauce  ! Fantastic. Thanks Mike !

name: Darrell Klein
text:
Just made our second visit here and it was every bit as good as we remembered.  Great food and great service.  High end menu but in a casual atmosphere.  Prices are higher than typical for this area but it is worth it.  Add this place to your list of must stops in Orange Beach.

Orange

name: Kenneth Pitts
text: Food was great, excellent waiter staff.

name: Gregory Kelley
text: I travel to orange beach once or twice a year with my family from Raleigh, NC. Louisiana Lagniappe is by far our favorite restaurant. Even though for a family of four it typically cost us about 250 to 300 dollars each trip, it’s worth it the because the food is amazing. Tonight my entire view on the restaurant changed. We called the restaurant to place a To-go order, and the hostess claimed they have only one bartender who can take a to-go order and she was just to busy to call back in an hour. She is the only one who can take a To-go order? We decided to go sit at the bar and have a drink or two until we could place the order because we don’t mind waiting on the food here it’s just that good. The manager claims the staff can’t handle it, and she won’t be taking To-go order tonight. You mean to tell me that we pay that much for that food when we come down here, and you can’t have a more efficient kitchen staff to take a Togo order? Hire more kitchen employees! It’s simple. I’ve worked in the service industry in Raleigh in a high volume restaurant, and we were always staffed well, and ready for any amount of guest that our restaurant could handle. Will not be returning because the management handled the situation so poorly.

name: Vylet22
text: We're from Louisiana so we're not easy to please when it comes to food, especially when traveling. This place had good food and service and great views. It should be on your bucket list every time you go to Orange Beach/Gulf Shores. Holding back that 5th star because the menu could use more variety- almost every fish dish was Grouper- which is good but so are other varieties of fish that are readily available locally. It's a beautiful place and more people should dress like it. You can wear shorts but dress it up with a collared shirt guys.

name: Cassandra Lombardo
text: We all had a great meal, and look firward to coming back!

name: Scott Smith
text: Lobster was cold, and not prepared properly. Very disappointed ☹️ heard alot about this place. I will not be back. To many other good restaurants around.

name: Millie matt
text: Enjoyable experience ..Food was delicious, service good and view of boats and Bay awesome..

name: William Tunnell
text: We always come here for work when we visit the area and it’s a crowd favorite!

name: George Wilkerson
text:
Good food.
Service could have been better.

name: R Jason Townsend
text: This is one of my dad's favorite places.  To me the food is a little heavy/rich.  Also their price point seems high.  I live in Vegas and have eaten in some really nice places. I didn't think I got my money's worth here when I compared it to my favorites.  What I had was tasty but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back

name: january cooper
text: Really liked our server Mike!!!! Food was good!

name: courtney callis
text: This restaurant has been a family beach trip tradition since I was a little girl. Now that I am older I have much more appreciation for the experience. We received superior service and food was delicious! Our server, Austin, was very attentive and gave us great recommendations. I highly recommend the grouper meunière (the twice baked potato paired with it is to die for), lobster tail/ shrimp étouffée, and key lime martini!!

name: Joyce Curry
text: My favorite Seafood restaurant in that area!

name: Erin Griff
text: Phenomenal food and amazing service! We have been multiple times for dinner and we have yet to have a "fair" meal. Everything has been delicious! Sunday brunch is excellent too and great prices. Highly recommend!

name: Mallory Howard
text:
We have heard rave reviews about this restaurant, and figured we would give it a try. We reserved our table online, so there was no wait. The server was very nice and well trained. I believe his name was Adrian. I had the blackened grouper. It was bland, sadly. The lobster that topped it gave it a small amount of
flavor. The view was beautiful. My husband had lobster and shrimp étouffée. The lobster was great, but the étouffée was  mediocre. The house salads are similar to what is served at the Olive Garden chain restaurants. The noise level was a bit high. We got lucky and were seated in a corner and were able to converse until a large group with multiple small children were placed next to us. We aren’t sure that we will return.

name: Wilson Christa
text: This place has never disappointed us.

name: Maureen Kennedy
text: Really good food. They have room for large groups. Not cheap but worth it!

name: Benji Borrelli
text: This is seriously a fine dinning experience! Great food! Great service! Very reasonable priced!

name: Stacie Ritchey
text: The food and service was excellent.    By far the best seafood we had on our vacation!

name: Donna Nelson
text: Called ahead as directed by the hostess...told we could be seated in 35 minutes..added our name to the wait list...arrived promptly at designated time...gave our name and was told it would be an additional 35 minutes...waited another hour + and was finally seated...the noise level is about a 20 out of a 1 to 10...unacceptable... We couldn't hear each other speak in a normal tone......The one highlight was the food and the server Mike...food was very good and so was the service but won't be making a second visit...

name: Eloise Lamons
text: We had my son and DIL rehearsal dinner here . They went above and beyond service and the food was delicious! We rented out the back room. I highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Heather Davis
text: Food and drinks were amazing. Friendly manager, gave us free dessert for our anniversary. We will definitely be returning.

name: Britny Fischer
text: Doesn’t do to go orders when they’re too busy. Was not in a hurry to order food so I didn’t mind waiting. Don’t understand the difference between me sitting in the restaurant and waiting for food vs waiting to pick up food. Very rude staff and guests.

name: waller king
text: Great place!  Some of the best service I have ever had, and the food was amazing!! We started with the lobster rangoons and smoked tuna dip then had an amazing side salad. My fiance had the Chef's Special wich was Red Snaper Pappilote, I had the Lobster Etouffee, both with twice baked potatoes. We shared both and  loved it!!! I have been working as a chef in fine dining for a decade and wish i had the pleasure of working with a staff like this!!  Every thing came out with perfect timing, the wait staff were very attentive and friendly and gave that "little extra" you expect from an establishment like this. The portions were large but who complains about leftovers!  If you are in Destin and are looking for an exceptional dinning experience go here!

name: Ruth Murnick
text: It was an awesome brunch place, with unbelieveable food and free beignets

name: Kevin Paul
text: Higher end on price. Food is elegant but very very good. In addition portions are huge. Service was great. Will return.

name: Lucinda Crum
text: Really good food,  nice, friendly atmosphere

name: Brenda Miller
text: Great food friendly staff.  Super friendly locals.

name: Carlene Humphrey
text: It was totally amazing.  Excellent.

name: Angela Glessner
text: Best seafood dinner we've ever had, hands down! Great service all the way around! We will be back next time we are in Orange Beach!

name: Marcus May
text: Excellent food and service! Highly recommend.

name: Patrice Beamon
text: Customer service was good but one of my guest myself received like warm food and had to wait a while for it to be redone.

name: Sam Wilson
text: ABSOLUTELY  WONDERFUL!🤗 The staff and food is Exceptional! Went for our 26 wedding anniversary. Thank you!😉😘

name: Michael Jackson
text: Damn!!! You gotta love it. Great food great service... Excellent!!!

name: Jim Hutton
text: One of our favorite.  Not cheap but worth it.

name: Jody Thompson
text: First time visit. We were seated, the waiter brought out hushpuppies before taking our order. The waiter was very attentive and professional so no issues there. The view was great. The hush puppies had no flavor except a burnt cornmeal taste. The salad was average at best. I ordered the yellow fin tuna and my wife the shrimp and lobster Étouffée. I didn’t enjoy the tuna. I have bought better cuts of Yellow fin in Little Rock Arkansas at the grocery store. It was not seasoned at all and had a lobster sauce on it that tasted like eggs Benedict. It was a bit chewy even though lightly seared. The Étouffée was even worse. The shrimp were small and no flavor at all in the sauce. Sadly the only food I tasted here that I enjoyed was the twice baked potato.

name: Ricky Stechmann
text: Outstanding as usual. Been enjoying this place for years, every time we visit the area, never disappointed. Exceptional for a tourist area, hope it remains and holds on to old traditions for years to come.

name: Dave Elmore
text: Fantastic food as usual!

name: Melissa Dobson
text: Wonderful food, we had great service and a nice atmosphere. We had a great experience for our birthdays. We will definitely be back!

name: bologna squash
text: Incredible all around

name: Elizabeth Leger
text: The food is amazing, wait staff on point, atmosphere was pleasant...Would highly recommend and is by far my favorite in Orange Beach.

name: Gabriella Burdette
text: Best restaurant in Orange Beach! Everything from appetizer to dessert was amazingly good. I can't wait to go back there next year!

name: Valerie and Richard Dupont
text: Excellent food and service. Best in the area

name: shawn baldwin
text: Awesome seafood. One of the best restaurants in Orange County in my opinion and I've been to most of them over the years.

name: Tom Holmes
text: Have eaten there several times and never had a bad experience. Great food, good service at a reasonable price. I highly recommend.

name: Amanda Melton
text: The blackened grouper was indescribable.  I went with a group of 10 people and everyone raved about their dish.  If you want to treat yourself to fine dining, GO!

name: Sue Dunfee
text: Never had a bad meal!  A+

name: Rod Montrose
text: Amazing food and great service. Their $45 dinner for 2 is a good deal for the quality if food.

name: Mike Ferrell
text: Best fine dining in Orange Beach.  Ate there twice we liked it so much.

name: Helen Farrish Hinkle
text: Very pleasant atmosphere and good food.

name: cary cheek
text: Best place to eat in orange beach. Great food.

name: Lee C
text: Our experience there tonight was absolutely amazing!  Yes they are expensive but the experience is totally and completely worth it!

name: R Clark
text: Just ok. Both food and service.

name: Gary Nollin
text: Outstanding food and even better service

Outstanding food, service and ambiance!
THIS THE BEST RESTAURANT IN ORANGE BEACH!

name: Vicky Dozier
text: Great place to eat! Delicious food!

name: Tracy Biggers
text: I don't even know where to start. I do not have one single bad thing to say about this place. All of the staff were very friendly. The food was excellent! Every single person in our party of 10 had an excellent experience and wonderful food! One person suggested this place and we all agreed to go because we had never been. We were a little hesitant on the way after being up the menu on our phones and seeing how pricey everything on the menu is, BUT... it is worth it! You start out with hushpuppies and water, then your beverage of choice. Then their house salad with a red wine vinegarette. And then... our meals came! Oh my goodness! It was so delicious! Not one complaint from the whole group!

name: Carrie Holmes
text: Had dinner over the weekend. The food was great and so was the service. I will be back next time I am in town.

name: brenda powell
text: We met friends here last night. It was our second visit to the restaurant. First visit was outstanding. Last night was a little different.  There were four of us. Three order the chefs special and I ordered a steak cooked medium.  The orders came out and it was four chefs specials. Waitress said oh my I put it in wrong.   The other three got their food and wanted to wait til I received mine to eat. I told them that was silly. Go ahead and eat.  Turns out it’s good that they did.  My steak finally came out. I asked for a box. I cut into it to take a bite while waiting and it was rare.  We just put it in the box and brought it home.  I know mistakes happen but when you pay $200. For a meal you expect it to be correct.  I’m not sure we will ever go back.  Such a disappointment after looking so forward to going there.

name: Rochelle Woods
text:
Best meal at the beach and we went to most of the nice ones! He had the ribeye and I had the grouper pecan. Both were great. Special Sun-Th $49.99 2 meals and a BOTTLE of wine!
Special was after Labor Day.

name: Kristine Jones
text: My family was in Christmas week and tried to make reservations for my parents anniversary the next Saturday (today). We were told they don't take reservations so far in advance, but call ahead seating day of should be no problem. My stepdad called a few minutes ago and was told no call ahead seating tonight because too many people showed up and a table for two would be 2 hours. They will be having a wonderful dinner at Nolan's instead.  Very disappointed.

Only quam would be the sheets of plastic up the the area we were sitting which took away from the ambiance a bit and we were also seated right next to the bussing station where ice was being dumped in or pulled out a lot. Other than that this place is a real winner ..will def be back!

name: Theressa Coleman
text:
My husband ate at the original Popeyes in New Orleans he now has vowed to never eat Popeyes Again. This store is disgraced to the Popeye's name. This is the third Popeyes in Birmingham that we went to with a handwritten sign on your Order Board saying  pull up to the window. So therefore everybody has to order at the window it literally took us 45 minutes to get to the window and then my husband said the chicken was Horrible & who can mess up mashed potatoes and gravy he said it comes in a pouch you just pour it out and microwave it but it was Scorched.
Come on Popeyes straighten up your act..

name: Step East
text: Popeyes Fried Chicken, Red Beans & Rice and French Fries are the best. The service we received at this location was fast and friendly and our Drive-Thru order was prepared and handed out correctly. We will definitely visit this Popeyes again soon..

text: Cashier, took my order and 3 people behind me with his gloves on, then he processed to the back line and start making food with the same gloved hands. He didn't change his gloves and got upset when I told him I didn't want the food.

name: edna godfrey
text: The staff was ghetto. The gentleman was trying to take my order but the staff was standing around him talking loudly he couldn't hear me and I couldn't hear him. They were out of tenders. Even when I pulled up to the window it was wide open and the staff was still talking extremely loud to include the managers. No one was working I guess everyone was on break all at once. They staff needs to be trained in etiquette there was none there.

name: Da Avigo
text:
Employees working on 4/23 evening should be FIRED!!! A charter bus driver was trying to get food and they denied service. We are from Texas and that was very upsetting! Supervisor, PLEASE address that problem ASAP. Truck and motor coach drivers should not be denied service, because those vehicles can NOT go on the drive-thru even if the wanted to. SMH!
Bad customer service

Has the management changed ?

text: By far the worst service I have ever experienced. First, the cashier gave me the wrong change. I told him I needed another $5 and all of a sudden he didn’t know how to do math. So I was sitting there trying to explain to him how I needed another $5, I just gave up and figured they needed more, to get better workers. Not only that, but the service took FOREVER. I ordered my food at 2:29 and received my food at 2:57... never coming to this Popeyes again, and I wouldn’t suggest this Popeyes to anyone else. If I could give a review without giving a star, I would. They don’t deserve one star.

text: Food was fresh and didn't have to wait which is why I'm giving 3 stars. The employees though were so rude it was ridiculous!!! Two females and one looked like a manager. Please do better with your customer service!!!!!

name: Valencia Moore
text: On this occasions it took a hour to get to the store and back home.  We are 6 minutes  from  the  store.  At least the food was correct and hot.  Most time we have the wrong order that is given to us.  Spicey  chicken is always out or not ready.  We then are  given the regular chicken.  They should ask us if we want it.  My husband's is always complaining  about that.

name: Cedric Davis
text: Although I own never want to complain because I once worked in fast food but this particular location always has some type of issues I love the product that they sell what's a customer service need some work and the people on the front end registers should be better trained how to take orders I ordered a 3-piece combo and I requested that I have spicy chicken to Wings and a thigh and he rang it up as mild and I noticed it on the receipt the manager came in corrected it verbally to the kitchen staff and they still gave it to me wrong but the lines were so long and the drive-thru was so backed up until I just set and ate my food I also would like to say I think that it is pathetic as high as Popeye's Chicken already he is that you started charging for gravy not for chicken but for gravy I think that is absolutely asinine I mean that's just an option with or without gravy I don't understand how that changed and why but anyway I'm sure this probably will fall on deaf ears and there'll be no follow-up but you have really lost a loyal customer pool service in high prices don't go together

So some young lady ask the man manager for the keys so she can lock the door and he gives them too her to lock ... She walks back around the counter and ask the guy who told me to come in was he gonna take my order he said no she asked the manager and he said no the lobby closed... Note a employee told me to come inside and the door wasn't locked and it was guest in the lobby ... I work in a restaurant and i know how things work u had plenty of chicken to sell and plenty of cars in the drive thru but turn me around... I think y'all should really do some better training to your employees and managers ...

name: Paul Campbell
text:
They always have a good selection of fresh fish at a reasonable price. They will prepare your fish as you want...i.e. scaling, skinning, fileting...
Shrimp are a fairly good price.
It isn't the most attractive place. It is clean.
The folks working there are helpful.
Lots of local folks there from panhandlers, regular folks, and professionals.

name: Jeaninne LaFleur
text: Great resource for our area for many types of fresh seafood. Shrimp is always a bargain. I don't care about the atmosphere or employee warmth. Give me the fish fresh, good price and I'm fine.

name: Jacqueline Moore
text: Meat not fresh

name: Doressa Cobb
text: Food was good and seasoned well.

name: Kenny Tran
text: One of the oldest seafood market in town and ran by locals of the community. The owner is a great and generous guy who always donate to the needs in the community’s The only way he could continue that is if we continue to support his business. This business will accommodate and please their customers if need to be. They will come in hours early to cook a big order or even pack seafood for you if you’re from out of town. Some of the best prices in town and you should stop by and check them out.  They cook food and also sell them fresh if you don’t want them cooked. Also if you’re ordering in large amounts, I do advise you to talk to the manager to get a better deal.

name: Jameice Diamondz
text: I paid for half a pound of shrimp and literally got sick shrimp. I ordered fried shrimp shrimp had no flavor. I had to get a refund for my shrimp because I could have took them at my house and saved $2 that they charge to cook the shrimp and it didn't even taste good I do not recommend getting any cooked food from there

name: Harriett Bell
text: On July 5th my sister in law and I went there to purchase fish, fish and snow crab legs. The service we receive from the so call young man with the braces was  awful. He was very nasty and disrespectful to us. We ask for his name. He refused to give it to us. But he stood there talking  to another employee about what is wrong with these two people. What was wrong was your knowledge of what takes to serve the public. We make your pay check. If your boss can't sell any seafood. You want get paid. The other employee to whom he was speaking to was the only one that had common sense and nice. Will come back to mobile but I will not under no circumstances will spend my money at this place.

name: Tynisha Williams
text: Whenever I visit Mibile, I go 2 Springhill Seafood. The last 2 times I've come here they didn't put any butter on my shrimps/crab legs and this was something I always liked about this place. When I asked them 2 put butter on my food, I was told they don't do it anymore because people were complaining and you have to buy butter to put on your food. News flash Springhill Seafood.  ask customers if they want butter on their food and for those who don't want butter don't put it on their food, but don't punish the ones who do.

I went I asked to try one piece of crawfish before I ordered 4 lbs. I could tell it was very very very seasoned (not in a great way) but I figured I might have just gotten a bad one. Well i was wrong! They were all extremely salty. All I could taste was salt. So gross. Not sure if this was a bad day because it was terrible. What a waste of time and money.
