text: Mostly good experience.  Used the app to get on the wait list.  Said wait estimate was 10 minutes.  Closer to 25. So don't trust the online estimate.  Had a really nice server.  She took great care of us: kept us supplied with those great cheesy garlic biscuits and got my special birthday chocolate wave cake.

name: shantrece d
text: The food was phenomenal. Hot fresh and seasoned just right. Huntsville Red Lobster is the poster child for restaurant perfection. The staff is warm neat and friendly, with fast service. The restaurant is also very clean and pleasant..I will definitely return to the city  just to eat here again.

resp.text: shantrece, we’re loving the 5 star review about our Huntsville team. We hope to see you soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Reverend Karen Fisher
text: Our server was Michael. He went out of his way to get us a dinner that wasn't even on the menu anymore. The food was cooked to perfection. The restaurant was clean as always. Partitions were secured between booths and staff wore masks. We had a wonderful time!

name: Michelle Stewart
text: My friend and I are lunch here. It was definitely fresh absolutely wonderful. Our waiter was amazing.  He made our dine in experience delightful.  Great food, atmosphere and terrific customer service.

name: Anthony Krones
text:
What can I say? Their food is great and the service was totally on point. Like, seriously, my drink was never empty.

As always, the cheddar biscuits were fabulous; hot and buttery.

The service was also extremely quick, even considering that we arrived 40 minutes before they closed. It was absolutely awesome.

name: Tilden Clark
text: The food is still very good after all these years.

name: Amber Brown
text: First time we ever went, and the service and food were fantastic! Initially, there was an hour to an hour and a half wait, which we understood being it is Mother’s Day, but they got us in within 30 minutes! Our waitress was Auburn, and she was incredibly sweet and helpful! My little sister loved her.. even went to hug her.

name: Ashleigh Mitchell
text: I can not even explain how good our food just was. I’m talking absolutely delicious. Every single thing was cooked perfectly and it all came out very quickly. We are regulars here but it seemed extra good today for some reason.

resp.text: Ashleigh, happy to hear you were well taken care of at our Huntsville Red Lobster Restaurant and we'll ensure this is passed along to our team! 😋  We hope to see you again soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Debbie D Walls
text: Great food and better service! The all you can eat shrimp fest is great on Mondays!

name: VW Insanity
text: It was mother's day food was good although my wife said the crab cakes were not as flavorful as she remembers. My fish and chips was wonderful and our server was on top of things. Being a Holliday and busy as mother's day can get over all was pleased 😀

resp.text: We’re glad you enjoyed every bite, VW! 🤤 😋 Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, 5 stars. 🦞

name: East Nashville
text: Well to start, our server Arthur was fantastic! I never had to wait on a drink and he was polite and I could tell he knew what he was doing. He is the sole reason they even got 2 Stars. The food.....Oh the food. It was absolutely terrible. It was my wife's birthday and she really wanted to go here. It was my first time. I ordered some lobster tails she had the ultimate feast. When I got my food a $40 meal, my lobster was like a rubber band ball it was disgusting. I could barely rip it apart with my fingers. It could literally bounce. I had to cut it with a steak knife. I should have been fluffy, buttery and savory. I know it's not an ocean side restaurant but with a name like Red lobster I figured the lobster would be decent. I was so let down. Please make sure your cooks can at the most cook lobster. How is a place named Red Lobster serving such terribly cooked lobster. Your chef clearly doesn't belong at your store.  My in-laws ordered fish and chips. The fish had to have been dipped and breaded 15 times before it hit the fryer. When they finished they had almost an entire plate of batter that they picked and pealed off their fish. I was so embarrassed taking them here. My kids ordered the sirloin steak, they claimed to like it but they are kids, kids like anything. The steaks looked pretty beaten up and over cooked. Thank you Arthur for offering to replace the meal with a better cooked one,( "which I turned down" ) and thank you for being a fantastic server! I know that's a tough job. You were worth the $50 tip I left you. But Red Lobster I beg you to hire some efficient chefs and focus on training your cooks how to properly prepare lobster, steak and even a simple fish and chips. Find people who want to be there and who care weather their food is good. I'm not asking you to fire this person that cooked our food tonight but at the very least spend hours retraining them to cook your food the way it should be. I can't imagine how much money your company wastes throwing away food that was cooked terribly. I'm not sure I'll ever go to another Red lobster again which stinks because my wife raved about it, but it was just upsetting. I hope anyone who reads this doesn't have the same experience. I work too had for my $$$ to have someone not care how their food turns out. I don't blame red Lobster as I don't know their current situation but they have to know that their cook is not very good. Thank you for trying to make it right but first time is a charm. Thanks aka. EAST

resp.text: Our goal is to provide a 5-star seafood experience and we apologize for letting you down, East. If you’d like a follow up regarding your visit to our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, please send us a private message on Facebook. Please include the location you ordered from, details of your experience, and reference GM050421A. www.facebook.com/redlobster/ Thank you!

name: Joe Pierce
text: Great service, great atmosphere, great food! It's nice to be able to hear the person next to you for a change! :) Food was terrific and service was excellent. Highly recommend this Red Lobster to anyone craving seafood.

resp.text: Joe, glad you could stop in and that our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Happy to hear you enjoy seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Austin Bullard
text: To start, Service was decent. The food was another story. My lobster tail, which was about the size of a shrimp, was brought out brown. The Brussels sprouts smelled like a trash dump, and my steak was not good at all. This place has gone way downhill. Used to be decent but will not be returning.

resp.text: Austin - We appreciate the recommendation and we will forward your comments to our Huntsville Red Lobster team! text: Our meal was delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was neat and clean. Will definitely be back.

resp.text: Glenda, we're glad to hear our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Glad to hear you enjoyed seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Google Mapper
text: What happened to that place? Red Lobster use to be a really nice place to eat. The steak and lobster meal was very disappointing. The small steak was overcooked and the dry lobster tail was smaller than a chicken finger! I was upset to discover that the service was much worse than the meal. My drink order was taken and I was provided bread. 20 minutes later, my drink arrives and I Insisted on placing my order. Dinner plate arrived 40 min afterward.  After eating my meal, I waited almost an hour before I could get someone to track down my server so I could pay and leave. If I had walked out without paying, it would have been hours before anyone noticed! NEVER AGAIN!! 👎

resp.text: We are sorry to hear the quality of food you received is not what you’d expect from our Red Lobster and we’d like to make your next visit a 5-star seafood experience. Please fill out our online form, along with the details of your visit, and reference GM042221A . ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm Thanks!

name: Linder Metts
text:
May 27th - Our server was not wearing a mask. That order is still in effect until July 3rd. I was taken aback and perhaps this is on me for simply not getting up and walking out or bringing it up real time. This whole situation we all find ourselves in is awkward for all involved.  However, it is not on the customer's shoulders to enforce state rules. I just don't get it since it seemed most if not all of the other employees had appropriate facial covering.  Rationally I can tell myself that the exposure risk was probably low. On the other hand should I be having to go through that because a restaurant/employee couldn't be respectful of their customers?

Update 3 weeks later:  Although I never received anything other than a canned response on Yelp in spite of contacting them via their website, I made a visit last night in hopes of finding improvement and dinning. Well, incredulously, it was worse!  The State's mask orders are still in effect. Opening the door and entering this time even the host doesn't have a mask and the first server we see - no mask. We turned and walked out.  You have to ask yourself what kind of corporate/management approach so blatantly violates an obvious and easily implementable order. And if they have this disregard about the things you can see then what about those things you can't even during non-pandemic times.

This can be done correctly. I've witnessed it at many other both local and chain establishments. It boils down to commitment to customers or lack thereof.

resp.text: Hi, Linder Metts.  We’re so sorry to hear this and we hope you will give us another chance. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM062320A in the comments section, so we can personally contact you and also know you first reached out to us here? We hope to hear from you soon! ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

My lobster bisque ( which I had to pay $3 extra) had NO lobster pieces.  Was totally liquid! I've had it before & it has always had a few little, tiny pieces of lobster in it.  So I was disappointed ☹️

name: Doug Johnson
text: Horrible service and horrible food. It all started when I asked for water, no lemon, and get brought back water with lemon. Not that big of a deal, it happens, simple mistake. I very foolishly paid for our food at the table tablet early as we were a bit short on time and wanted to leave as soon as we were done. Our food arrived and the steak was over done like shoe leather, the lobster tail was like eating a rubber band, and the side of fries was missing. The shrimp was at least alright. Our waitress was not seen again for 20+ minutes. She finally came back around, we mentioned some issues, and she vanished again. After several minutes, we caught some other waitress nearby and asked for a manager. After another 15+  minutes of no manager nor our waitress being seen, we left as we simply had no more time to waste dealing with this ordeal, we were already late at this point. We didn't get all the ordered food and half of what we did get wasn't even edible. It's bad when you leave Red Lobster and wish you would have stuck with Papa John's.

resp.text: Hi,Doug Johnson.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? My point of view or opinions come from over 7 visits but take out only, can't tell you how the experience is if you choose to dine in. The fresh catch salmon portion is rather small for $19 plus tax. Summary; If you know of a better seafood restaurant then I would try them instead.

name: Scott Allman
text: Another packed Red Lobster. I just moved back into town from Memphis. The Red Lobster there literally has the same qualities, defects, pros and cons as the one here in Huntsville, AL. Both lack in cleanliness. At peak hours the bathrooms become disgusting. Which seems understandable based on the amount of human traffic one establishment can take, but at the end of the day cleanliness has to come first above all. The food tastes like it came off an assembly line. I have no idea how people who’ve had real seafood, down on the Gulf of Mexico, can stand to come home from vacation and eat this? There’s nothing fresh about it. I have nothing negative to say regarding the staff. They seem like they work extremely hard. Sometimes it seems like they’re just holding on. Much respect. Verdict? If you want real, fresh and delicious seafood...get in you car and head South till you hit sand.

resp.text: Hi,Scott Allman. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM051619A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Jason Scrivner
text: Went on 5/22 and ordered curbside pickup. It took just shy of an hour, three phone calls that were each answered with indifference, and finally going inside to get our food. We were placated with a $10 gift certificate for the annoyance. I know we weren’t the only ones either as I saw a couple other cars waiting for just about as long as us only to end up having to go inside. What’s the point of advertising curbside service if you have no real intent of providing it? The whole point  was to avoid unnecessary contact, but we were essentially forced to go inside just to provoke any sort of response. This location has disappointed in the past, but never to the point of me feeling like posting a review; and like fools we keep coming back. This experience left us with a feeling that they just really don’t care, and that’s sad because we really like the product. That $10 gift card will probably end up in someone’s birthday card at some point because we’ll be hard pressed to go back any time soon.

resp.text: Hi, Jason.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? When you submit your feedback, please reference GM052320E in the comments section so that we know you first shared your experience here: ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Battle Kitten
text: I Went in for lunch today at 1:00. I sat at the bar since I was alone and you usually get faster service at the bar. No one was there. No employees and only two ladies who were finished eating and sitting to talk. I waited two waiters bused tables around the bar. Finally a black guy came to the bar and answered his phone he talked and never acknowledged me. Employees milled around. A black girl came to chit chat with the hostess. Still no service. Black guy is still on the phone. Finally I left. Walking past the black girl and hostess no one said good bye thanks for coming. Not one person spoke to me.

resp.text: We're sorry you were unsatisfied with your experience, Battle Kitten. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM110218C in the comments section along with your feedback? We would like a chance to make this right.  ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

text: We try to go when they offer the endless shrimp. Our server was less than solicitous, only brought drink refills one time and had to be reminded of the further order of shrimp (traditionally we have been offered numerous refills). The menu change no longer offers my favorite flounder, an entre I have eaten for more than 30 years. Little things add up: the check was brought to us just the receipt paper, was whisked away with our payment card, returned the same way, and finally collected from the table before we were able to get up and away (we did not linger lest one think the server was trying to get rid of us) Just disappointed with the overall experience.

text: Delicious food, excellent service, friendly staff especially our host Chelsea.  She was very helpful and friendly.  She made sure our wait was minimal and she was very beautiful.

resp.text: Hi, 1Feng 2Shui. Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! We look forward to serving you again soon.

text: Good service ,very clean great server

resp.text: We're glad to hear your experience from our Huntsville Red Lobster! We hope to serve you again soon, Jeff.

name: Joe and Leslie Deerman
text: The server was awesome! Food was great too!

resp.text: Glad to hear you enjoyed your meal at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Mike Daury
text: Salad fresh Asparagus good Rice way undercooked Crab legs fair at best. No Alaskan King very depressing Rock Lobster good not great and the scampi was shrimp and butter absent garlic and herbs. For what we paid. Not worth it. Service was very good and the only reason I did not complain about a meal I wait for all year. My Birthday meal next year will be at a different location. It will not be red Lobster.

name: Alex Webster
text: It was great!!! The food was perfect and the service was amazing.

resp.text: We're so glad to hear you had an amazing time at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Angela Harbin
text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

name: Mechele Hobbs
text: Great lunch!

name: Charles Winkles
text: Love their lobsterfest. Falls around my wedding anniversary.

resp.text: That sounds like a fantastic experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster and we're already looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

name: Sherri Fitzpatrick
text: The food was good, however, the waitress was very inattentive.  She took our salads and appetizers away while we were still eating them.  After she brought our food, she didn't check on us again until we were almost finished eating.  My daughter had a sticker floating in her water, I needed a drink refill, and she didn't ask if we wanted more biscuits.  Their recommended tip was also calculated on the total after including the tax instead of the subtotal. I would eat there again, but I would not want to have the same waitress.

name: SamMarie Mayrut
text: Great service! Food was not so great  Crab fest was a let down. :(

resp.text: We value our guests and we are very sorry to hear about your bad experience. We'd like to learn more so we can try to make this right for you and also prevent similar situations happening in the future. Could you please click the following link to provide details about your experience? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm So that we know the feedback is from you, please reference code GM082719E in the comments section. Thank you!

name: Roger Green
text: Always great food and service every time we visit.

resp.text: Thank you for giving the Huntsville Red Lobster 4 stars, Roger Green, we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time.

name: nikki billips
text: Was greeted promptly at the door. Nice host. Was seated and greated immediately. Great server. She took care of us. Got drinks fast. And the food came out quicker than expected. But the food was terrible. My husband and I both had the steak and lobster. The steak was tough and bland I can do much better by cooking my own steak. The lobster was tough and tasteless. The only good thing was the service and drinks.. but that will not bring me back. I wanted a good steak and lobster and was highly disappointed. And it was our date night haven't been on a date in 8 months. We'll  go back to Connors next time. Everything there is phenomenal.

name: Adam Needle
text: Another sub par seafood restaurant.  These guys have been pretending for years to be a good seafood restaurant.

name: Charles Winkles
text: Love their lobsterfest. Falls around my wedding anniversary.

resp.text: That sounds like a fantastic experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster and we're already looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

name: tony chavez
text: Visited this location for a birthday and service was beyond exceptional. Steak was cooked exactly as I asked and tasted amazing and the wifes crab was on point. Our server was very friendly and quick to get us anything we needed. Adel the manager was also exceptional. Made our 3 year old daughter smile and enjoy the meal which anyone with kids can understand the delight from that.

name: Barry Andrews
text: Everything was great. Food hot & very nicely served. This site continues to do very well.

name: Linda Whitaker
text: It was very good.  We loved it.

resp.text: Sounds like the best day ever at our Huntsville Red Lobster! Thanks for sharing.

name: Caroline
text: Good service, food was just alright though

name: Cynde Glass
text: Love it always have a great experience and the waitstaff is awesome . We will definitely be back

resp.text: We love hearing that you had a great time, Cynde!

name: Melissa Escamilla
text: Our waiter was extremely playful with my 6 & 4 year old. He even gave them a little stuffed animal. Food was top quality! yummy in my heart & tummy

resp.text: We're so glad to hear you had an amazing time at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Lesa Leon
text: Service was slow to start. There were 8 of us. We ordered appetizers drinks and meals. All our meals came out together, correctly and hot. We were there to celebrate a birthday, the manager came over to congratulate her. We had great food and a great time.

name: Donna Woods
text: Absolutely wonderful... The food was awesome... Our waitress was fantastic...

resp.text: We couldn't be happier about this, Donna!

name: George Barnett
text:
Our server, Adel was incredible.  The food was great. The restaurant needed some updating and there was something greasy on the floor below our table.
The highlight of our visit was our server, Adel.

name: frank panzeri
text: Food was a 4 or above, service was slow and it wasn't crowded,  had to flag down the waiter for drink refills. Bread didn't arrive until the meal was being served and they were crispy. Overall it was a good expierence,  but could have been better.

name: Angela Harbin
text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

name: LT Luv
text: Food was not cooked well. Waited over 30min to speak with the manager, who never came but did refund the appetizer which was not the problem. Smh... will not be eating here again. The service has truly diminished over time.

resp.text: Hi, LT Luv. We always welcome feedback and would like to learn how we could have made your experience a better one. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM012219A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

name: Tim Patterson
text: Great food, great prices, service was great! A place to return to time and again!

resp.text: Glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster! See you soon.

name: David Jackson
text:
Tiffany was our waitress - she was outstanding. Kind, courteous, friendly, anticipated our needs and checked on us often.   She reminded me of when people cared about their customers and made them feel appreciated. She is a gem.
Food was very good and the birthday dish was very nicely decorated and presented.
Thanks for a great dinner.  See you again soon.

name: Frank P
text: My portion of Lobster Alfredo was very small, child size, and I ordered a full. The fish my husband ordered was bland and over cooked. The broccoli was mushy and the color of the tops was yellowish which meant old.

resp.text: We're sorry you were unsatisfied with your experience, Frank Petrillo. Our team would like to learn more so that we can prevent these mistakes in the future. name: Savannah Blake
text: Superb service and food. I was also highly impressed with their functional allergy menu.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our 1818 University Drive N.W. Red Lobster and for sharing your pleasant experience with us!

name: Alvie Rodgers
text: Excellent experience. I had Ultimate Feast. It was perfect. My wife had Walt's Shrimp and they were perfect. Seems you can always count on Red Lobster.

name: Phyllis Ledford
text:
We hadn't been there in at least a year. We finally went back 3 weeks ago and we had their Shrimp Scampi once again. We love their fried shrimp but we love Shrimp Scampi so much more. It is fixed in garlic butter. There isn't enough garlic butter for us. We had more added to it and we could tell there was garlic in the butter that time. That made it so much better...like it used to be. We like to put some of the sauce over our
vegetables, potatoes and even soak pieces of our bread in it. Sooooo good.

name: Patti Golden
text: Don't like their menu change

name: Oriana Brown
text: Had a reservation and still waited 30 minutes. While waiting we observed a low health department score that was just given days before. Mostly having food at the wrong temperature.  Server was nice and helpful but the food was just ok. The drinks were not good at all. It took awhile for the food to come out after ordering.  I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Hi,Oriana Brown. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM112618A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: Good food, good service

resp.text: Hi, John Valenzuela. Thank you for sharing your feedback and giving the Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant 4 stars! Your comments have been shared with our management team and we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time!

name: Vicky Price
text: The food is great and the prices are good..

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Meagon Underwood
text: Service was undeserving of even one star. The server was very obviously annoyed that we were in her section. She walked up and introduced herself with an irritated vibe (she also added to her introduction that she was going to get us out of there fast due to the bad weather, which wasn't that bad) and asked for our drink orders then walked away without another word. Any time she came to the table she barely spoke beyond necessity, we would thank her for various things and she did not once acknowledge us. She brought half of my order out and I suppose my face expressed a question and she stared at me... the appropriate thing to say is, " Can I get you anything else?" I finally said, "Is the soup coming out now or later?" Her reply? "No, it's coming out now..." and a brisk walk away. To make dinner less enjoyable the staff were definitely not using professional language when they were in the kitchen (my table was next to the kitchen).The food was decent (hardly agree with the price verses value) but the service made the whole experience... I walked out remembering why we hardly visit that place.

resp.text: Hi Meagon Wood, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant and we’d like to know more. Please fill out our online form letting us know more about your experience and reference GM022619A in the comments section. Each comment receives individual attention; ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Scott Vance
text: Red Lobster always a staple in Huntsville.

name: Curt Crittenden
text: it's good but when they're busy you can see a decline in the service promptness but positive attitudes all around. Food is better than it used to be. I used to have to go Decatur for good Red Lobster, not anymore.

name: The Life
text: Great staff

resp.text: We’re America’s #1 Seafood Restaurant because of YOU, The! 😋 Thanks for being a lobSTAR 🦞 🤩 and we hope to see you back soon!

name: John Little
text: Great service and great food.

resp.text: Happy to hear this, John!

name: Missy Brewer
text: It was very clean and we had no wait time and the waiter was so nice to us and the food was delicious

resp.text: Hi, Missy Brewer. Thank you for visiting and giving our, Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! Happy to hear you were well taken care of and we'll ensure it's passed along! Looking forward to serving you again soon.

name: James
text:
Service:
Whether being helped at the bar or at a table I have no complaints. Waiters are prompt and very helpful.

Food:
I usually get the Salmon New Orleans and never had a problem. Sauce is extremely well made and salmon is great. Also good to note that I have never had a fish bone in my food... Thus far.

Another good recommendation is getting the 4 course meal as it's a great value and good to share.

Overall:
Never had an issue with this restraunt and hope that continues. I would highly recommend this location!

name: Kitsune of Inari
text: The place is usually packed but has a nice calm atmosphere. Servers are quick to take orders and bring drinks and are very nice. Food is always great at Red Lobster, however expensive. If your looking for a spicy dish here, order the Dragon Shrimp, really spicy and really good. Get a yuengling to go with it.

name: Jimmy Nance
text: The service was good waiting was fair

resp.text: Hi, Jimmy Nance. Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! We look forward to serving you again soon.

name: Lianne Litzenberger
text: The food and the waitress were good, however there was a waiter  there who came across as very creepy when he walked passed our table, then stopped and yanked my 9 year old daughter's menu from her.  He apparently did it as a joke. Well it scared and upset her. He then kept talking and making it worse by saying things like "oh she's mad" etc.. He said sorry and then said he was going to get her and our son a toy. He came back with a broken airplane that wouldn't stop beeping and two stuffed animals. It was just a weird experience and my daughter didn't want anything from him. But why would an old man be joking like that with a child and then making it worse by continuing being in our upset daughter's presence and giving her toys that we don't know where they've been?  Are these toys from Red Lobster or did he bring them in himself? He was just a creepy guy who seemed like he had the maturity level of a 12 year old.  Why would you "joke with a child you don't even know and yank her menu off the table? Just leave us alone. he wasn't even our server to begin with.

name: donna thrower
text: Waited for over 2 hours with no chance of being seated in sight. Some of the people that were at their tables had been waiting for an hour to get refills. No wonder everyone was waiting most of the employees was having a good time out back smoking and chilling. They could have at least asked us to join their back porch party since they had no intention on feeding us.

text: The food was delicious service is a little bit slow but it is a very busy restaurant

name: Lisa Altheide
text:
Service was extremely slow...it took almost 40 minutes to get our food once we ordered ..There were 4 of us(3 adults, 1 children)...

As we were ordering, we found out they were out of a lot of items...For the prices we paid for our meals we expected to get what we wanted.. Some of the things we were told they were out of, bacon, cheese(we could not get loaded baked potatoes)...Couldn't order the  Berry mango drink they were out of the ingredients..couldn't order a daiquiri they were out of ingredients for it as well, they were out of onions

We ordered the 4 course meal for $15.99 and that came with brownie a La mode however can u guess it, they were out of that as well. We got the cake and ice cream instead and guess what they charged us and up charge for   getting the cake and ice cream even though the didn't have the brownie a La mo and our meal came with it... 😢

After we finally ordered, the kids meal came out first and it was suppose to be macaroni but it was a bowl of grease... We didn't even know grease was used to make macaroni.. The manager did come over to apologize but my nephew had to watch us eat because he is a picky eater and the only thing he will eat at Red Lobster is the macaroni.. When the manager came over she explained they usually use Kraft macaroni and cheese for the kid's meal but...can u guess. .they ran out and they were substituting ...

The manager did not offer a satisfactory resolution..

The service was so slow.. We ended up missing some of our movie..we will not return...

text: Great menu, prices a little high, food was hot. Brocklie needs brown spots cut off and less stalk on it. Seaside plater was great, baked potato was cooked just right. Popcorn shrink perfict.

name: Teresa Brownfield
text: I love seafood and in Alabama you can not go just anywhere to get it. I took a friend and he was just amazed at the store, yes it was his first time LoL. Made my trip even more special. Great staff that gave us time to look over the menu so he could pick a great meal. And no one likes to be rushed on their first visit so all in all we had a wonderful dinner.

name: Chad Holland
text: Service has never been good, I ordered a Maker's Mark Manhattan. They brought me a double shot of Maker's Mark in a highball... When I asked the server she said oh they didn't have sweet vermouth... To which I asked if they were out or just didn't carry it, so I wouldn't order it again if they didn't carry it. Her answer.... " I ain't the bar tender I don't know..." Wow! I almost got up a left at that moment. Things were mediocre from that point forward as they were out of the first 3 dishes I ordered.... We never got the biscuits because "the kitchen done burnt 2 batches, I'll keep my eyes out" I tried to speak to the manager at the conclusion of our meal but to no suprise I couldn't find one... I walked around the dining room twice. We won't be going back!

WoW just WoW!!!  Ugh..... Never again will I visit this establishment. Gave us a fifty dollar gift card for there as if money of any value is going to make me feel better about my son possible have eaten glass. We gave the gift card away to someone on the way out.

text:

WoW just WoW!!!  Ugh..... Never again will I visit this establishment. Gave us a fifty dollar gift card for there as if money of any value is going to make me feel better about my son possible have eaten glass. We gave the gift card away to someone on the way out.

I also had the hot lobster roll well worth the price.  I am from New England so am a little spoiled but good deal for the price
The clam chowder was really good and again in groom New England so...
With a beer total came to line $32.

When my mother came to visit thus is one of the places we would go.
Yesterday would have been her 93d birthday so I celebrated in remembrance.

I would come back

name: Neil Young
text: My wife and I had a craving for some red lobster so we stopped in . We were seated very quickly and our waitress arrived and took our orders for drinks quickly.  It took a little bit but our waitress made her way back around and got our orders. Our food came out hot and fresh. My appetizer never did make it out so I asked to have it removed from my ticket which our waitress took care of. It seemed as the restaurant filled up with the Sunday crowd our waitress became more attentive which was good. The overall experience was ok, things have changed I guess with red lobster and just kinda went somewhat flat. The restroom was clean but had hand towels all over the floor and was in a slight disarray.

name: Caitlyn Hoppe
text: Customer service way off. We ate here because we got a giftcard for Christmas and it turned out to be a big mistake. We ordered an appetizer, soup, salad, and dinner entree. Our appetizer came out and the waiter set it down on the table and quickly walked away as I was trying to tell him he didn't give us any plates or forks. So from the get go I was irritated. We tried to flag several people down and were ignored each time. So after getting no help we started eating our shrimp appetizer with our hands. Finally a different server helped us and got us some forks. But still no plates. Our appetizer was gone by the time our original waiter finally came back to the table and mumbled "I shoulda been brought these out to ya" at me and finally got us plates and biscuits. Then our dinner entrees were brought out by yet another different server. We tried to ask for our soup and salad but she turned and walked away so quickly I don't think she heard me. We had nearly finished our dinner entrees by the time our original server came to check on us, and instead of apologizing for the mistake just said "yeah I know" when I said we had ordered a soup and salad. If you know, then where is my food? We both finished our dinner entrees before he brought our soup and salad out and by that point we were already full. I paid $8 for a bowl of soup I didn't even eat. The manager comped one of our meals but I will never go back there after that experience.

resp.text: Hi,Caitlyn Hoppe. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM022019E in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text:
It was Saturday night and the crowd was in. We had the choice of waiting 30 min, or we could eat at the bar.
We sit down and can immediately see the two ladies working are swamped with work. We waited patiently and our bartender got to us. She got our drinks pretty quick(Bahama Mama for my wife which she loved and in sweet tea for me which was good tea) and got us ordered.

We again patiently wait(more so than people who sat near us who just sat for a little bit and then left) and our food comes out. It was fantastic and now I have some great leftovers to enjoy. Our bartender was gracious for our patience as we were to her helping us.

text:
Were do I start:
1. The waiter was not knowledgeable of the food items to the point he had to ask another co-worker and how to key it in the register.
2. He forgot to leave me silverware. Another waitress gave me one after I asked.
3. The lobster afredo was nasty.
4. The same waiter had a 2 dollar item added to my receipt which I didn't order. Mind you I had to ask to see my itemized list. Smh
5. The manager was no better. However the waitress that helped me out was the reason I gave 2 stars.

name: Lynda Smith
text: Back in the good days red lobster was awesome. However, the last few years I really don't know what the hell has happened. The crab legs are smaller than a pencil, the lobster is approximately 2-3 ounces...we actually had to ask for our silverware and napkin's, obviously when you're having to crack open your food your ganna need even more napkins. What you see in TV is NOT what you get. The following week we went to out back, what a difference, I actually got the proper size lobster, with a steak! Hmm!! Lesson learned.

name: Darryl Bailey
text: When in the mood for seafood then this is the place I go.

name: Eric B (GodSponge)
text: Food is always great here. We used to have issues with our waiters, but lately we've had incredibly good service.

name: Bee J
text: Terrible!! Not only is this restaurant dated, the food has become increasingly poor. I've gone to Red Lobster numerous times, too many too count. I have had many instances of unsatisfactory service (the latest being 5 minutes ago) but I give them chances because they are one of a few seafood restaurants in this area. And I love my snow crab. I Ordered food online was late to make sure the food would be ready (9:52) the food wasnt brought out until after 10:15. No problem.... Things Happen...but then the biscuits were burned (paid for these extra biscuits, I wish I could attach pics) asked for new biscuits and decided to order a chilled shot of patron. The bartender PUTS ICE WATER IN GLASS (in a poor attempt to chill the glass) and pours the warm shot in the glass. This is not chilled, strike 2. Asked for a lime after we had to wait to get her to turn and we were the only 2 people at the bar besides the bartender. The bartender LITERALLY brought a lime with her BARE HANDS and said here you go. No napkin, no tooth pick, straight hand to hand contact. Clearly she should have not been working the bar. Didn't even want the drink just wanted to kill time until the food came back that they screwed up. Paid for the drink and she says have a good one. WHERE ARE MY BISCUITS???? she NEVER brought them back out. I said forget it and left with the burned biscuits which are inedible. This is the LAST time I will visit this red lobster. Until they revamp and retrain their staff... They have lost 2 customers. I mean the carpet even stinks here, you can smell it reeking and there is so much dust your allergies with not like you. It's a shame you spend all this money for subpar quality. Shame on you Red Lobster!!!

Having made sure his coke was topped off throughout dinner, she came to the table yet again to ask him if HE wanted a refill When it was MY glass that was empty at the end of the table. He then told her to fill mine and she says, "oh. okay." in a questionable tone.

She also made sure to extend the "couple more minutes" we needed to look over the menu, to about 15-20 minutes..she was a ghost half the night then had the nerve to ask about dessert. I was turned so far off of asking her for anything more than the check and even getting that was complicated..

All told she served the family behind us very well so something was fishy.. The crab okay but sadly we will not be returning.

name: Kelli Black
text: We took my father to lunch yesterday to the Huntsville Red Lobster. He is 85 and a veteran from World War II, Vietnam, and Korea. He retired to   Huntsville almost 30 years ago. He has been going to the Red Lobster there for 30 years.  We had our meal and he insisted on paying the bill. He handed me his wallet which had 3 crisp 50 dollars bills inside. He asked to take two and put them in with the bill.... he wanted to pay the 47 dollar bill and get change to tip the waiter.  I removed the two bills and he ask that i lay them side by side in the envelope so that they did not get stuck together and so the waiter could see there were two and not just one. The lunch was slow taking almost two hours to complete so he finally asked if we could make our way to the car while my wife stayed and waited for the change.  i brought him to the car and we waited for another 20 minutes but my wife did not come.  Finally she did come out and was blown away.  The waiter came back by the table and through the plastic bill holder on the table and said there was no bill or money inside and that he was reprinting the bill for my wife to pay again. I went back into the restaurant to talk to the waiter, but he wouldn't even talk he left for a bit and the manager came out to talk to me. He said that i must have dropped the money and the bill and asked if it was in my pockets. I explained that I knew for sure the money was there because my dad had asked be to take the money from his wallet and to lay the bills next to each other so not to have a mis understanding and that i had closed the plastic envelope before is left and my wife had not even touched it.. only the waiter had touched it.  The manager did not seem to know what to do, but said if i left my number he would call if it turned up. It was a bad situation for everyone. The lady;s sitting across from us leaned over to my wife and said ' we saw you pay the bill"...  I finally decided that having my dad at the restaurant for 2 and a half hours was too long for him to be up so I just told them to keep our money and i left.  I guess i was hoping that the manager would say here is your 40 dollars change you asked for and we will find this mis-placed bill and work it out... i understand it is a bad situation but my dad now will never go back after 30 years and is telling everyone he sees about the lost of  his money.

text:
It's still a nice restaurant chain. Unfortunately this time we had a large party and the wait was 1 hour which actually turned into an 1hour and 40 minutes. The manager appologized for the wait around the 1 hour mark.

Finally seated and starving and irritated. It would have been nice to have a complimentary appetizer or two brought to the table by the manager to appologize for the excessive wait time. Nope. So we resorted to asking the waitress for bread which they despise because they are not supposed to bring them out till after you order. Oh well.
Other than that the menu has a good variety and the prices are decent.

name: Zachary White
text:
Can’t say I’d recommend this location, at least not based on this particular experience. The service was very poor (despite not being particularly busy, in the ~2 hours of our being there, the server only voluntarily visited our table 3-4 times).

As for the meal itself, the iced tea I was served tasted funny. The dish I ordered had a choice of New York Strip or Filet Mignon and, despite not indicating a preference, the server never asked me which I’d like. The Caesar salad had maybe 3-5 shavings of parmesan on it and the lettuce was rather limp and not crisp. The shrimp scampi was fine; it tasted of garlic and not much else. The wood-grilled shrimp was meh; it was lackluster in terms of flavor, due in part to its complete lack of seasoning. In general everything was pretty bland.The “steamed” broccoli was instead maybe half-steamed, i.e. it was half-raw, therefore rather crunchy. And even the ~$11 Lobster Tail was over-cooked, dry, and bland (also it wasn’t served with butter).

Based on this experience, I would recommend going to a different location or, if you find that the quality does not improve elsewhere, pick a different restaurant altogether. 3/10.

name: Joanne Reynolds
text: Went there yesterday for a late lunch around two with my husband. There weren't that many people there. Stopped at the hostess stand and she was on the phone talking to someone about a lost article. No big deal so we waited several minutes while she finished her phone conversation. There was also a male employee who was stacking menus who just ignored us. The female hostess gets off the phone and seats us. We look through the menu and make our selections. I realized that we still had not even been greeted even though 3 other tables had been seated after us and were approached by their waiters and were given drinks and biscuits. Still no waiter even though there were two waiters standing by our booth right behind my husband. Our booth was at the end so they were just a couple of feet from us and I am sure that they could hear our conversation wondering why we didn't have a waiter. At that point I pulled out my cellphone to keep track of the time. We had been sitting there for almost fifteen minutes when a female waiter passed us and said our waiter would be there in just a minute. A few minutes more went by before a female waiter who had an order of food to deliver paused at our table and asked if we knew what we wanted to drink. I told her that we had been sitting there for quite some time and already knew what we wanted to order to eat. She said okay that she would be right back and would take good care of us. I saw her deliver the food and then go to another table to take their order. My husband and I just looked at each other and got up and left. I can't believe that there were waiters standing around and nobody had waited on us in all that time. It was inexcusable and I will be sure to let everyone we know what poor service we were given. I could understand if it was busy, but there weren't many tables occupied.

name: Justice Writer
text: Every time we visit a Red Lobster and especially the one in the Huntsville, Alabama on University, we say, never again.  This time, Niadja, our waitress was caring; but she gave us dinner pricing when our visit was at lunchtime. Is it legal to charge dinner prices at lunch claiming that the sizes are larger without notice or consent from the customer? We never got the towelettes we requested until the end, either.  In Japan, for instance, a nice hot cloth towel is afforded to the patrons prior to eating. On the same note, Japanese peeps don’t wear shoes indoors either so why would we expect for an American restaurant to provide us hand wipes prior to eating? Our seats were too close together, so we moved. But, the table we moved to wobbled and caused damages to us as well as to our belongings. Thomas, the manager was rude and indifferent. Niadja was to apply a $4.00 coupon which led to our finding out about the pricing deceit. Our hot-spot was being used; but Thomas wouldn't let us use their DSL to get the $4.00 coupon from our Trash. Thank GOD $4.00 won't break us since GOD has given us so much. It's the principal of the matter, though. On our visit previously, a man came in seeking stuff and it was not until he started to bother other guests did management ask him to leave. Plus $1000 was stolen from an acquaintance of ours from her purse while she and her friends were eating there a while ago. On second thought, the people there are very unhappy, the waitresses never smile and purposely catch your eye only to give you a mean look. What a shame.

name: Nathan
text:
All the way around,  the worst dinning experience I've had in years! Would not go back and would not recommend to others.
Nothing was served on time or in correctly order, bake potato was never served.
Owner needs to get rid of both managers and get two that knows what going on.

We received our ultimate feast and asked for togo boxes and our check. The manager didn't take anything off evrn though it was a terrible exoerience that caused a loss of appetite for us both. name: Jacob Silcox
text: Love the place. Sit outside of ya can. Got a great view and they have fans out here. Love the catfish and the crab legs. Ask for Katy! She was an excellent server. Very attentive.

name: Sophea
text: Went here on a Monday night with my family of 3 at 7pm. It was not crowded at all.  There were 4 tables that were occupied by other customers.  Got our drinks quickly but waited 10 minutes before waitress came back to take our orders. But the food arrived quickly. I got the Bloody Mary (Alabama Eye Opener) and it was delicious despite the lack of spice.  I ordered the crab cake entree,  which came with 3 crab cakes, 2 hush puppies, maybe 1/4 cup of their shrimp slaw (coleslaw) and a side of choice (I got fried okra). Crab cake was good but the other items was your typical sides.  My husband got the crab cake burger with fries.  He says it was good and the bun tasted better than most hamburger buns he's had. My daughter got the fried shrimp basket with fries and your side choice  (cheese grits). And again it was typical fried seafood meal.  With other choices of seafood restaurants to choose from I'd support the local seafood business than this chain restaurants because the food was edible but not superior and the service was average.

name: James Lesesne
text: Not the best seafood I’ve had but the food was pretty decent. I would wish the cook would use some seasoning because the food was bland. Other than that; the waitress was outstanding and served very well.

name: Jenna Beattie
text: Visited this establishment for the 1st time and enjoyed our dinner. Server was nice, restaurant was not crowded (Thursday night), and the food was good. Definitely different from our favorite Shrimp Basket in Panama City Beach, FL, but still good. My son enjoyed his shrimp basket for dinner. And I enjoyed my shrimp and grits. Though I liked my shrimp and grits, I probably would not get it again. The shrimp was deliciously cooked, but the grits were not so great. Prices are expected because it's seafood. All in all, I would recommend to anyone in this area. Nothing negative to say about this restaurant.

name: T Jr.
text: 3.5 ⭐ The food was great, but for almost $14 I expected a bigger portion.  The onion rings were a little under cooked for my liking, tasted good though.  The place looks great, but I did not dine in.

name: Emily B
text: If I could give zero stars I would. Very disappointed. The best part of the meal was the coleslaw. The oysters were still very frozen with large ice chunks. The county boil was bland and watery. Even adding hot sauce couldn’t save the boil.   The service was nonexistent, refill on my drink no way.... very disappointed.

name: Robert Larson
text: This was my first time eating/getting anything from here and I must say I had a great customer experience. The staff was extremely friendly and they also do a great job of cleaning the tables as people leave. The food was hot, fresh, and delicious. I had gotten one of their overstuffed Po Boy shrimp sandwiches. I will definitely be coming back for sure.

name: Tim Hammond
text: Fantastic service and really good turn around. Food was hot and delicious. One of their best locations. All you can eat shrimp Wednesday and Sunday

name: Malcolm Hatcher
text: First time here and didn't realize it was part of a chain, we stopped in here for lunch and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us and was excellent. I got the chicken wrap and it was fabulous, I'm not sure what the sauce is, some type of tangy sweet wing sauce or something, but it was the bomb!!!!….if we didn't live so far away, we would come back for dinner, but I was traveling Columbus for business and if I have to go back I will hopefully check them out for dinner...Keep up the Great Work!!!!

name: Marrissa horton
text: Tonight we went and they were packed, however they made sure to come back and check as we waiting on our order. Waitress was very attentive and manger tonight was awesome. I even saw the manager help as the workers got more and more busy. I would highly recommend here!

name: Carly Akin
text: Food was really good. We had great service! Mary was such a great server, very attentive. The grilled shrimp platter is the best!! Definitely will be coming back!

name: Melanie Hunt
text: I've ordered; Redfish smothered, Blackened catfish, Cajun Shrimp, fried fish, and the  key lime pie. Everything is so Good!. Great servers, Great atmosphere, Great prices. Large portions. I Love going to the Shrimp Basket

name: Barry C Collyer
text: Food was good but no spice.  If you prefer your boiled shrimp with a spice or crab boil type flavor this is not your place.  Otherwise very good.

name: BryAnna Lighty
text: I came in for National key lime Pie Day (and got a FREE slice of key lime). I was very satisfied!! The food was amazing and the atmosphere was welcoming. They also have great specials on different days of the week. Shrimp Basket never disappoints!!!

name: Lydia Nicholson
text: This place is great. Love the food. Great staff.  Will be back. Make sure you ask for Lydia. She was on top of all our needs.

name: Chancy Rudd
text: We were pleasantly surprised. The food was excellent. Kids meals were free because of it being sunday. Santa Claus was there and very friendly as well. Kids loved it. We will be back.

name: Melissa Smith
text: Service was fantastic.  My waitress was very responsive to me.... checking up on my meal often.  Food was good.  I would have liked the shrimp and fish fried just a touch crisper.  Everything was served hot.  Condiments we're tasty.

name: salena M
text: Had an amazing experience at the Shrimp Basket. The food was amazing and the server definitely set the standard! She was extremely helpful and truly made my day! I believe her name was BryAnna and I would recommend her and this establishment for your next visit !!

name: Joni Johnson
text: Great service and good food!

name: xo. vaeh
text: The food there is delicious, but I don't like how they keep the disgestive tract in the shrimp ( The poop line basically ). It isn't harmful to disgest or anything, but it is a personal preferance.

name: Mark Kinser
text: I don't give many 5 stars for restaurants, but this one is deserved.  All food was excellent.  Especially the shrimp.  Service also made the visit so enjoyable.  Ambience is very nice as well.  All in all, a very happy customer.  Will be back as soon as possible

name: Christopher “Shinobi” Henderson
text: This place is really good. It is one of the top restaurants in Columbus, GA. They have friendly service, inside/outside seating. Some all you can eat options on a daily special of the week. Everyday is a different special. They have a range of grilled and healthy options to traditional friend seafood. The corn fritters are really sweet and soft and the fried crab claw is outstanding!

name: Brent “B & b Brickrails” Smith
text: If you like seafood its pretty good. Prices are fair. The building is small and not a lot of seating. I may go again if someone else wanted to go.

name: Dustin Retherford
text:
Customer service was fantastic. Got my drink, appetizer, and meal in a very timely manner.
Boom boom shrimp appetizer was excellent. Enough for two people. Could be a meal for one.
Shrimp tacos were good. Cabbage took over most of the taste, but was definitely fresh.

name: Kaska Howard
text: Lots of choices on the menu, freshly prepared food. Service a little slow.

name: Beverly HIll
text: The portion sizes are big, however the meal was disappointing.  The french fries were warm, not hot, and they were mediocre.  The hush puppies were tasty and small, the cole slaw was good.  My dinner companion felt the same about her meal.  Could be it was a bad day.  The server did a great job.

name: James Lackey (HeavyMetalChef)
text: Service is always good. Food has always been pretty good too. Love the crab claws. Not like eating seafood at the beach, but definitely acceptable for Columbus, GA.

name: Priscilla Thomas
text: Shrimp Basket is a family friendly restaurant with outside seating.  Our server Camryn was very friendly. The food was good and satisfying.

name: Lynn Moore
text:
This is the best friend shrimp we have ever eaten. Great outside with the fans and the mist of water!
Misty our server was absolutely amazing!!! She answered all of our questions!
I highly recommend this place!
