My dinner companion felt the same about her meal.  Could be it was a bad day.  The server did a great job.

name: Stephen Hill
text: AMAZING isn't a strong enough word. I want a Shrimp Basket location in upstate South Carolina so bad. The food was perfect from the first bite till the last. Just thinking about it has my mouth watering.

name: Christina Davis
text: It was alright. My waitress made sure to assist, however I didn't care for the fact that she didn't give me my change or rather correct change...not sure if she assumed I wasn't going to tip well or what.  But I prefer to have all of my change in hand and then I make the decision as to what I will leave ...if I had been in a mood I would've probably left her with just that, the change.  But overall the service was fine but the food wasn't impressive.  Different tastes for sure.

name: Bennie Gonzales
text: It's the first time my wife and I have eaten here. Everything was fantastic. This is definitely our new seafood stop. The prices are just right for the portions and taste of the food. The service was superb. We will be here again very soon.

name: Kari Harbuck
text: First time eating there and i enjoyed it. My server misty was awesome great food and great service from a lady with a very good personality.. will be back for sure

name: Torren Boyett [Student]
text: Awesome food! Awesome servers! Especially Brittany and Olivia!) Awesome management! Kaci was super helpful! THE BEST coastal margarita!!! Thank you for a wonderful lunch! Always a pleasure 😘

name: Will Hogg
text: Food was hot even with large party, waitress was very nice and asked the perfect amount of times if we needed anything (which is more than twice and less than 6 times in an hour IMO) when the check came we had someone else's order on our ticket, we pointed it out and it was corrected without hassle. Otherwise perfect place to get some hot seafood, lots of options even burger and chicken for people that don't like seafood that you might be bringing along.

name: Berniece Schamburg
text: Service was excellent. The food was hot and fresh!! We will be back.

name: Sandie Hardeman
text: Good food and GREAT service. Food portions were very small for the price. The corn fritter was good tasting, but smaller than a quarter.

name: Miss
text: Generous portions. Very down to earth environment. Great waitresses and service. Prices aren’t too bad. I will definitely come back.

name: Billy Harris
text: Very good service.  My wife's shrimp basket with new potatoes was very good.  White fish in my fish basket tastes okay, but had an odd texture.  I'll ask next time what kind of fish is it.  Steamed mussels we're good appetizer.

name: Nordia Felder
text: Shrimp basket is so good with excellent customer service. I love unlimited fish, shrimp, and clam Monday-Thursday.

name: Madhav Desai
text: Food is okay. The staff is nice and the environment is small, but cozy. They have a pretty decent selection of food and drinks. Everyone is different so I would definitely recommend checking out. You might love the place.

name: Bae Arthur
text: Good seafood. Cameron is the best waiter I've ever had!! Get it, dude.

name: Melanie Dorsey
text: Great place to eat and our waitress was amazing I don't remember her name.

name: Josh H
text: It was our first time there and everything we had was great! The Blackened Redfish with cream sauce was AMAZING! Service and management was exceptional! Very clean, beach themed restaurant. Can't wait to go back and try other items, esp on their all you can eat days (Sun thru Thur)!

name: Reina C
text: Service was great! Our waitress Liz was very friendly and checked back often. Food was very good. Will definitely be coming back!

name: Paul Burkett
text: Really good fried fish and shrimp. My wife,s corn and potatoes were not hot so no 5. Server was great, a little pricey but overall very good and we will definitely come back again. Yummy.

name: Amber W.
text: I dont eat seafood but i still love to come here for the Cajun chicken and the cheese grits. Actually, all the sides are pretty good. If you go on your birthday you get a free entree.

name: Milton Watts
text: Great food. We ate fried shrimp, crab claws, and red beans and rice.  All were excellent. Service was outstanding.

name: Derico Countryman
text: There was a bit of a wait,but the food was actually pretty good. They have some reasonable prices and a moderate selection of food.

name: Emily M.
text: Love this place! Great food, service, and prices (for the amount of food you get)!! Highly recommend.

name: Beatrice Hiner
text: I like the Shrimp Basket. Decent food but it is heavy and fried. My husband and I go a few times a year for something different. Very casual atmosphere.

name: Mark Eckman
text: Mrs Hightower 102 birthday today eating at her favorite place, the waitress made her feel very welcome and special, thank you

name: Alexander Dixon
text: Great friendly staff. Food was great. I had the shrimp and grilled catfish combo platter. Very good. It will be or should be illegal not to get the funnel cake fries.  OMG!

name: Nick Hammond
text:
Heads up military, no military discount here.

Been to a lot of Shrimp Baskets around the south east, and I think this one is the best I've been to so far. For an opening day, they've done exceptionally well. Everything is running so smoothly.
I had the blackened mahi mahi with shrimp étouffée and my wife had the BBQ burger. Both were great!

name: Latoya Diamond
text: One of my favorite seafood restaurants!!! I enjoyed the service and fresh seafood!! The staff is so sweet!! Great place to take the family.. Not really expensive but worth the money. Please check it out. You wont be disappointed

name: TIffany Hardamon
text: Food was awesome!!! Had a party of 6 and we all enjoyed everything!!! I Will definitely visit again!!! Lydia was very nice!

name: Gloria Duvall
text: Food was good but not exceptional.  Staff was friendly.  Although I didn't appreciate my waitress chasing after her toddler the whole time and forgetting "twice " to bring me what I asked for.  Very unprofessional.

name: Teresa Mehaffey
text: Food was really good. Drink was great. Wonderful service provided by our waitress, Essence.

name: Lisa m
text: First time we ate here my husband didn’t like his food and I liked it (I ordered fried seafood).  Second time we got the seafood boil for two.  Food was very bland and shrimp was so rubbery and overcooked.  The sausage and potatoes is all we ate. Seafood queso is great just doesn’t come with enough chips.

name: Gene Taylor
text: When I sometimes come down to Columbus to take photographs of River rafters, this is my place for shrimp.  It is well seasoned though the portions of kind of small for what you paid, but it is good.

name: Wendy Henderson
text: Excellent experience, food, and service! Our server, Essence, was bubbly and efficient. Ask for her if you visit the Columbus location.

name: Eric Ingram
text: Misty was an awesome server. Atmosphere was really laid back and calming, and the banana colada was just right and refreshing after a long morning. Thanks Misty for your great service!

name: Briana Saul
text: Enthusiastic servers are rare in Columbus, but this restaurant seems to have them all. Great food too.

name: Maranda Xiong
text: The food was alright. Cajun shrimp was definitely not Cajun hot. Corn fritters and hush puppies were delicious. Sweet tea was amazing. Our waitress was great; keeping drinks filled etc. The reason for the 2 stars is because of the price versus food quality. If the price were lower, I would have given more stars. Isn't worth the Red Lobster prices.

name: Candence Crawford
text: Came to dinner with my sweet friend Carrie. We had the best server named Chris. He had a great smile and personality. The food was really good! I highly recommend this place for seafood.

name: Kennan Ducey
text: Great patio experience +better than just good food (for what it is/where we're located; in regards to pescatarians who don't live by the sea). Highly reccomend the key lime pie! Made for a very pleasant birthday celebration.

name: Aisha C
text: I would love to give it a 5 star but the water wasn't good. The service and our waitress was amazing. The manager was great! I appreciate all of you!!!!

name: Misty VanBibber
text: If I could give negative stars I would. After ordering and waiting more than 30m we were told that manager was coming out, 20m later still no manager. When we decided to let someone know we were leaving manger shows up and stating our food was being given to us at no charge. We polited declined and left. Its sad that in less than 3 yrs this place has dropped so much.

name: Stephen Watkins
text:
We went during peak time on a Friday night and we were seeted immediately. My wife ordered a frozen concoction from the bar and it was fantastic. Tasted like something straight from the beach. We got some fried pickle chips for an appetizer which were amazing. I got the whitefish basket and my wife ordered the grilled shrimp platter. Both of our orders were cooked to perfection and came out in what I consider a timely fashion. On top of the food being cooked just right and timely, it was also delicious and plentiful. I couldn't even finish all my food.

This was our first time there and will not be our last.

name: Patricia Kauffmann
text: It was an awesome experience! Our waitress was gracious and helpful, and the food was fantastic!!!

name: Brian Hughes
text: Food was good.  But, it was quite without a doubt the smallest piece of catfish I have ever been served.  It was the catfish platter too.  When he served it, I actually thought he brought out an appetizer by mistake.

name: mary rau
text: The Service was good. I would have given a 5 Star but the Servings were REALLY small. I ordered a Platter and wow!!!

name: Meagan Oswald
text: Friendly service but the food was a bit too greasy

name: Joseph McCarty
text: The service was good and the food was quickly prepared.  The restrooms were clean. I had the catfish which had a strong flavor.  My wife had chicken which was somewhat tough.  The price was also a bit high for the setting and the food quality.

name: Gale Taylor
text: I always enjoy eating here. The staff is awesome and service on point. The fried shrimp and whitefish is always tasty, lightly breaded just the way I like it.

name: Amanda F
text: Good atmosphere. Staff seemed nice. Food was good, but could've been better. Most of the food seemed bland (cheese grits, coconut shrimp) and I don't like that they put  shrimp in their coleslaw. Hush puppies and corn fritters are pretty good there and the Pineapple and vodka drink I had was good.

name: I'm Cathy McCarty
text: The tail on grilled shrimp and rice is awesome! The service is great too. Kylee was an outstanding waitress.

name: biddysere
text:
Great seafood!
I always eat here when in town. If there was only one in dothan! ,(hint,hint!)

name: Janet Goodwin
text: I enjoyed the meal. It was very filling and delicious.  The manager and employees are always very courteous and provide a comfortable environment.

name: Dominic Medico
text:
Service can be a little slow at times but the service is great when they do interact. So far, the food I have tried has met or exceeded expectations. I bring my 10 yr old and he is already planning the next visit.
I definitely recommend you give it a try.

name: Bruce Thompson
text: Excellent service and food. Great relaxing atmosphere. Enjoyed it all.

name: Roger Denny
text: Great food, Great Service and thanks for my Free Birthday meal. Our group will be back.

name: Cassie Williams
text:
Went just tonight and not sure if we will be back... while it wasnt the WORST experience we've ever had the food was very bland. I got the peel and eat shrimp and my husband got the catfish poboy. I was expecting sweet corn on the cob, and you could tell it came out of the freezer. My shrimp was like rubber, and the new potatoes had no seasoning on them. The sweet tea tasted like dirty water. The best tasting thing I ordered was a stuffed crab. The flavor on that was great, texture not so much. Very mushy.

Just all around a bland experience. This was our 1st visit. ☹ Not worth $40 for the both of us.

name: robert smith
text: We always enjoy our visit to Shrimp Basket...and more so when we get Chris as our server.  He always insures that we get the best possible service and makes sure my oysters are fresh, cold and of good size.  Also a shout out to Kendrick the manager....who has on several occasions stopped at our table to ask if we were enjoying our meals and if we needed anything.  Good value, good service and quality food....thank you Chris and Kendrick for your service.

name: Donna Walker
text: My husband and I just had the worst seafood we have had. Oysters were so undercooked that the breading would not even stay on them. Stuffed crab was overcooked on outside and gooey on the inside......the only thing in the entire seafood basket that we were able to eat was the shrimp and they were not great. Not a pleasant experience at all.

name: Clara Dickerson
text: Food was great!! Service was even better. Fast and so nice

name: Jeff Weaver
text:
First trip 30 + min wait for food. Cajun shrimp bland, no flavor and very small. Good beer prices & nice server (Camron) I think.
J

name: lori thorp
text: Fried crab claws have too much shell.  Good food just wrong menu item.  Good coleslaw and my husband had fried oysters which we're really good.  Nice atmosphere, say outside.

name: Jani Phillips
text: Candice is the best waitress they have here. She always goes out of her way to ensure we have an enjoyable experience. The food is always fresh too.

name: Debbie J
text: My first time and it was good. The fries had a little too much black pepper but it was all really good. The waitress and manager were super friendly.

name: Mark Laster
text: It was a nice clean restaurant friendly service. The food was good & hot when served!! The food had had a good taste also!! Enjoyed the experience!!!

name: Dena Gunn
text: Best fried pickles..ever. Service was great.  Soooooo glad they expanded from Alabama.

name: Sylvia Stafford
text: Today I got an order to go. Fried shrimp basket with side of cole slaw and loaded potato salad. It came with hush puppies and a corn fritter also. The shrimp, coleslaw and corn fritter were good. The potato salad had a suspicious fuzzy feel to it, don't know if it was the skin left on the potatoes or not. The hushpuppies were very overcooked so not worth eating either. Overall the shrimp was the best so I guess I got what I wanted but not worth the price.

name: Old Email
text: I ate at the Columbus Georgia shrimp basket at 7:35pm.  I had shrimp etoufee and shrimp and grits.  Both were delicious.

name: Sally Moore
text: Reminds me of Captain D's but way more expensive. For the price, food should be better. Tastes like all fried foods cooked in same oil, all tastes same. Have been 3 times and will not go back.

name: Devin Bricker
text: Great food and drinks.  Excellent service

name: Genny Basch
text: Enjoyed our visit here last night! We had a large group and there were a couple of other large groups in at the same time - the service was a tad slow but completely understandable given the circumstances. Appetizers and drinks came out quickly and the food was great, as has been our experience here!

name: william Risinger
text: Food was good, service sucked, that's why only 3 stars

name: Brian G. Perser, Sr.
text: Great service. Good food.

name: Crystal Hughes
text: The food was so Hot and Fresh! I ordered coconut shrimp for the appetizer and the shrimp and oyster basket with greens! The best greens and fried oysters I've ever eaten. I will definitely be back. All the food was delicious. Well worth the money.

name: DaVon Pridgen
text: Food was amazing. Wish I would have taken a photo. But enjoyed the shrimp. And the service was also great!

name: Brannon Tharpe
text: Good food. Laid back atmosphere.

name: Jon Gutowski
text: Fast service. Hot and very good food. We visit often and usually have a great time. There new in town so there still learning. Highly recommended.

name: MLG Em
text:
Went here to eat yesterday (9/1/2018) and I did not like it. Family ordered some food, but I wasn't really that hungry so I ordered fried pickle chips. They were SUPER spicy for pickles, I mean fried pickles.  They didn't even taste good.

Also, the cups were SUPER strong with whatever strawberry scented detergent that was used, so much so that the taste of my Dr pepper was affected.

All in all, I wouldn't eat here... 🙅

name: Tina Jones
text: Food is good. They have great lunch specials

name: Raymond Cheshire
text: My waitress was very friendly and made sure I had everything I needed. And my oyster basket was great!

name: Brenda Hughes
text: Great food, cold beer and great service

name: Reynolds Cheney
text: Good food and fun atmosphere. Tea was a little bitter but the Boom Boom burrito was fantastic.

name: Curtrina Strozier
text: We had a awsome waitress and the food was delicious!

name: Sandy Baxley
text: Food is consistently good but even though they were not all that busy, we had to wait longer than we usually do for our food. When it's all you can eat, the servers should be quicker to refill the baskets of food.

name: Chris Everidge
text: Very nice first visit. We went for lunch and sat at the bar. The food was good and the staff were excellent. Definitely gonna go back.

name: Bert Reed
text: Excellent food and service. Went back today and ate inside this time. Service was excellent and the food was awesome. My wife is not a very big eater but she ate ALL of her shrimp and only had a few fries left. We'll be back no question about it.

name: vDrip Vincent
text: Everything was all good until I discovered hair in my food.

name: Ethan Goodman
text: Good food, great service and huge portions. Small restaurant and never so busy the wait staff can't handle their tables in a great way. They know the menu and can answer your questions if you don't know what you want. Highly recommended.

name: J “REDMG” E
text: Absolutely amazing. Cozy atmosphere with wonderful staff. The food is incredible and always consistent.

name: Justin McCarty
text: Best oysters in town! Great service.

name: henry matchen
text: The inside has that low country waterfront feel you get at some oceanfront restaurants. The server was nice and happy to answer questions and recommend dishes. The food arrived quickly and was as we ordered. The food was very tasty. The four of us each ordered a different dish, and everyone was very pleased with the taste and preparation. Excellent hush puppies and fried okra. We'll be back to have the low country boil.

name: CJ
text: Good food and prices... just always got inside the restaurant. They need a new AC unit.

name: Maurice Chambliss
text: The Monday all you can eat white fish is great can't get enough of it. The food is just as fresh and good as the baskets down on the coast.

name: Germaine Peoples
text: My mom and I love the food and the waitresses are awesome.

name: Judy Williams
text: The food was very good. Waitress was on top of everything. Glass never went empty. Decent prices.

name: Becky Thomas
text: Wonderful food and service.  White fish and catfish were both delicious!

name: Savannah Haile
text: Great food! Friendly and very welcoming staff, with wonderful service!!

name: Jessica Fairchild
text: There atmosphere was great. The fried pickles had a lot of flavor, but when I got to my crab claws they had no seasoning on them. It tasted like it was dunked in flour and fried. No salt. No Creole. For $16 I expect a lot of flavor. I'm not sure if they just forgot to put seasoning in the batter, but I was not impressed with the food.

name: kathy Thompson
text: First time going, I really liked the food, service wasn't that great. But it was extremely busy so maybe that played alot.

name: Shon Centofante
text: Redfish is so good! My favorite meal

name: River Rodriguez
text:
This place is absolutely wonderful. I have never been to a place where both the food is delicious and the customer service is excellent. Our server Tera was the best and she has exceptional customer service skills.

I had the burger and it was very delicious. My friends had the fish and they said it wasn't greasy at all like other seafood restaurants.

I ended up buying their specialty hot sauce because it was so good. Everything was so good that next time I am in town I will defiantly be coming back.

name: Cindy Helms
text: My husband and i went in to the Shrimp Basket in Columbus Ga, tonight to get something  good to eat. We got seated and asked the Manager about a item on the menu. He answer our question and then walked away that was fine he told us what we wanted to know. But after that it was like we where not there, no waitress came to take our order. We sat there for a good 30minutes, I asked another waiter  if anyone  was going to wait on us and she looked around like well maybe. This restaurant was not busy and there where waitress walking around everywhere. When my husband asked if anyone was going to help us and the lady was dum founded my husband just said Let us help you out we are going somewhere else to  eat.That we did Thanks Rosehill for a fine dinner. 54.00 for dinner 12.00 tip that Shrimp Basket could of had.  I hope this reaches management so you can fix the problem.  Don't think I will be back anytime soon.

name: Lydia Nicholson
text: This place is great... love it.

name: Nancy Loofboro
text: Great food and service.

name: Mark Wells
text: Nice staff, Going to make this a weekly spot to go and eat Oysters!

name: Debby Forde
text: ALWAYS good food and service. Love this place. I can go here and pretend I'm at one of their locations at the beach when I don't have time to get to the beach.

name: Pat Slovokia
text: A pleasant surprise. Being from FL, and inland seafood restaurant doesn't sound appealing. But, this place rocks. We were there on AUCE fish day, catfish or white fish. Outstanding and plentiful. Good visit, you won't be disappointed.

name: Charmaine Harris
text: Very clean, staff friendly and welcoming, and food was delicious

name: Brandon Purvis
text: Overpriced.  Been here twice. Won't be back. Service is good. Food is mediocre.

name: Larry Blandin
text: Great experience. Food was good

name: Samuel Gonzalez
text: Before I ordered from this establishment, I read the reviews and notice that quite a few people complained about the lack of flavor and seasoning in the food. Despite my better judgment I decided to still order from this establishment. I must say that they were right about the lack of flavor of the Shrimp Basket restaurant. This was my first time eating at this restaurant and it will be my last. The chicken tenders I ordered for my kids had no flavor what's so ever. The popcorn shrimp had an awful after taste and the tarter sauce tasted like mayo. You are better off eating at the Red Lobster, especially for the amount of money that you will spend. Its a waste of time and money. My recommendation to management is change the way your seasoning your food, and add more flavor to your recipe.

name: Sabrina Thomas
text: I ordered the sample platter that had oysters, fish (white or catfish) The oysters were the best part and because I didn’t eat the rest Since I was full, ordered an oyster appetizer to take home. The oysters were A bit smaller than the ones I had received on my platter. They were all very small, 2 were just clumps of bread, I ate one and it was like a hunk of rubber or like chewing squid. Service was good, sort of slow but they were slammed, but friendly and helpful.

name: Erika Lockette
text: Food and service is ALWAYS GREAT.

name: Kristin Watkins
text: Great food and great service. My only complaint is all the other people complaining for no reason and the fact that I left that I didn’t get the free coupons that the great waitress left one of the complaining patrons. :-)  the prices are what is expected when you go out to eat. It was about the same price if you go out to any other restaurant. Have ate at several shrimp baskets locations and will continue to go.

name: Clemmie Ross
text: The portions was on the small side  but the food was big on taste and the service was excellent

name: richard thompson
text: Food was good fast service and very attentive servers.

name: mike72uga
text: Worst restaurant service I’ve ever had in Columbus and I’ve lived here my entire life. Waited 29 minutes for my food before I cancelled my order. Restaurant was about half full of customers on a Friday night. The first visit wasn’t much different but this visit done me in. After canceling the order never heard a peep out of a manager. Real professionals. Go across the street to Mellow mushroom or ezells instead. Much better.

name: Ben Parsons
text: Excellent service and food. I enjoyed the blackened white fish with a side of hush puppies and green beans. This was my first time dining and I look forward to my next visit.

name: Zack Hamsley
text: Excellent food. We had blackened and Cajun shrimp that was delicious. Great service too!

name: toni whitaker
text: Great Atmosphere,  Customer Service Excellent,  Food Cooked to Order

name: Marie Marwitz
text: Good food, clean, good service.

name: Doc Magilicuty
text:
Fried shrimp were completely devoid of flavor, clam strips were over cooked and rubbery. Potatoes were microwaved and the okra was cooked through.
This was a major disappointment and we will stick with Rose Hill sea food. Service was good , staff was friendly. But a pretty face doesn't make a turd taste any better.

name: Jeremy Silva
text: It looked like I was walking into a beach-side restaurant. The wait staff was friendly, and the portions were quite large for what our party ordered. My red beans and rice was tasty, and my wife enjoyed her popcorn shrimp. The grilled cheese for my daughter that was given so much praise turned out to be nothing more than a burger bun inside out and fried like garlic bread. Overall though, it was a great experience.

name: kim smith
text: Some really good fried oysters and shrimp!

name: Tonya Ford Dale
text: Everything was great. Our server could have been more attentive, but others made up for it. Really good food! No need to dress up. You can be "regular" here.

name: Tori White
text: Awesome food,good atmosphere,and wonderful service I can't wait to return.

name: Jeff Sparks
text: Regardless of location that we visit the food is always the very best you could eat really do enjoy going to this restaurant regardless of what state or what town it is in

name: Glenda Lewis
text: Freshly cooked well seasoned food. Very good customer service. The manager asked customers how was everything. Will return.

name: Aaron Cooke
text: excellent food, service is great, a bit pricey but worth it

name: Kim Pilcher
text: Nice atmosphere.  Great service.  Not the coast but was impressed.

name: Clara Dewhart
text: I love this place so much and I've never had a problem with the workers or the food. But today the food was not good all of the shrimp tasted really fishy.

name: Kim Jones
text: The food here is great and so are is there service. Ive been to two shrimp basket and the experience was wonderful. I drove a hour and some change just to go eat there. Love it recommend you try it.

name: Jessica Walker
text: The staff is always friendly Wendy is a great waitress & the manager is wonderful. He's probably the best manager I've ever met.

name: Wanda Rodriguez
text: Delicious! And the servers were fun. Great night. 🙂

name: Rachel Elliott
text: Starting from the beginning: location is perfect, parking was not a problem and was well-lit, we were greeted with smiles at the door, the place is very comfortable, decor and ambiance were perfect, servers were perfect, food was amazing, prices were just right, the restaurant itself was large enough to accomodate without being so large you do not receive the attention you need. I have NO complaints about Shrimp Basket, and it is our new fave place for family and couples dining. You can bring your pet to enjoy outside dining which was also very nice. I urge everyone to patronize this restaurant!!!

name: Maria Evans
text: The food wasn't the best and server never came to fill up our drinks 😔

name: Bevelyn Herndon
text: Great food and friendly service

name: Tori White
text: Awesome food,good atmosphere,and wonderful service I can't wait to return.

name: Clemmie Ross
text: The portions was on the small side  but the food was big on taste and the service was excellent

name: Catherine Stanton-Schmoll
text: Server was great.  Very attentive to our table.  The shrimp slaw and corn nugget are good.  Grilled chicken and sweet tea were perfect.

name: Tracie Nunya
text: The catfish and onion rings are so good here. The service was spot on. Staff was very friendly. I highly recommend this place.

name: Alicia Day
text: Fish was fantastic, light and fluffy, not greasy or fried hard. Shrimp tasted fresh and delicious. Cheese grits were very good. Broccoli was just okay, hushpuppies were small and fried hard, could do without them. Hubby loved the red beans and rice. Variety of options for a family. Wish they had a few more healthy sides or didn't charge extra for not the greatest broccoli. Service was fantastic!! Worth the wait for us!

name: Kim Pilcher
text: Nice atmosphere.  Great service.  Not the coast but was impressed.

name: Robert Bessinger
text: Went there this past weekend for my birthday. Was very disappointed, ordered shrimp and fish basket. Portions were small and the fish was very thin and over cooked to almost being like rubber. On the other hand the fries were under cooked. We had ordered an appetizer and it came out with the meal only after asking waitress about it. Would  had gone to Captain’s place had I known better.

name: Katie Evans
text: Went here at not a busy time of the night. There were a ton of tables empty inside and out. We asked to sit outside. Hostess said it would be about 10-15 minutes to get seated. Waited outside for 35 minutes and watched multiple people who arrived after us get seated. We left.

name: Eric Woodall
text:
My Mother and I eat there for the first time. Staff was great. Food came faster than expected. I got the Shrimp and grits. It was ok. The shrimp were grilled nice but grits had little flavor. Not worth 13.00 I had better for less. Mom got the fried seafood basket. The fish she gave me to try you could hardly chew. Overcooked with very little fish inside the batter. Her oysters were overcooked barley tasted like oyster. She had 1 scallop. The shrimp was good. The 16.00 dollar price was high for the quality.
I will come back to try the boiled or grilled dishes. Benefit of the doubt. Maybe just a bad day.

name: Ms Lady
text: We went on a Thursday, the waitress was very friendly. We had the all you can eat catfish. I will definitely be going back again..

name: eileen goodman
text: Food was good. A bit pricey and a small amount of food for the price

name: Nick Rourk
text: Always a pleasure when we eat here. Staff is amazing as well as the food. Ask for Frank he's the best.

name: Adrian
text: Awesome food and great service!

name: Rhonda Walker
text: Wr were greeted promptly and with a smile. Our waiter Warren was the absolute best! His energy was off the charts great. He made us feel like we we're old buddies. I had the all you can eat white fish blackened, new potatoes and corn😊 Let's just say I'm a Beast when I have not had breakfast 😂. Can't wait to come back

name: Ms Lady
text: We went on a Thursday, the waitress was very friendly. We had the all you can eat catfish. I will definitely be going back again..

name: MomPop Jones
text: The food was great and the service was outstanding, we sat at the bar and not one employee passed us by without addressing us and asking if everything was ok or if we needed anything. Will definitely recommend going there. Great food and great service.

name: Mona Gilbert
text: Awesome the food was great and the staff is great. Food fresh and hot.

name: Valinda Canion
text: Service was great, good and drinks are awesome. Love it

name: Myra Pickens
text: Tasty! Always a hit. I love the grilled white fish, red beans and rice, and turnip greens.  Their tartar is made on site and delicious!  I moved to Columbus two months ago and have already eaten there so many times I've lost count.

name: Lemuel Powell
text: I ordered oysters and they was big...awesome place to eat..

name: stephanie lenderman- hice
text: Service was amazing!!! The shrimp, fried whitefish, and clam were also amazing. Not greasy or soggy. The tuna dip while really good is your basic tuna salad that you can make at home with a can of tuna. The burger is just an overcooked frozen patty. Their idea of cheeseburger was to sprinkle a little shredded cheese on top. I couldn't get through more than a 1/4 of it. But I guess that's what I get for getting a burger at a seafood place. Over all happy and will be back.

name: Angel Kirkland
text: The cheese curds were very good and the shrimp skewers were excellent but the service was not so good...the waitress seemed a little up tight but I guess everyone is entitled to a bad day..

name: Paul Stamm
text: Great service, Very good food! Highly recommend

name: Raekeymia L
text: Great food and awesome service, thanks Tamecia!

name: Taste-a-Lily Cupcakes
text: Drinks were weak, but the food was delicious. Skip the lobster claws. They were well seasoned, but virtually meatless.

name: delilah hardin
text: My Dad loved this place till he had to kill the salt.

name: Danny Combs
text: I wasnt impressed, I ordered the seafood basket. The atmosphere was Quiet, not many people present.

name: Bobby Lumpkin
text: Great food great service. Wait staff was attentive without being annoying. The food was cooked to perfection. We will definitely be back.

name: Catherine Stanton-Schmoll
text: Server was great.  Very attentive to our table.  The shrimp slaw and corn nugget are good.  Grilled chicken and sweet tea were perfect.

name: La Vida Loca
text: First time going today and it was decent.  Had the fish and shrimp basket with red beans and rice.   Five stars because it was an overall good experience, between the service and taste of my food.

name: Donna Dexter
text: Had  the Low Country Boil for two, it was very tasty and a lot of food. We shared 8 or 10 shrimp and several pieces of sausage with a third person and still couldn't eat it all.  Lunch tomorrow!  Yummy #

name: Rick Cantrell
text:
The best reasonably priced seafood in Columbus.
Good menu selection.

name: Robert Bessinger
text: Went there this past weekend for my birthday. Was very disappointed, ordered shrimp and fish basket. Portions were small and the fish was very thin and over cooked to almost being like rubber. On the other hand the fries were under cooked. We had ordered an appetizer and it came out with the meal only after asking waitress about it. Would  had gone to Captain’s place had I known better.

name: Thomas McInvale
text: Good service, good food

name: Katie Evans
text: Went here at not a busy time of the night. There were a ton of tables empty inside and out. We asked to sit outside. Hostess said it would be about 10-15 minutes to get seated. Waited outside for 35 minutes and watched multiple people who arrived after us get seated. We left.

name: josh henderson
text: The food was great as well as the drinks the  host management and whoever made the food really good place to go!!!!!!!

name: KELVIN THOMAS
text: Loved the great " all you can eat shrimp " deal on Tuesdays !! Plus the bartender was Awesome,  adventurous and delightful to be served by . My beautiful wife  , Odie Thomas choose this place to eat for her Birthday.  The environment was great ! The Oysters were wonderful and tasty per: My Wife  lol . My wife and me both reccomend this place too eat and have a few drinks .

name: Scotty Donaldson
text: Great food and always hot. Great customer service! Never a negative experience here.

name: Lacy Harden
text: I love the low country boil for 2. So much food for the price. Best deal on the menu. Drinks are a little weak.

name: Sharon Payne
text: Wonderful food and service. Always love coming here

name: Christopher Sharpe
text: Good food great staff great price i believe our server camden is the best when i m back in town will definitely come back keep up the good work

name: Narada Eady
text: Establishment was clean and the staff was friendly however the food was unseasoned not tasteful and you can tell that is a franchise business. The wait wasn't bad either I believe we waited for about two minutes. However I would rather wait a little longer for a better tasting dish

name: Ellen McCall
text: Shrimp Basket  food good but pricey

name: M Jessica Lee-burgett
text: OK can anyone say best oysters EVER..but please take off 2 bucks it kills my pocket book.. I drove by n keep coming in for those amazing oysters they have great fish ,the rice and beans could use more soul,n gumbo is not full of flavor no corn .I think so neon needs to put thir foot in it .cause this place can be more amazing ,the owner is so nice he's not like regular owners who aren't around he's there busing n serving it's good to have this place in Columbus ..go eat

name: Des Gangler
text: I have been there twice now with my family and both times we sat outside and the service is terrible. We were completely ignored and only got a waitress because she felt bad that no one was going to serve our table and even said so. The excuse was that it was so busy. Plenty of other waiters and waitresses came by and didn't even say anything or bother to help us and with the all you can eat fish it was 15 minutes to just get 2 more pieces as a refill, part of the order was forgotten constantly and it just felt like it was a hassle and a bother for them to come outside and do their job. The food is alright when you actually get it and if it is still hot and it is well priced, but if you want good service and to actually enjoy the whole going out experience this is not the place.

name: Raven Stokes
text: I placed a to go order and waited about 30 minutes. While waiting, I observed the absence of hair nets all around and the only gloves I seen were on the guys who were preparing raw oysters. My food came out and my bill was about $42 for 3 catfish and shrimp baskets. I handed over my card then opened my plate...for the amount of money spent, the portions are lacking. The food was okay, but I've had better.

name: Paula Romano
text: I love this place. They have great food and wonderful customer service.

name: Sissy Awakened
text: Inedible. Bland.  To their credit they offered to remake the food.  I declined... time.  We were leaving full plates.  Did not offer to cancel bill.

name: Danielle Kitchens
text: The food looks delicious, but its definitely not what you expect!!! The food is expensive and you barely get food!! Smells good though.

name: Linda Southard
text: I didn't eat the food there because I don't like the way they cook it I was there with friends. My husband got the cajun catfish and for the price he paid and amount fish he got it wasn't worth it, plus he said he said it wasn't a good cajun spice it was very salty instead.

name: Melanie Friesen
text: Lots of food! Great price for the qty & taste!

name: Alicia Day
text: Fish was fantastic, light and fluffy, not greasy or fried hard. Shrimp tasted fresh and delicious. Cheese grits were very good. Broccoli was just okay, hushpuppies were small and fried hard, could do without them. Hubby loved the red beans and rice. Variety of options for a family. Wish they had a few more healthy sides or didn't charge extra for not the greatest broccoli. Service was fantastic!! Worth the wait for us!

name: Kim Spivey
text: It was pretty good a little wait and not a lot of food for money but had coupon

name: K
text:
1. Not hot water in bathroon
2. No soap in bathroom
3. Dinner, steamed shrimp, potatoes and corn on the cob all Cold.
Manager shucking oysters in a sink with No ice to keep oysters cool. Zero ice. BEWARE.

name: FHHD Ministry
text: The food was very tasty and the service was excellent and friendly .

name: Kyle Robertson
text: The food was great.

name: BLAZER KUN
text: Expensive but damn good food. I didn't have a single complaint about my food!

name: nick centofante
text: Very good service would definitely recommend to a friend

name: Fletcher Graymane
text: Great experience. The to go area is small, yet suffices well for placing and picking up only. The cashier was exceptionally courteous and I honestly feel she deserves more credit for her knowledge of the menu and over all welcoming demeanor. The only quandry I have lies in the price as to the portions. It's not an everyday kind of food. It was quality and I will eat there again soon. Not the place for cheap seafood, but honestly, real seafood ought to cost their prices, so fair enough.

name: Jeffrey Stolpa
text: Good menu, good service, good food.

name: Keith Haines
text: Really really really great food! Loved it

name: Connie Baldwin
text: Food was great, wait time for service, a little lacking.

name: Plush Hair & Beauty Salon
text: My fiance and I went last weekend for my birthday. We got the shrimp boil with the potatoes sausage and corn we were highly disappointed because all of the food was cooked separately.. and did not have a seafood taste at all !!!! What's the point?..lol  We are going to go back again and give it another try. Try something completely different next time. Our waitress was sweet though

name: Chris McCalla
text: Service is excellent, and the food's good, however it is not cheap! Four of us and it was almost $80. Tacos are $13. A poboy is around  $10. Some may say that's the new average. I feel it's overpriced.  Just my opinion.

name: John Rufus
text: Service was ok.... food was horrible and over priced. This place has fallen off big time since it opened

name: Michael Brunson, Sr.
text: We enjoyed it. It was like being at the beach food wise. Well, there was no sand or sea, but, the food was good.

name: Breezy’s World
text: I really enjoyed my visit the food was delicious and our waiter,Brittany provided excellent customer service with a smile

name: Odie Thomas
text: Birthday dinner sat at the bar great service from Oliver. Ty do much enjoyed!

name: Carter Manderson
text: Food was good a little bit pricey

name: L Bailey
text: Tried the fried catfish with fries and hush puppies. Food was hot and tasty. Service was exceptional.

name: Odie Thomas
text: Birthday dinner sat at the bar great service from Oliver. Ty do much enjoyed!

name: Michael Brunson, Sr.
text: We enjoyed it. It was like being at the beach food wise. Well, there was no sand or sea, but, the food was good.

name: Sissy Awakened
text: Inedible. Bland.  To their credit they offered to remake the food.  I declined... time.  We were leaving full plates.  Did not offer to cancel bill.

name: Kim Spivey
text: It was pretty good a little wait and not a lot of food for money but had coupon

name: Melanie Friesen
text: Lots of food! Great price for the qty & taste!

name: kristina Gibson
text: My clam strips tasted plan and had a rubbery texture.. My grandfathers catfish tasted like white fish and was under cooked..  Wasn't worth $30.00 server was nice though

name: Larry Williams
text: Not worth the trip. Very over priced for the small amount you are served. Fries were cold and was told that it would be 15 minutes to get some fresh ones. Only had a few minutes to get my food and get back on the road. About as friendly as a bed of snakes. 👎

name: Jessica Thetford
text: I took my Grandmother there because she love fried crab claws! Food was excellent, service was excellent!! I did have a problem with a customer though, I have a 2 year old and he was being very active and she gave me a couple dirty looks, 😂😂😂, besides that it was a great experience!!!!!

name: Paul Price
text: We eat here 2 to 3 times a week.  I always have gave it a 5 star rating  until this week. My son  has fish allergies so he always get chicken with substitute the slaw which has fish products in it. They said that he had to get the slaw so we had to leave it for them to trash it. You would think they would consider people fish allergies if we did not ask he would have to the hospital.  We told waitress that. She said nothing she could do it is a new policy.  SO IF YOU GET THE SLAW IT HAS CRAB MEAT IN IT.

name: Jonathan Offthat
text: The Budweiser was hot. The coconut skrimp was great🧜‍♂️

name: Deborah Stewart
text: Great service, shrimp was delicious, hot when arrived at our table. Ice cold adult beverages!

name: Keshia W.
text: Never a disappointment when me n my family eats there. The food is hot, fresh, and tasty and very fulfilling. You really get ur money worth when eating here. Mondays and Thursdays all you can eat whiting or catfish......my fav is the shrimp basket.

name: Sharon Kennard
text: .Will never go back again food was awful.

name: Bob M
text: Great food .The staff was great.

name: Terra Corbett
text: Always seems very busy but the food is good. Good service.

name: Ashlee Tillett
text: The food could be better but an inland location can't be guaranteed to have fresh seafood. Dining inside seems very dark, crammed and uncomfortable. Dining outside is more relaxing with misting fans and better seating.

name: Tia Jones
text: Horrible service, waitess are slack, didn't even get service or food but glad I didn't, horrible service=horrible food!!!!! no money wasted😁....wish there was and option for no stars very unprofessional👎🏾👎🏾👎🏾

name: CJ
text: Essence is a very hard worker! She needs a raise! She was the ONLYone working in that place... other staff need to watch and learn from her!

name: Barry Tharpe
text: Food was great, I was very surprised more people wasn't their.

name: detric cummings
text: Needed some good  seafood. This place rocks!

name: janice smith
text: The food was very good! The service was nice, the inside looked good, everything was awsome! We are definitely coming here more often!! :D

name: Connie Waits
text: Fabulous food. Great variety. Fresh large hot oysters with only a little cornmeal breading.  Don't understand the bad reviews.  I am a foody and Very Picky.

name: Denise Brown
text: Food was ok not worth the price. Probably won’t go back anytime soon. Customer service was good.

name: Karlton Haloo
text: Awesome food, atmosphere is great.

name: Jeffrey Pilkinton
text: It's a great place to eat and it is my favorite place to get seafood now. Prices are reasonable for the food portions too.

name: Steven Mills
text: Good food, good prices

name: Adam Martin
text: Great food, but FANTASTIC hot sauce.

name: Kimberly McGee
text: Good food and nice staff. Also good prices. Very satisfied customer:)

name: David Sauls
text: Get there early.  They open at 11:00 and by 11:30 there is no parking (except for Columbus Police, who park illegally as usual).  It is new and the locals are eager to try it out.  For a test run, I got the seafood platter.  It is very good value.  The fried shrimp were perfection, true gulf shrimp.  Oysters OK (slightly over done), crab cake had little meat but was very tasty.  Hushpuppies and slaw were very good.  The fish was so bland that my cat turned down the leftovers.  Service was excellent and the management was ever present and involved.  My home is on the Gulf of Mexico and I work temporarily in Columbus.  This is serious seafood, just stay away from the whitefish filler.

name: Rachael Rowe
text: The staff is super friendly. I'm not big on fried, but the shrimp etouffee is wonderful! The fried pickles are the only thing I love there that is fried.

name: Tigger 5
text: Good food just cost a lot

name: Ashley Bruce
text: Great food, awesome service! Nice people.

name: Gernaro Jones
text: Good service, good good

name: Scotty Donaldson
text: Good food for a quick bite. Customer service was ok.

name: Tara Simmons
text: My first time and it was delicious food was hot fresh and fast, but the best part of our experience was the server. Leyban was amazing! She was upbeat attentive and just a real pleasure! We will be back!

name: Brittany Baker
text: Good food and good service

name: Sandra Taylor
text: Great food.  Great service.

name: Ernestine Young
text: Victoria was great! Ask for her when you go!

name: Letriese Byrd
text: Got take out and it was amazing. Great service and establishment as well.

name: Naomi Stephens
text: The portions are extremely small, wont be going back. The food was seasoned properly just not enough.

name: JT Brayboy
text: Good food and great services

name: Powell Smith
text: Really good food! Service was friendly and fast. Try the blackened redfish over rice and the red beans and rice!

name: Danielle Miller
text: Yuck. Burger tasted like freezer burnt reheated meat. Onion rings tasted like ore Ida. Large shrimp was barely medium size. Beer selection is weak. They should hide the slop that ends up on the kitchen floor better so customers don't see it. Food was at a fast food joint level at high prices with a long wait. Not impressed.

name: Judd Brogden
text:
Harley at the bar was excellent!!!  She could easily run the place with just her personality. I have been to many Shrimp Basket locations including Mobile, AL, Perdido Key FL, and a couple of locations in Gulf Shores and this location has the absolute best coleslaw of them all. You are only missing the beach atmosphere but the food is just as good if not better.
Try the AYCE steamed shrimp on Tuesdays...unbeatable deal.

name: Michael Hardeman
text: Food was great and had great service

name: Randy May
text: It was clean it was awesome

name: Cheryl Renee
text: Food is very good. Waiter was in his job this visit. Very nice.

name: Miguel Miranda
text: Best seafood by far. Clean, inviting environment. Loved it.

name: Deborah Guthrie
text: No paper towels on table and empty hot sauce bottle. I had to get both from another table to eat oysters.

name: kenneth oliver
text: Losing interest in this place. Many better places to spend my money

name: Danny Gentry
text: Very good food and service was great too

name: Edwin Jones
text: Excellent food at great prices

name: Angie Morris
text: The food was only ok. Expected better quality

name: VerNeshia L
text: Went with my coworkers and we all loved it. I plan to take the family. Food was great!!

name: Bill Bell
text: Had a wonderful fish meal with great collard greens. Hot food, great value and great customer service. I will be back soon.

name: Sonya Jones
text: Food wasn't good at all. The people was very nice and friendly.

name: Hallie DeBardelaben
text: I have always enjoyed my experience here, really awesome food and service!! The tuna dip is to die for!

name: Beth Heindel
text: Great food and service!

name: Rachel mills
text: It's nice to find a place with good seafood when you're inland cause I'm from Florida where seafood is fresh off water

name: Static Kafka
text: Way too pricey for the food you get. Cheese grits suck! Captain D's is better.

name: Barry Winters
text: The waitress I dealt with was very oblivious to what the bar had to offer. I ordered a daiquiri and got served a lime something on the rocks. It took an extremely long time to be told that the frozen drink maker was down. My wife and I waited about 30 to 40 minutes to be served our food. It's a new place so they have a lot of development that needs to occur,  fast. The food was on point though.

name: Taavi Yusuf
text: excellent food, great atmosphere, wonderful staff!

name: Audra Yancey
text: Great food and excellent service

name: david potter
text: Good food cold beer and ok prices

name: Tina McCoy
text: Great food! Good service. Good atmosphere.

name: Genesis Appiah
text: Very good food, reasonably priced, will definitely return.

name: Carissa Johnson
text: Service started good then went bad. I ordered the all you can eat shrimp and a stuffed crab claw. My family knew the waiter seemed a bit new so we tried to bare with her. I pointed directly at the items i wanted on the menu and she still got the crab claw wrong. Instead tried to give us fried claw basket which is 15 dollars more. It took her 20 mins to come back and check on us. The other waiters walked around us also and ignored us as well. All the waiters went to the back for about ten mins leaving the restaurant unattended. Im sure it was more unsatisfied customers even tho it was only ten of us there. I didnt see why the service was bad. Positive note food was good. Didnt really get the all you could eat experience due to lack of service and frustration with your staff. I will probably try out another location if I was you. The girls there are either stuck up or racist I am not sure because at least two of them appeared to be black. But go at your own risk.

name: Robert Jones
text: Worked there. Food was prepared fresh & on time. Good quality and service. Prices are reasoable!!

name: Islah Muhammad
text: Visited for the first time with my guy and loved it. The food was great the restaurant was clean and the variations of the sauces where awesome . Can’t wait to visit again!!

name: The Findley Adventures
text: Great food and service!

name: Linda M
text: Great food today all popcorn more like small shrimp you can eat as nd sides are 👍

name: Laura Murphy
text: Brought the food out in a timely manner for a fairly large group. Good coleslaw.

name: Darlene Smith
text: It was my first time eating there and me and my family really really enjoyed the service and the food and we will visit again.

name: Brad Turner
text: Fried food not crispy at all. Greasy and soggy. French fries limp and shrimp soggy and soft. Fried food supposed to have crisp skin. One and done. Brother at the bar gave good service is why I gave it a 1. Went in at 1550 and sat at bar to order take out.

name: Santanna Curry
text: I used to love this place it has really changed but not in a good way the employees are great but everything eles not so great sorry not sorry

name: Reebe Jarrett
text: Awesome service Great Food

name: Les Hornsby
text: Good shrimp good service

name: Johann Matthews
text: It's a great place to eat.  It has great prices. It's in a great location.

name: Mary Chandler
text: Great etouffee and all you can eat steamed shrimp on Tuesday.

name: Larry Waldrup
text: The food is good and the service also. This was our 2nd trip and we have enjoyed this place.

name: Pat Phillips
text: Good food with good friends. Service a little slow

name: josh Man
text: With everyone that hyped this place up to be something as amazing I haven’t quite figured that out yet. A couple of friends and myself went when they first opened up.  I think of great seafood is something you get on the coast.  This place is nothing more in my opinion and I state my opinion as being an upgraded captain d’s. I would rather go to captain d’s and get the same thing that they offer at a better price.

name: Vernon Calcote
text: Shrimp was very good,sides were good and service was very good. Enjoyed my lunch.

name: Kathy Brown
text: Oysters were spot on, but onion rings disappointed.  Tasted like a food service product.  Kick it up a couple of notches with home made rings and I'll come back with 5 stars!

name: Mary Falls
text: We didn't like this, management was rude. I will never go back!!

name: Denver Hooten
text: Good till the last bite

name: Adam Orlowski
text: Great service and delicious food!

name: Jerlis Valderrama
text: Service was okay. The shrimp tasted like it came straight out the ocean and they just rinsed it off and put them in batter and cooked it. The broccoli had no flavor and not steamed good. The fries was the only thing that actually tasted good.

name: K Thompson
text: Great place.. Good food.. Friendly service

name: Tammy Colley
text: There cheese grits are the best.  We have always  received good customer service.

name: Jessica Long
text: Service was awesome and the drinks were yummy! 🍹

name: Olsa Darden-Harris
text: Our waitress was great, the wait was short but...... I ordered the crab claws ... Not worth the $18 I spent smh. I was super disappointed because I went to this same restaurant in Florida and loved it. So when I heard one was home I was excited. But it fail short.

name: Sherman Dublin
text: Food was delicious!!! Especially the shrimp and grits...

name: Roger Raney
text: Love their fried shrimp basket and my wife enjoyed the fried oysters.

name: Alexis Colon Lopez
text: The service was great from the moment you walk in. The food was magnificent, If you leave there hungry is your own fault as they serve you plenty of food. You can't beat the amount of seafood you get for your dollar.

name: Anthony R
text: Wendy was fantastic & the food did not disappoint!

name: Martha Rucker
text: Enjoyed scenery service was great

name: Michael Woody
text: My wife and I really enjoyed ourselves. The food was good but the customer service was outstanding!

name: Kyra C
text:
My visit today was unfortunately disappointing (no dramatization involved)... Not sure what was going on with the food today...
- The best thing(s) I had was boom boom shrimp appetizer, corn fritters and fries with ketchup
- Customer service was very good.
- Other than that, the food was not good to me (Those in my party felt the same). We were there when the restaurant first opened and the food was at least decent although, not memorable.
- Food today lacked flavor of any sort (includes fried catfish, baked cajun catfish which was a tad spicy but no flavor,  and shrimp) They give condiments for everything but I personally would like it if I didn't feel the need for them just for some flavor.
-Hushpuppies overcooked/fried
- My fried catfish tasted, looked dry, and had an odd texture
- My steamed broccoli had black spots on bottom of all the stems  which made me a little uneasy, Waitress wasn't sure if that was still okay to eat  when asked for a new one she told me that all their broccoli had black spots on them but still no confirmation if it was okay to eat or not from anyone...so yea.. :/

name: C. Brown
text:
Went here on a rainy day. Sat outdoors cause there was a nice breeze and we didn't think there'd be flies because of the rain, which was partially true. When the rain stopped, the flies came. There should be some kind of netting or cover for the outdoor patio to keep those pesky flying insects on the outside.

The food was just okay for me, nothing special, but the place is always packed, no different on the day we went. Not sure why, I wasn't impressed with it. Don't think we'll be going back. The service was good though.

name: LifeisGood
text: The food was not seasoned and it had a bad after taste.

name: Marina gardner
text: I know people have bad days, but it seemed like everyone hated their individual job this evening.  The food left little to be desired.  It definitely fit the criteria of a chain restaurant.  My blackened fish was undercooked and saturated in oil.  The potato salad was gummy.  My broccoli wasn’t cut up- served in huge heads and no knife to cut it.  We sat at the bar and watched a kid struggle to shuck oysters that weren’t even iced down.  The crab cakes were ok.

name: Shawone Riser (OGAgirl)
text: I have visited several other Shrimp Basket locations. This one did not meet my expectations. The hush puppies and fish were overcooked. Much of what we ordered did not taste the best.

name: hernandez mathis
text: Wasn't very good is it frozen or is it fresh?

name: Jo Kinavey
text: Great food. A little pricey. Friendly staff. Wonderful service.

name: Steve Golden
text: Fantastic,  great food , good service  and great atmosphere

name: Brenda Meadows
text: Food was overpriced, service extremely slow, no bourbon in bar, ordered steamed shrimp which were the size of salad shrimp.  Prior visits have not gone well either.  This was our last attempt at dining there.

name: Gary Stogner
text: A great seafood restaurant and was surprised that the dinner was free on my birthday.  Worth a stop anytime.

name: Fred Jones
text: Food was great, and service ok 👍

name: Gary L Murray
text: Food was great and service was excellent.

name: Cindy Fourhman
text: Good food goodservice. Will go back.

name: Kimberly Washington
text: Great food. Great service.

name: cindy Bankston
text: The food was good however the service was not. The waitress rushed us to order but we couldn't get drinks refilled by the time we did we needed togo cups. When the check was brought out she disappeared and we had to ask someone else to take our check.

name: Chet Jr.
text: Food is great and the staff was very friendly. Prices lower than I expected.

name: Shirley Newman
text: I love the white fish

name: Diane Hetzel
text: Really good boiled shrimp, outside dining area and cold beer.  Going to come back for the 'all you can eat' shrimp.

name: Robert Burns
text: Very good seafood. Good vibes, good service and good prices.

name: Michelle Pegues
text: I ordered the gumbo and the rice in it wasn't cooked😩

name: user 39507
text: Salty but good service

name: Cleve Bowden
text: Good food and great friendly service

name: Walter Pinkston
text: Great service  love this place

name: NoMoreSun
text: Good is oh so good!

name: Cheryl Kolb
text: Amazing seafood! Best place to get fresh oysters and shrimp without driving to Florida.

name: Don Hitchcock
text: Take out was timely. Order complete with condiments. Will order again.

name: Andy
text: The best place for seafood (Oysters). Three times we have been there we had the same server and she was super nice

name: Steven J
text: All you can eat  shrimp on Sunday. The corn fritters are very good

name: Jackia Newton
text: Shrimp is always on point, however the sides were super bland (steamed broccoli)

name: Aidan Komendantov
text: Small wait, but well worth it for the food. Prices were great as well for the quality and quantity.

name: Scott Jenkins
text: The staff was very friendly, the portions were generous and the seafood was fresh. I only wish that they seasoned the low country boil more, it was toned down presumably so it would be OK for everyone's taste.

name: Anja Reckmack
text: Nothing special,  had a hair in my food.

name: Anthony R
text: Wendy was fantastic & the food did not disappoint!

name: Gary L Murray
text: Food was great and service was excellent.

name: Moreau Rau
text: Excellent food and service. Reasonablypriced

name: Dennis Moore
text: Not as good as everyone said it was. The hush puppies are good.  The corn fritters are also good.

name: Amanda Marshall
text: So this place has been the talk of the town.  I'm from the Pensacola area and was excited to see it had made it's way to columbus. The wait is crazy, they need more tables and rearrange the tables to add a few more, the drinks were great. Now the service. My daughter's food was the first thing we ordered. She didn't get hers when ours came out, the server didn't even stick around to see if everything was ok, my husband had to wave down someone to ask where my daughter's grilled cheese was. That really put a bad taste in my mouth because the Manager who brought her food really didn't care my kid was upset and hungry. text: My wife and I went at lunch time together.  It was relatively slow.  The service was GREAT!  However, the food not so much. The rice was under cooked for our liking (some folks tend to like a bit of a crunch) and there were also shells in it.  My wife got a shrimp poboy and I got a crawfish poboy.  My wife liked hers and said it was cooked well but my crawfish was WAY over.  There really wasn't any taste left to the actual meat.  It was chewy and tasted only like the breading.  This was our first time at this restaurant, so we may try it again if we are in the area.

name: Tim McCarthy
text: We have eaten several times at the Shrimp Basket in Homewood, AL and have raved about the place.  So we were very disappointed in our meal at the Columbus location. I ordered the fried catfish basket and my wife, the fried shrimp basket.  The shrimp on top were excellent, but those toward the bottom of the basket were soggy and rubbery.  The catfish was just OK.  The strips were narrow, so the ratio of breading to fish made the fish really doughy.  The onion rings were excellent.  Service was OK, but nothing out of the ordinary.  We will be in Homewood in a few weeks and we will check out that location again and see if Shrimp Basket has taken a step backward or the Columbus location is the problem.

text: Less than mediocre. I had the fried seafood platter, which came with a mix of their best sellers, and I was beyond disappointed. The fry itself has absolutely no flavor and/or seasoning, so all of the seafood tasted incredibly bland. The side item I ordered, beans and rice, was the only thing on my platter that had any flavor, but it wasn't anything to write home about. My wife had the jalapeño burger, which was also majorly lacking in flavor as well (definitely a frozen patty), but I kind of expected that, being that this is a seafood joint. The 2 best things about the experience was the service and the dessert, funnel cake fries. Im giving it 2 stars because the food wasn't served raw, or spoiled, but I will never go back. Definitely not worth the $50 check!

text: Witnessed a couple of customers being very rude and obnoxious to employees. text: I’ll leave this picture here so someone else won’t make the same mistake. The waitress was great, the food took about 1:30hours. name: Rikita “MosBae” Banita
text: The food was so good. I am such a haggler and almost didn't choose this place but am glad I did!! The crab cakes!! Yummmmm. The calamari could've been fried a tad longer but were still good. We both had the king crab legs and we shared a jumbo peel and eat shrimp. We couldn't find a complaint and left extremely full and satisfied 😌

name: Kyle Willcox
text:
Let’s start out with the 18% gratuity that they are going to slap on your bill at the end of your stay first. I normally tip 20% when service is good… this was not the case. The food was good but the price didn’t match the quality I expected.
Secondly my family wanted water with our meal, instead we get told that the water from the facet in currently coming out BROWN. She tells us that the lemonade and Sweet Tea are pre made and are fine. So if I want anything to drink with my meal I had to purchase drinks at $4 a glass.
At the end of the meal I asked if they figured out the water situation because my friends had drinks off the fountain? She told me it looks like it’s the pipes that are making the water brown. I think the health department needs to be aware of their bad pipes and they are still service food since my kids have been suffering from diarrhea this morning.

I will not be returning to this restaurant in the future.

name: Todd Jacobs
text: This was our first time visiting due to being on vacation. We had a party of 8 and everyone of us loved our meal!! Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food they delivered! Also, our server, Maya, and all of the staff was amazing!  I highly recommend King Neptune's!!

name: Allie Kat
text: We’ve been in GS since Sunday, & this was our second visit to this restaurant. We may eat here every day, after sampling other restaurants’ food.  The wait staff is tremendous: friendly, happy, polite, & as one of them told us “we work as a team”.  Two nights we ordered the grouper sliders, & they were amazing!  Their food is fresh, served hot, & delicious.  Drinks are a bit pricey I think, but don’t let that stop you from eating there!

name: Katie Cole
text: We booked our trip to Gulf Shores because I had to come back to this place. The food is a lot better than most seafood places here and the dessert is amazing! Our server was very attentive and friendly... you can’t go wrong eating here.

name: Miranda Turner
text: Tried this on a family vacation.  I was a little apprehensive at first because it didn’t really look like a restaurant.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The food was good, my daughters loved the shrimp and my son was able to get chicken tenders (he doesn’t care much for seafood). The prices are a little high and I never did get a refill on my drink.  The waiter was really nice and did a good job.  Not a bad experience.  Not sure if I’ll go back because of the prices but it is the beach and the seafood is fresh.

name: Colleen Ashton
text:
You must try this place, it's definitely worth the drive, just a couple of blocks off the beach.  When we drove by it looked like a small unassuming little restaurant. perhaps even a take out, but we stopped to give it a try. We sat outside and ordered, and the food was absolutely delicious!! Everything from the Bushwacker drink, to the delicious seafood gumbo soup, to the main course blackened red snapper with a delicious creamy seafood topping, fresh steamed vegetables, and don't forget the Beignets! They were hot out of the oven and covered with powdered sugar and just absolutely to die for!
I mean seriously, every single thing here that we tasted was absolutely delicious and I can't say enough about this unassuming underrated place. It's a real hidden gem, you must try it!
Service in addition to the delicious food was fast and friendly. Highly recommend!

name: Rob Nat
text: A very tasty, innovative and authentic way to enjoy local fare.  The food here has changed over the years, always been great.  The price however is quite high for the offerings.

name: BeardedVapeMan
text: Awesome atmosphere and kid friendly! The food was amazing and decently priced! I will definitely stop here again when I bring my family to Gulf Shores!

name: Austin Mills
text: Awesome service and awesome food. We had went to sea n suds and had a horrible experience with service and food. This place was awesome even though we had a large party. Everything was quick and the waitresses were very nice. Would recommend to anyone coming for a visit.

name: Phil Johnston
text: Ordered the grilled red snapper and it was awesome! My wife had gumbo and crab cake sandwich and she loved it! Will go back again!

name: Micaela Galluccio
text:
Had lunch with a group of 10...food was great, staff were awesome.
We especially enjoyed the hush puppies, fried pickles, and Rockefeller oysters.

name: SOULTOAST
text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! I hate fish but tried it anyhow. The fried white fish was amazing. The grilled Mahi is the best fish I have ever eaten. It baffles me how, at the time of this review, this place is below a 4 on Google. I will be back here. Trish does a killer job.

name: Bettye Rogers
text: Trout Almondine was poorly filet'd and not cooked adequately. The fried okra and collard greens were way too salty. And they don't have pepper sauce.

name: Nika Cooper
text: We were excited to try out this place until we actually did. Yes, they were busy which is very understandable but the service and food was absolutely horrible. Our waiter gave the kids their menus but no crayons after asking repeatedly. We had to ask specifically for our silverware after receiving our food and waited over ten minutes to even get that. We never received any of our water's. One of our guests didn't even receive their food until after everyone was already finished. The response from our waiter was, "I'm sorry, another server took your food and its not my problem, you'll have to speak to my manager." This is not acceptable customer service. He was very rude and not professional at all. The dungeon crab legs were a disgrace. More than half of the crab legs had no meat and the very little meat there was, it was overcooked and dry. We will definitely not be back.

name: Martin&Tammy Hamm
text:
Stopped in for coffee and beignets because of sign out front.
They were amazing ended up ordering a second order. Best we have ever had. Including the ones we ate in New Orleans  We will return in future to have dinner and dessert.

name: April Scott
text: Good fun, good drinks and great fast service.   Highly recommend 👌

name: Jake Pruetting
text: Great seafood and chicken. We had the fried  mushrooms and they were some of the best we have ever had.

name: CJ Jinright
text:
If you're in the area and want delicious seafood, go here! I had blackened flounder and it was excellent!
The 2021 NCAA Beach Volleyball Championships are being played at The Hangout but we can watch from here. 😊

name: Randall Cassady
text: Food was great.  Very good shrimp and crab cakes.  Service was mediocre but they were busy.

name: Adolf Martin
text: Small but as the saying goes, the best things come in small packages. One of the best places to eat in GS. Been going down to GS for for 24 years and have frequented King Neptune's more than a few times. Food and service always great.

name: Ryan Bo
text: Glad we stopped here.  Service from Abby was outstanding, food was quick and the fried shrimp and blackened fish were really good.  Also got the Miami Vice daiquiri which was also really good.

name: Rhya Bleser
text: This place is a hidden gem! I can’t wait to come back here the next time that we are in Gulf Shores. Our waitress was so nice and told us the best things to do in Gulf Shores. The beignets were fantastic, we had four baskets. They are made in house. 100% recommend this place.

name: Medusa
text: I was slightly hesitant because of the other reviews but I really wanted to live out my princess and the frog beignet dreams. It was absolutely fabulous. I came back again to try the fried fish po' boy (and another batch of beignets of course.) The fish sandwich was exactly what I had been craving. This cute local spot is definitely a restaurant I will return to in the future. Our server Kati was so kind and enthusiastic towards us. It felt like arriving at my "usual hangout" despite not being a local. All of the ladies are very welcoming and quick to answer anything you ask. King Neptune would be proud lol.

name: Jack Parker
text: Disappointing. $40 lunch is astronomically  priced. Waited on server to ask us what we wanted to drink, small portions for the price, the  water was even bad. After we ate, we asked why they didn't have a lunch menu in the middle of the week, server said they do upon request only. The play foreign music load enough to not be able to hear across the table. Wont ever go back, Nd will advise anyone we know or can tell, DO NOT waste your money!

name: Chris Collett
text: It's alright. Food was ok, just not for the cost. I got the crawfish....which by the way way delicious!!!!! But it was quite expensive. We got a salad, crawfish platter, fish tacos, a chicken sandwich with cheese and spent $70.

name: Lauren Hawley
text: I have never written a review before but I felt compelled given the “solution” that was offered up by the manager for the worst service I have ever experienced. Our drinks were not served for a long time and the appetizer we ordered took very long. We had 7 small children with us and thankfully they were extremely patient but for some reason it took a very long time for our food to come out. We noticed that other people had received food prior to us and the server made it clear to us that he knew we had been waiting a long time. Not sure if our order was misplaced or not put in but we were not given any explanation. By the time our food came out we were missing multiple items and sides. My husband had to go into the bar area for a refill of his drink and I had to go in another time to get tartar sauce and cocktail sauce which we asked for but never came out. We were never checked on by the wait staff. We finally received our final two meals but at that point it had been over 1.5 hours and we needed to leave so we did not get to enjoy the food. The waiter offered to bring a box and mentioned the meals would not be included on the check. As you can imagine at this point, we did not receive a box nor did we get the check. This was even after asking for the check multiple times. My brother finally went in to discuss the check so we could get going. One of the waitresses called a manager to discuss the situation but the manager only took 10% off the bill because they said we received all of our meals. This didn’t even cover the two meals that were so late we were not able to eat nor take home because they did not give us a box. In my opinion, the “solution” was seriously lacking given the situation. This is by far the worst service I have ever received at a restaurant and the only time I have not left a tip. Every time we asked for something it felt like it was never going to come unless we took action by tracking someone down. The only reason I wrote this review was because of the lack of follow through by management to come up with a solution to a terrible experience. I truly hope nobody else has the same experience, especially when they are on vacation and just trying to enjoy some family time.

name: Kelli Ryan
text: Ordered the royal reds! Over cooked, dry! Sent them back same thing again! I was sure they returned the same plate to me. Ordered the gumbo, awful! Tasted like it came out of can! They gave us no crackers, no lemon, no cocktail sauce, no butter, no napkins! Service was ridiculous! Then they bring you a electronic device and stand over while wanting you to click on the automated tip! Never ever go to this restaurant!

name: David Niday
text: Shrimp and Grits is cajun style and the best I have ever had. Flounder plate was amazing as well. Great service

name: Mal Gerdes
text: Absolutely amazing crab legs.  We had the gumbo as well, which was also phenomenal.   Would definitely recommend this restaurant!

name: Vicki Hart
text: Amazing food! Fresh crab cakes, excellent fresh caught mahi, and the fried shrimp.... Ugh, sooooo good! Cute atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating.

name: Trever Cochran
text: Good bacon wrapped shrimp, coconut scrimp even better! The gumbo is good. All around good place to eat. Not fancy,but you won't be disappointed in the food. GREAT FOOD!!!!

name: Jeffrey Gourdine
text: Service was excellent. Food was excellent. I wasn't a fan of the crinkled fries but everything else was cool.

name: Yaimari Castillo
text: 🌻Had some fish tacos 🌮 that were delicious. Service was super 💨 fast. The environment was very pleasant. I would definitely recommend it. 🤗🌻

name: Katharine Kenney
text: Amazing crab legs! Very fresh and flavorful. Takeout was ready quickly on a busy Friday night. Staff was very friendly.

name: Don Bekurs
text: Had gotten awful. I stopped eating there several years ago. One owner died and I understand the other sold it. Haven't been there since ownership changed in past year or two.

name: Deb Deweese
text:
Excellent food and our waiter Jay was awesome and very informative!  Seafood was great, and service was quick
Will come again

name: Aimy Ramsey
text: We had the best seafood I've had in a long time!! Trisha was our server and she was very helpful, friendly and she made my night! My husband said "best fish I've had from a restaurant in my life." We will eat here everytime we visit Gulf Shore from now own.

name: Tyler Kohn
text: Soooooooooooooo good! We went for lunch and got fried pickles as an appetizer and Po'Boys as an entree. Pickles were fried perfectly and super delicious!
