Now, let me tell you about these po'boys. I had shrimp piled so high I had to eat a bunch of it before even folding my sandwich. My boyfriend had to eat half of his fish because it just didn't fit on the bread! Fried to perfection and absolutely delicious. Was it cheap? No. It's seafood. Cheap seafood= instant poisoning. Was it great value for the price? Yes sirrrrrrr. Also, the hush puppies were something else. Crispy on the outside and moist and delicious on the inside. We ate outside and the vibes were 🤌 immaculate. Would highly recommend!

name: James Taylor
text: Sad to hear the previous owner passed away. Unfortunately the food has suffered somewhat. This was my favorite place to eat in Gulf Shores and always my 1st stop coming into town. The breading on the shrimp has changed and not for the better. Oysters were very good although. Wait staff tried but could not handle the volume of people there.

name: Wasp Nest
text: This place is a rip-off. My son & I ate here and spent around $40 only to leave still hungry. We ended up going to McDonalds up the highway and got 2 Big Macs, 2 large fries. Will never waste my money here again!

name: Dave Martin
text: Good food and a really fun staff. Wish we would have found it earlier on our stay.

name: Malorie Blankenberg
text: The service was HORRIBLE, the server Janice never checked on us one time. She brought me fries with my steamed seafood then when I told her that’s not what I asked for she proceeded to attempt to argue with me about the side  an my witness there even said I never said that either. The person with me they brought her the wrong salad. When finished we waited and waited for a ticket an never got one, hell never even got a check back so we assumed we had to get up an pay well that wasn’t the case an we were told by another server that someone would bring the check. When Janice did come an cash us out at the table she didn’t say one single word at all even with the thank yous she was gave from my aunt. IFFF I ever went back it would be for Togo only! As a server this experience was absolutely horrible.

name: Nancy Miller
text: Best shrimp ever!!! Indoor and outdoor seating. Great service, will definitely return asap!!

name: Jill McDonnell
text: Great servers and food was pretty good. They do have a happy hour. Not too too expensive.

name: Anita Sharitt
text: Food was good but most of the waitresses were giving another waitress a really hard time. And when we were leaving,  we stopped to speak with her but she couldn't speak one word of English.

name: BrandyLyn Patrick
text: Best customer service I've had since Covid lock downs! All the food was wonderful! We had Royal Red Shrimp 3 times while on our 5 day vacation. Get the beignets y'all!!!

name: jack grady
text: Food was great. The service was top shelf. Really laid back place I loved.

name: Paul
text: I ordered the fresh Red Snapper with a side of new potatoes (which was $24), the portions were pitiful and food mediocre for how much the price is. You'd be better off going elsewhere and waiting the extra time.

name: Lynne Roth
text: Poor service. Waited for server to ask what we wanted to drink when we sat down. Wait staff stood behind us at register the whole time we were there. The cost of linch was $40. They never offered us a lunch menue. After we ate we asked the server.why there wasn't a lunch menue, they said they had one, we had to request it. Disappointed. We're locals and know this was uncalled for. Don't go there, portions aren't good for the price. Beware

name: Ashly Elliott
text: The best royal reds hands down! Thank you Maria fantastic service! Will be back again and again.

name: camber chase
text: The grilled oysters and King crab were delicious  👌  and the beignets were a great finish to a wonderful meal! Our server Taheera was helpful, attentive and friendly! Will definitely stop here again next time we visit!!

name: Bobbi Fox-Klett
text: Went there for lunch and the place was busy but there was a couple seats open so we didn't have to wait.  We ordered the mushrooms for an appetizer. It was a little pricey considering the appetizer cost more than our lunches but both hubby and I agreed it was worth the price.  Our lunches were good.. we would definitely go there again for lunch.   I've read other reviews about the dinner prices and I agree it's costly but if you go during lunch it's half the price and you can try out the food!

resp.text:
Hey Bobbi,
We are so glad you loved your mushrooms and your lunch meals. Stop in and see us again soon!

name: Lako Vivians
text:
3 Reason U Should Stop Reading This & Go
#1 The PRICES are very REASONABLE $$
#2 EVERYTHING was so FRESH
#3 GO 2 THE BAR 🍹ASK 4 A 🍓 Daiquiri

name: Nancy Litch
text: Have eaten here twice since we have been in GS. The seafood is fabulous. It's been cooked perfectly. We will be back.

name: Dave Jensen
text: We really enjoyed the whole experience. The food & the server, Malia, were excellent.

name: Tracy Lancaster
text: Simply the best! I'm disappointed to see a 3.9 on this restaurant it is a 10 hands down! The Royal Reds are the best we ever had. Great grouper corn fries and the beignets are better than that famous place in NLO . A must when in OBA or GSA

name: BD CribZ
text: Service was amazing the girl taking my order was very nice definitely will be coming back

name: Lisa Qualls
text: Great food, and friendly service.  A little chilli inside but, definitely will be back

name: Jamie Myers
text: Should be ZERO stars, but you have to at least pick 1. Service was HORRIBLE. We were brought 2 glasses of water, I asked for straws, she handed me one and started walking away. I asked for a 2nd straw and she slowly walked backwards and dropped the 2nd straw on our table. The food was sub standard. When you cash out the waitress will hand you a device where you have to put the tip in right in front of her. Don't waste your time or money, too many better choices in Gulf Shores.

name: Cassandra Lurate
text: The food was delicious!  We started with the raw oysters.  They could have been a little more careful cleaning them to avoid shell pieces inside the oyster.  We had the fried calamari which was good, but a bit overpriced.  I had the Zydeco Penne which was amazing!  It was spicy, a little salty, but so tasty!!  The menu mentioned it was the most flavorful dish...that is TRUE!  My husband had the catfish, but wished he would have picked my dish.  I gave him my leftovers!  We (family of 4) left with a pretty large bill, I would definitely return!  I might skip the appetizers next time just to cut back on the price.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice review, Cassandra! We really appreciate your feedback and the fact that you and your family stopped in to dine with us. Come see us again soon

name: Michelle Lang
text: THE FOOD WAS GREAT AND THE SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT AND OUR WAITRESS WAS SO VERY NICE

name: Jason Harvell
text: Just ok.  I ordered the shrimp n grits and my wife had the coconut shrimp dinner.  The prices were a little high for the food that you get.  I thought that the shrimp and grits were going to have the cajun sauce with the crawfish and crab, but it only had a creamy sauce with lots of crumbed bacon.  I could have used more grits too.  We ordered our food for take out and they didn't tell me that there was a 15% gratuity on all pick up orders, so I also included a 20% tip.  Shame on me for not checking first, but just be aware of that if you place a take out order.

name: Matt Stacy
text: Food was great! Would definitely eat there again.

name: Brenda Clough
text: Great food, wonderful lunch specials.  Several picnic tables with umbrellas for outside dining.  Excellent service, great waitresses.  Will return again soon.

name: neill hessinger
text: Awesome. Period. Overstuffed po boys with legit NOLA style rolls, Bushwackers on point, rapid and friendly service, reggae tunes on the speaker. Do yourself a favor and hit them up.

name: Mrs. A
text: We love this place! The shrimp boil was amazing! The beignets were better than in New Orleans!! Bob was our waiter for 2 nights in a row!!! He was fabulous!

name: Debra M
text: Really good food - very casual goodness!

name: Stephen Powell
text: Service was good  food not so good, prices were out rageous even for a tourist area

name: Kim M E
text: Great lunch place for locals ask for the lunch menu.  Great choices, great food, great service.

name: travis barnes
text: Took out Royal Reds shrimp. Delicious.  Will go back.

name: Cathy B.
text: Placed at a table that hadn't been wiped down yet.  The entire time the waitress was talking to me she couldn't stop touching her face and mask.  Might as well of not even worn one.  The crab bisque soup was amazing, but the other food was mediocre at best.

name: Emily Gremminger
text: Phenominal tasting food, amazing service, great atmosphere.  We are already talking about coming back tomorrow for our last meal here while on vacation!

name: Richard Vielhaber
text: Had shrimp po boys , ample shrimp and really good french roll . The only down side was the rumalade sauce that almost ruined the sandwich. Good service with outdoor table option .

name: Josh Vanhuizen
text: The food here is amazing!  We had the crawfish and Oysters.We went around 3:00 and there was no wait. But by around 5:00 there started to form a line. Staff was very friendly

name: Jasmin Jeffery
text:
Honestly BEST food we’ve had during our week long stay in gulf shores! The fresh catch was red snapper, I had it blackened. We had gator bites and oysters Rockefeller (waaay better than Oyster House down the street. WAY. BETTER. They were flavorful and just amazing.) Other people in our party ordered crab legs and po’boys: all really good. And the beignets!!!! mouthwatering. We came back another day just for the beignets.

And Taheera, the bar tender... service?? *chef’s kiss* every single person was so so sweet, quick, just wonderful. amazing atmosphere here. 💗

name: Bob Compton
text: Super nice people, just the spiced used a bit different. Killed the shrimp.

name: lori lahman
text: Service could be better.   Food was great.

name: Renee Baker
text: Not great. Prices to high! Better seafood in many other places in Gulf Shores!

name: clara blades
text: I didn't really care for the place because the chicken sandwich and it was dry and I didn't really like it they come with fries and 2 hush puppies ( but I don't like those in general)  I ordered the sweet tea and it was not sweet at all I had to put the sugar in it but that didn't really help. There crawfish was okay ( words by kiki my friends aunt) I didn't really like king Neptune's but they mostly had seafood ( I don't like seafood) but I feel like they should have had more things to pick from for peopel that don't eat seafood and they didn't have a kinda menu when I was there but they might have changed that too. They only thing that really bothered me was there bathroom it was outside the door to come in the restaurant and you had to go out if it and if the door was locked then there was someone in there and that really bothered me. But the inside is small. So I didn't really like it so I hope this helps y'all out! :)

name: Debbie Dutton
text: Stopped in, looked at the menu and got up and left. We never do this but...This place is EXPENSIVE!!! I know the location  is fine and we expected high prices but not like this.

name: jeremy369
text: Great place to eat and the food is good. This is one of those places that I say we need to eat here at least once, while we are here.

name: Ted Gipson
text: The pork chops very tasty however I didn't know they cut pork chops that thin. The waitress however had an attitude we got our lemon after we had finished eating and last glass of tea. Next the waitress explained to us that and the specials we could have a biscuit or a dessert but we were supposed to know that in advance until the waitress there's no written thing anywhere that explains that so how are we to know to order biscuit or dessert on the specials. When the waitress took my credit card she kept it for 10 minutes eventually someone else at the table went to ask where our credit cards were which then was brought out. My biggest complaint was we were going to sit six of us at a table however they had no tables so we set apart but the waitress still charged us the 18% gratuity even though we were not sitting together or even been served together by the same waitress. My biggest concern is the length of time she had my credit card I'm afraid she could have copied it and is going to use it somewhere down the road I am not a happy camper about that. This is 2/15/21 and so I will continue to watch my credit card to see if I get some unusual charges to it.

name: Autumn Mc Kinney
text: Butterfly shrimp is delicious,fried perfectly and not greasy. Best hushpuppies in the Gulf Shores area.

name: Doug Pike
text: Amanda, server, was great (thank you Amanda). This place is really good. I had the 1/2 pound of Royal Red Shrimp. Cooked fresh. All The ladies were great to talk with. Very friendly, speedy service. Highly recommended you stop by and see Amanda and the rest of the service crew.

name: Paula Parker
text: I'm from Tennessee. This was my first time visiting King Neptune's with my family. The food was very good and the staff was awesome.

name: Suzanne Vinson
text: Absolutely love this place! Local, fresh. Great food and plentiful portions! The Po Boys are fantastic!

resp.text:
Hey Suzanne!
Thanks so much for the fantastic review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your po boy. We are so lucky to call you a loyal customer. See you again soon!

name: clara blades
text: I didn't really care for the place because the chicken sandwich and it was dry and I didn't really like it they come with fries and 2 hush puppies ( but I don't like those in general)  I ordered the sweet tea and it was not sweet at all I had to put the sugar in it but that didn't really help. There crawfish was okay ( words by kiki my friends aunt) I didn't really like king Neptune's but they mostly had seafood ( I don't like seafood) but I feel like they should have had more things to pick from for peopel that don't eat seafood and they didn't have a kinda menu when I was there but they might have changed that too. They only thing that really bothered me was there bathroom it was outside the door to come in the restaurant and you had to go out if it and if the door was locked then there was someone in there and that really bothered me. But the inside is small. So I didn't really like it so I hope this helps y'all out! :)

name: Autumn Mc Kinney
text: Butterfly shrimp is delicious,fried perfectly and not greasy. Best hushpuppies in the Gulf Shores area.

name: Charles Somervill
text:
I heard great things about this place.  It is true there is all you can eat peal and eat shrimp.  I actually found the place disappointing.  The shrimp was all you can eat, but they were over cooked causing the shells to not easily pull away.  I expect better when I am in an area on the coast.

I will not be likely to revisit this place when there are so many other places cooking seafood in the area.

name: Debbie Dutton
text: Stopped in, looked at the menu and got up and left. We never do this but...This place is EXPENSIVE!!! I know the location  is fine and we expected high prices but not like this.

name: jeremy369
text: Great place to eat and the food is good. This is one of those places that I say we need to eat here at least once, while we are here.

name: Ted Gipson
text: The pork chops very tasty however I didn't know they cut pork chops that thin. The waitress however had an attitude we got our lemon after we had finished eating and last glass of tea. Next the waitress explained to us that and the specials we could have a biscuit or a dessert but we were supposed to know that in advance until the waitress there's no written thing anywhere that explains that so how are we to know to order biscuit or dessert on the specials. When the waitress took my credit card she kept it for 10 minutes eventually someone else at the table went to ask where our credit cards were which then was brought out. My biggest complaint was we were going to sit six of us at a table however they had no tables so we set apart but the waitress still charged us the 18% gratuity even though we were not sitting together or even been served together by the same waitress. My biggest concern is the length of time she had my credit card I'm afraid she could have copied it and is going to use it somewhere down the road I am not a happy camper about that. This is 2/15/21 and so I will continue to watch my credit card to see if I get some unusual charges to it.

name: Paula Parker
text: I'm from Tennessee. This was my first time visiting King Neptune's with my family. The food was very good and the staff was awesome.

name: Renee Mann Brown
text:
A little expensive.....but really good food!!!
With AMAZING service!!!

name: Malcolm Gillis
text: Got there right after opening, kitchen wasn't ready. Ordered beignets but only got three out of four of them. Tea wasn't made, had to wait. Had to wait for the fourth beignet, got it to go. Staff was friendly. No lunch prices, everything is priced for dinner time.

name: Love's Life Literally
text: I absolutely Love King Neptune's!! I was there this week with my mom and I am missing the daily lunch specials but I still loved the food and I'm so happy to be able to sit indoors or outdoors now as well! I have been going there for years and always enjoyed it so very much! We were waited on by the most sweet and amazing waitress named Maple!! She got our food out quickly and she was super friendly and talkative with us! THANK YOU Miss Maple! We will be back to see you again soon! Best spot in town!

name: Donel Baswell
text: Bailey was a very friendly server and the food was fabulous. Best bushwacker ever and great Zydecco Penne.

name: Tommy Reynolds
text: Almost didn't go in, looks a bit rough from the outside   Glad I did.  Most stuff was fried but, man, perfection on a plate!  I had coconut shrimp.  Crispy to the point that if the cook had thought "wonder if it's gonna rain" they would have burned.  The were done exactly right.  We all had something different and we all cleaned the plate.  A bit pricey, but here you do get what you pay for.  Wanna go back

name: Arabia S
text: Came here last year and it was great so we decided to come back. The food not good this time...

name: Shanna Barton
text:
Read a couple if reviews and decided to try it on my way to a showcase.

Building & Staff: Not built for a crowd of people and the service staff isn't either.

To-go:  Took maybe 10 mins before anyone took the order.

Meal: Shrimp and crab quesadilla was thrown together, soggy, tomatoes and chopped onion to pass as pico's de gallo. The salad received a 1.

Expectation:
I expected too much, I guess. This review is real. I would rather go to Acme or Hangout and pay the same price for better taste, quality food, and service.

Decision: Read the menu and decide for yourself but don't expect much.

name: Juliana Pinheiro
text: Love the food !!! The place is very clean .. the manage always ask if we are ok.  Good service and carry . Thanks !!

name: Jane Reynolds
text: Normally this is a good place for lunch.  However, the last time we ate here the food was good but the service was terrible!  Now even if the server was new, the other servers should have helped her.

name: Canines Felines United
text: I came to eat, not get robbed. This place is total daylight robbery! Never go here unless your intention is to blow your hard earned cold hard cash. I'm so upset I don't even care about their food at this point. Hidden fees left and right that I lost my appetite after I finished the meal. My brain just ejected any memory of the flavor of their seafood because the hidden fees were so ridiculous!

name: Connie Garrison
text: So after driving 8 hours from Arkansas to Alabama we decided to eat where the locals do. This establishment is fantastic! Relaxed atmosphere and ALL the food was fresh & cooked to perfection.

resp.text:
Hey Connie,
We are so glad you decided to stop in and eat with us and our locals. We are even happier that you loved your entire experience dining with us. We hope to see you in again soon!

name: Sandra Skraba
text:
Been in Gulf Shores 2 months this is the FIRST TIME we were hit with a to go fee of 15%.  Their food was pricey and it was good but there were many restaurants we tried that DID NOT charge us this fee.  THEY THE ONLY ONE?
Won't go back there even when COVID is over.  No mention on their website

name: Yukon
text: DO NOT GO HERE. Freaking overpriced TOURIST TRAP. THEY CHARGE YOU 15% TIP FOR TOGO ORDER. Essentially they don't care charging tourists like crazy cause you ain't coming back. I don't usually talk like this, but they play dirty, I talk dirty. Go here if you want to get upset

name: Ta Faye
text:
Dont pass this place up!

This is our go to when in Gulf Shores. Seems to be a local place and that is why we enjoy it there. The food is always good and HOT! Their sweet tea is perfect! I ordered the butterfly shrimp and my husband had the chicken livers. Both were cooked to perfection. Not to mention our waitress was spot on and a sweetie!! They are also clean and the manager always comes by to check on every table! That is priceless!!!

name: Dan Burleson
text: King Neptune tonight. Food was good. Prices were 2 to 3 dollars Higher than online menu. Which were already higher then other places. And for a place without much in the way of dine-in accomodations they charged us a  15% extra charge for takeout. Probably not worth the extra money. Docs seafood shack and shrimp basket have got them beat on price and taste so far.  Neptune's gumbo was unique and I did like it.

name: allison swanson
text: Overpriced, just ok food. Tiny spot, a bit crowded

name: Greg Monigold
text: Shrimp and fish po'boys were very good, just a better bread supplier away from being excellent.  Fries didn't travel great but that's hardly the point when the fried seafood is that good.

name: Stacy Clifford
text: Great food, great service, no wait!

name: Charlene Saunders
text: Food was good, service was decent, prices were high.

name: MrJonugget
text: My husband and I visited this restaurant for the first time on our anniversary. We were NOT disappointed! The food was absolutely delicious! Our server, Maple, was so wonderful! Great personality and very good at her job! Also spoke with the manager, Corrina, who was also very pleasant to talk to. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone!

name: Meagan Hurd
text: Love it. Good food n good service

name: Sarah Bryant
text: Food was just ok but not worth the price.  Probably won't be back.

name: Jon Young
text: Great food and great service. Wish we'd found this place earlier. Will definitely go back.

name: Ogads Way
text: Kinda expensive...new ownership!  The staff was super friendly....I wanted to pay around $10 bucks for lunch not almost $20. It isnt their fault....I should have researched it more.

name: Journey To Med
text: Great food. Staff was very professional, prompt and friendly, too.

name: Bill Jensen
text: Overpriced substitution of Tilapia for Grouper. Manager did not care!

name: Joyce Lembcke
text: Great people. Food was decent.

name: James Hanneman
text: Very nice waitress. Nice pricing . Good food.pleanty parking

name: J Lynn Serino - Barbour
text:
While the food tasted good of what I was able to eat, I didn't like everything on the plate so I gave most of it away. Because they are rigid in what they serve with no substitutes, I paid mostly for items I didn't like.

I added sausage for $5. I could have bought a whole pack of sausage for that price in comparison to what they gave me.

At the Juicy Crab restaurant, you build your menu for cheaper than what we paid at this restaurant, and they give you a lot more food.

But because the food that I could eat did taste very good, I feel that a 3 is fair and plus, just because there were items that I didn't like on the plate doesn't mean that others don't like it.

So for taste factor I would say try it out.

resp.text:
Hey J Lynn,
We appreciate the honest review and will pass this along to proper management. Please give us another try in the future.

name: Jude Broussard
text: Started with a bowl of seafood gumbo that claimed to have chicken and sausage also. Arrived with 3 shrimp, 1 Piece of sausage, loaded in okra and the roux was made with too much flour. ( Kinda looked like it was out of a can). Next... appetizer. Fried crab claws, no seasoning, over cooked and cold. Something you buy in a box then fry. Definitely something not to waste money on. Lastly, shrimp tacos and crinkle cut fries. Fries were cold and 7 salad shrimp between 2 tacos, it should be called salad tacos instead. If you are from Southern Louisiana (Acadian area) below I-10 I guarantee you will be disappointed. Wait staff was nice but unorganized. Not work the time.

name: Tara Bennecker
text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. Initially told we would have a 20 minute wait. When we finally got seated inside, the hostess said she would try and find us a server. She also seated about 3 other tables and a huge party about 5 minutes after us and told them the same thing. We waited 30 minutes, and still no one even acknowledged us. The other 3 tables, who were seated after us got waited on. We tried to pull the hostess over to ask her if we could get waited on, and she completely  ignored us. Finally, we got up and told her we were leaving, and THEN she acted like she was going to get us a waiter but we had it and left. This place is extremely overpriced and the service is HORRIBLE. Do not waste your time. If you’re looking for a fairly good priced, awesome service, and amazing food then go to Bahama Bob’s!!!

name: mitchell brown
text:
Terrible, way to expensive, 3 small drinks
For $9.00 Awful, will not ever go back.

name: Vickie Estes
text: The steak and roasted potatoes were delicious

name: Travis McBride
text: It was great. We shared the Neptune and it was a ton of food. Servers were friendly and checked on us often. Then we finished off with the fried beignets and key lime pie. Very good.

name: L. M. (Chilly)
text: I was not expecting to see a bar as granny and my teenaged son walked in the doors. The barmaid was rude to our waiter too! My calamari was served to us bone cold and the fountian beverages tasted like someone put pepper sauce in it, we got refunded 2 of the fountian drinks and settled for waters with a sliced lemon.

name: Dianne Alexander
text: Horrible food and service. New owners better change or they will be out of business SOON!!

name: Ken and Rose Heideman
text: They were a bit slow, food was good, are server for our forks, other wise great

name: Genise Okeke
text: Good hospitality, great food, good atmosphere.

name: Stephen Brown
text: Higher prices with just average food. Staff was very polite and punctual. The menu left out many important details about each dish. Food was good, just not worth the price they ask. I'd come back, but not as a first or second choice.

name: Chelsea Boyd
text: I went in and the place was dirty, table was sticky, there were splatters all over the front window too. I was told they wouldn’t honor the menu that’s on google. The waitress was rude and rolled her eyes at me. I asked for the manager and her body language was what made me walk right out of the restaurant. Dirty, rude, and apparently not in need of business.

name: Javier Almaguer
text: Visited King Neptune's for the first time while visiting Alabama. Love the food, love the staff. Great job everyone!

name: J Mac
text: Great service and the best seafood in Gulf Shores.. In fact it's the best seafood we ever had.  We ordered the charbroiled oysters, shrimp tacos, shrimp Alfredo, Calamari and seafood gumbo..  Well done!!!

name: Kerry Sandifer
text: Couldn't get in the "Oyster House" because it was too crowded. Decided to tryout King Neptunes. Food is very,very average, however they charge PREMIUM PRICES. Drinks are so so. To top it off they tried to hit me with the so called Covid-19 surcharge. If you just want some not so fresh food, this is the place. If you want really good and fresh seafood, wait it out somewhere else.

name: Karen Brueggemann
text: Excellent all around! Fun place, great food, staff is so friendly! Cant wait to see them again!

name: Renee Mann Brown
text:
A little expensive.....but really good food!!!
With AMAZING service!!!

name: Gwen Young
text: Great service and delicious food. 100% recommend.

name: Angie Sweet
text: Very nice place for few drinks. Management was very friendly! Will be back!

name: Kayla Strickland
text: I absolutely love King Neptune’s! We come here multiple times during our stay each year! The food is always fantastic and the service is great! The fried cheesecake is delicious, I def recommend trying it! Maple was our waitress two days in a row and she has been great! No complaints!

name: Clint Cannon
text: Tiny portions of Captain D’s quality food at premium prices (think $25-30 average entree price). Plenty of choices in Gulf Shores for much better food and reasonable prices. Try Doc’s, Sea N Suds, Fish River Grill, or DeSoto’s. Don’t waste your money at King Neptune. You’ll still be hungry when you leave.

name: Connie Garrison
text: So after driving 8 hours from Arkansas to Alabama we decided to eat where the locals do. This establishment is fantastic! Relaxed atmosphere and ALL the food was fresh & cooked to perfection.

resp.text:
Hey Connie,
We are so glad you decided to stop in and eat with us and our locals. We are even happier that you loved your entire experience dining with us. We hope to see you in again soon!

name: Reginald Owens
text: Good food and speedy service.

name: michaela johnson
text: A place where Gordon Ramsey would spit his food out in disgust. He like myself would probably have a few choice words for the horrific food that was served. $35 for crab legs that were clearly not fresh and had no flavor at all. The shrimp was breaded and tasted like water, no flavor at all. Our appetizers came out after our food was served. The calamari was also bland and honestly the calamari and shrimp tasted the same. The salad was only lettuce, one tomato, and two cucumbers. They didn’t even have croutons on my salad and they served them in a plate after the salad was served.The only highlight of the meal was the nice waitress we had. I feel like this place should be on kitchen nightmares and I will not be returning until changes are made. I do not recommend spending money on overpriced food that tastes bland and like water. Save your time and money people and may Gordon Ramsey help us all.

name: Crashing Dead
text: Way to expensive, wasn't even that good, service was decent, good place to burn extra money, it was okay not the best, bathrooms are outside, our waiter was vey kinds and nice

name: Victoria Sargent
text: Maple was amazing! She was super sweet and on top of everything we needed! We had a large party and she did a great job with everything!! Loved her!! The food was awesome, everything was cooked great. Overall great time! Thank you Maple for taking vare of us!

name: Gregg C
text: Excellent restaurant!  We've been coming for years.  Very consistent.  Shrimp scampi is delicious....

resp.text:
We're so lucky to call you a loyal customer, Gregg!
Hope to see you in again real soon

name: Tachiana Svetlauskas
text: The food was great and our server, Maple, was very friendly and accommodating. The grouper was delicious and the key lime pie divine. I was sad they were out of hush puppies but my husband and I will go back again to give them a try.

name: Lynne Christie
text:
Dinner was delicious
Service was very good

name: Kirk Ruark
text: Very friendly and attentive staff. Food was good.

name: Hanna Abdelrazzaq
text: HORRIBLE!!! Do NOT go here. If I could rate it a 0 I absolutely would. We arrive a little after 6pm and sit down without menus. We have to ask someone to hand us a menu. Order our drinks and food. Appetizer takes 45 min to come out and is served on a small plate with the food falling off of it. We notice that the restaurant is busy so we wait patiently and don’t say anything. After an hour and 15 min we ask our waitress, Erica how much longer. Then the manager comes to our table and apologizes because our ticket “gets lost” in the back. We immediately get up and leave and still end up having to pay for the horrible appetizer and drinks we waited forever for. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

name: Darlene Hanson
text:
The server Jeffrey not very attentive I guess cause we weren't the party of 16 he was waiting on. I ordered a side salad well they brought me a salad in a bowl we've never been there didnt know what one was to look like I asked him repeatedly after he brought the bill why i was charger 7.99 for a 2.99 side salad he mumbled something twice and never offered to fix the problem then I noticed the table nest to us when we were leaving I guess ordered a side salad it was no less salad just on a smaller plate.  From a different server.
I would give less than 1 star if it was offered!!
My daughter also ordered an appetizer of coconut shrimp and she was charged for a full plate 23$. Instead of the 15$ or so that it was. You really need to teach your people you may get more return customers and they might actually make good tips. Nah I doubt it.

name: Bob Stewart
text: The Red Snapper was wonderful, loved it!!

name: Alex Hornsey
text: Cozy place with amazing food! Had a bit of a wait due to it being busy but it was worth it. Ordered the Fish & Shrimp Platter which is a bit pricy, but very filling.

name: Sharon Woods
text: Loved their seafood. Good portions for a good price. Good social distancing!

name: Independant Food critic
text: Couldnt get seated to eat.  Employees walked past us several times and never tried to seat us at a table. We left and won't go back.

name: Shanna Barton
text:
Read a couple if reviews and decided to try it on my way to a showcase.

Building & Staff: Not built for a crowd of people and the service staff isn't either.

To-go:  Took maybe 10 mins before anyone took the order.

Meal: Shrimp and crab quesadilla was thrown together, soggy, tomatoes and chopped onion to pass as pico's de gallo. The salad received a 1.

Expectation:
I expected too much, I guess. This review is real. I would rather go to Acme or Hangout and pay the same price for better taste, quality food, and service.

Decision: Read the menu and decide for yourself but don't expect much.

name: Em Me
text:
King Neptune’s is a small, hole in the wall that has AMAZING food. (Dress VERY casual) Out of our whole trip we thought this was the best we had.
Upon arrival, we were seated outside. Immediately after, a table opened up. I asked if we could sit inside. They said fine. We proceeded to wait an hour before a waiter acknowledged us. Finally, she said “I’m so sorry. I didn’t know he wasn’t serving y’all.”
Other than that everything was great!
I got the steamed shrimp. Came with potatoes and corn. I’d recommend getting the full pound rather than the half pound.
Husband got fried fish, fries, hush puppies. He agreed it was the best meal we ate during our whole trip.
The restaurant was practicing social distancing and all workers wore masks.
Overall, I’d give five stars for the food. 2 for the waiters. The food was worth the wait/miscommunication/lack of service.

name: Valtina Fossett
text: Our server Maple was excellent! Very attentive. Very friendly. She checked on us frequently even though the restaurant was short-staffed. If you eat here, please ask for Maple. The food was great, too.

name: Kathryn Baker
text: A pleasant surprise.  We started our meal with the crab claw appetizer.  We dove right in before I remembered to take a pic.  The portion size was generous with many large claws.  I choose the grilled fish with the cilantro lime marinade and mango salsa.  It was wonderful!  My companion chose the Zydecco Penne.  The sauce was flavorful and they gave an abundant portion of crawfish, shrimp and andouille sausage.  Our server was courteous, pleasant and attentive.  We will definitely return in the future.

name: angela florez
text: Delicious food, Great service, highly recommended,  Thanks Karina for your suggestions and your attention,  we loved everything!!! We will be back soon!

name: Kayde Musgrove
text: Quick wait time, got us in, in 15 minutes while they were packed full. Great service and even the ranch is homemade. The waitress was amazing

name: Jessica Wilson
text: I don't mind playing for ridiculously overpriced seafood, but I'd at least expect the staff to be somewhat pleasant. The hostess clearly did NOT want to be there.  The hostess provides the first impression of a restaurant.  We decided to leave, as you can get better hospitality at the Dollar General. The restaurant probably doesn't mind, as they don't look for repeat business, as the area is mainly tourists.

name: courtnie wilkerson
text: Delicious! Worth every penny. Staff was ver courteous. I recommend the Zydeco Penne.

name: Angela Smith
text: Good food

name: Independant Food critic
text: Couldnt get seated to eat.  Employees walked past us several times and never tried to seat us at a table. We left and won't go back.

name: Sharon Woods
text: Loved their seafood. Good portions for a good price. Good social distancing!

name: Gary Barnett
text: It was alright, nothing to brag about.

name: Em Me
text:
King Neptune’s is a small, hole in the wall that has AMAZING food. (Dress VERY casual) Out of our whole trip we thought this was the best we had.
Upon arrival, we were seated outside. Immediately after, a table opened up. I asked if we could sit inside. They said fine. We proceeded to wait an hour before a waiter acknowledged us. Finally, she said “I’m so sorry. I didn’t know he wasn’t serving y’all.”
Other than that everything was great!
I got the steamed shrimp. Came with potatoes and corn. I’d recommend getting the full pound rather than the half pound.
Husband got fried fish, fries, hush puppies. He agreed it was the best meal we ate during our whole trip.
The restaurant was practicing social distancing and all workers wore masks.
Overall, I’d give five stars for the food. 2 for the waiters. The food was worth the wait/miscommunication/lack of service.

name: D Reddy
text: Good stop for excellent seafood. Shrimp was amazing

name: Kayde Musgrove
text: Quick wait time, got us in, in 15 minutes while they were packed full. Great service and even the ranch is homemade. The waitress was amazing

name: Kay Palmer
text: I have enjoyed lunch at King Neptune’s for many years! With the new owners things changed but OK but this week was bad! Always loved there chicken liver but this week dry and over cooked! The beans and squash were tasteless with no seasoning! I can open a can at home! The biscuit was a hard hockey puck! They better get a decent cook back or they will be out of business soon ! Higher prices and poor food! I was very disappointed! Diane and Al would never have served this!

name: courtnie wilkerson
text: Delicious! Worth every penny. Staff was ver courteous. I recommend the Zydeco Penne.

name: Ken Christlieb
text: Went Sunday before Memorial Day early dinner, seated right away. Waitress and staff friendly. Then it went bad when the table next to us ask where their food was to be brought out. We waited 65 minutes with 4 people. Waitress said 3 times you food will be out in a minute. Never came. Once it did come, average quality. Bill was $125. You got me once.

name: Matt Shapard
text: Great seafood!  Prices like they are waterside, but still good if you want some good seafood.  Grilled oysters were superb.

name: Faith Williams
text: Delicious!!! There was so much to choose from, so we got one of the platters to share since it had everything we wanted to try. Shrimp, whitefish, and slaw were delicious. Best and biggest fried scallops I’ve ever had! Their fried pickles were amazing! My mom loved their fried oysters. Neither of us cared for their seafood gumbo, though. It just wasn’t that flavorful and I couldn’t even taste whatever seafood was in it. We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Faith! We are so happy to hear that you and your mom enjoyed your experience dining with us. We're looking forward to your next visit

name: Carlos Tapia
text:
Overpriced
Small portion
Gumbo was not good.
Good service.

name: Ken Christlieb
text: Went Sunday before Memorial Day early dinner, seated right away. Waitress and staff friendly. Then it went bad when the table next to us ask where their food was to be brought out. We waited 65 minutes with 4 people. Waitress said 3 times you food will be out in a minute. Never came. Once it did come, average quality. Bill was $125. You got me once.

name: Matt Shapard
text: Great seafood!  Prices like they are waterside, but still good if you want some good seafood.  Grilled oysters were superb.

name: Manny Morales
text: Waited more than an hour for our food after ordering it. Waitress brought us drinks and 15 minutes later brought us straws. Once we had drinks, we kept getting refills of wrong types, twice the waitress poured water on my child's Sprite. Food is good but cost as much as Peg Legs Pete's yet the portions are small. Ordered fish tacos, paid $22 for 2 tacos,spent $90 dollars on food for 3 adults one child, left hungry, dissatisfied and had to grab some fast food on our way home. Yikes!

name: Erica White
text:
First time eating here again in years... showed up and they told us it was an hour wait on food...two hours later everything arrived in to go boxes. We ordered the  $12 crab cakes and  $40 dollar seafood platter and received only two crab cakes... and for the platter we received  shrimp, reds and a BABY crab leg... never received the oysters the waitress “forgot” to tell us that they ran out earlier that day. We asked if she could take off the price of the oysters since that’s the only reason we ordered that meal and instead she took off $4 and gave us 4 more shrimp
All in all won’t ever be returning
A waste of $70

name: William Rogers
text: Be careful with takeout orders. There is an automatic 15 percent surcharge. If you get takeout it would be wise to check everything before you leave. Food was average at best.

name: Dan Crafts
text: Average food... above average prices.

name: Donald Arasimowicz
text: Menu is well balanced and meal was very good.  Service was quick and friendly.

name: Steven Brummet
text: Food was excellent, as well as the service 😋

name: Juli “Crappie Queen” Chandler
text:
Friendly Service
Great Food

name: Marcus Blair
text: Place is horrible!! Ripping people off. Small portions that are nasty and not worth the money. Avoid this place!!!

name: Chuck Bishirjian
text: Worst meal and service I have had in years.  Dined at King Neptune the other week and it was the worst dining experience I can remember..   Had to wait for 10 minutes to get seated when there were plenty of seats and no one ahead of us.  Then we waited 20 minutes and finally had to flag a waitress to get a menu.   After a 40 minute wait we received our meal, which was relatively expensive.  The food was horrible.  My fries were clearly cooked the day before, dry and cold.  I had to get condiments from another table and we were never offered a refill on drinks.   I had the Maihi Sandwich which was dry and chewy.   Of course we had to wait another 15 minutes to get the check and then another 10 minutes to get it back so we could get out of there.  Total waste of time and money.   BTW, they were not that crowded.

name: Natalia McGee
text:
How can this place have such high ratings?!?
This was awful.
It's our last night in town, and we love to find "hidden gems" that specialize in seafood.
With the high ratings, this seemed like a sure bet.

Boy, were we WRONG. We ordered the Neptune plate, mahi mahi and grilled shrimp.
The grilled shrimp was mildly edible, because well, it's grilled shrimp. The food had NO flavor, no salt, nothing. It was such a waste of seafood. Frozen, prepared fish from the freezer aisle has more flavor.

I never write reviews, but this was just too bad.
Even the fries were soggy..and you can almost always count on fries.

We were so disappointed.

name: Jim Wyckoff
text: Excellent seafood! A little pricey but, very delicious seafood! The gumbo was outstanding!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Ben Mitchell
text: Food was very good.  Service was good also but had to wait a decent amount of time to get the food.  We will be going back soon regardless.  Thank you

name: Brandon Carpenter
text: Maple was absolutely wonderful, she done an outstanding Job and I plan on coming back and would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great food with a great personality! 23year anniversary and they brought a free dessert.

name: Jeffrey Finney
text: The sweet potato casserole is the secret to world peace.

name: Ben Kirkland
text: Good food good service. More than you can eat.

name: Sarah Abdukarimov
text: This hidden gem is a must when visiting Gulf Shores. Unlike many other restaurants there us rarely a long wait and the food is fresh and delicious. Maple was a wonderful and thoughtful server, we throughly enjoyed eating here and will return!

name: les tincher
text: All good food and service

name: Phillip Casteel
text: The building is old they've been there a long time but still got a 98 health rating. And the best seafood in gulf shores...

name: Missany Samaniego
text: I got the dungenous crab and it was black and rubbery. I got sick soon after leaving. Don't recommend!!!!

name: Corruptoris __
text: The food had decent flavor. That's the only good thing i can say about it. The waiting area smelled terrible. The only tables available while we were eating were outside and the gnats and flies were very abundant. I was not able to finish my food because I couldnt keep the bugs out and even when the server and wandering manager was told they didnt even offer any kind of compensation for the experience. I do not recommend anyone going to this restaurant, or at least the Gulf Shores location.

name: Sandra Akin
text: The food was delicious and the customer service was outstanding!! Great management and relaxing atmosphere as well! I will definitely frequent this restaurant.

name: Tim Greene
text: Overpriced for what I received. Service was great but the only thing I would recommend here is the Gumbo. Solid.

name: KOOL May
text: We were not expecting to see a bar as we walked in, the barmaid was snippy as she greeted us and treated the male waiter unfairly, the calamari was served  very cold!

name: dominique bordelon
text: Food was yummy. Snuck in a $9.90 to go charge. $70 for a dozen oysters Rockefeller onion rings, fried mushrooms ,a kids chicken strip dinner and small stuffed crab shell... to go. No drinks

name: Haley Magwood
text: My girlfriend ordered Crab Claws and they were entirely over-breaded and they tasted un-fresh. This was a complete waste of our hard earned money. This has truly ruined our experience with the company. I asked the waitress for some condiment packets and it took her 10 minutes which left my food cold. We will never return to this establishment.

name: Tyler Mason
text: My girlfriend ordered Crab Claws and they were entirely over-breaded and they tasted un-fresh. This was a complete waste of our hard earned money. This has truly ruined our experience with the company. I asked the waitress for some condiment packets and it took her 10 minutes which left my food cold. We will never return to this establishment.

name: Tyler Mason
text: My girlfriend ordered Crab Claws and they were entirely over-breaded and they tasted un-fresh. This was a complete waste of our hard earned money. This has truly ruined our experience with the company. I asked the waitress for some condiment packets and it took her 10 minutes which left my food cold. We will never return to this establishment.

name: Rachel Mitchell
text: Delicious local spot. Kinda pricey- no meals under $20 per person. I got a fish po boy. 2 huge peices of fish, fries & slaw $20.

resp.text: Thanks so much Rachel! We are so glad you enjoyed your flounder po boy, next time you come in check out the back page we have a full list of baskets and baked specials  for $12 and $10  also if you come in Monday through Friday from 11am to 2pm we have our wonderful  lunch specials  starting at $4.95! We look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Meghan Grantham
text: I am highly disappointed that during a pandemic when we place a To Go order we are hit with a 15% additional charge! This information was not disclosed to us when we placed the order. The restaurant was packed with people on top of one another, but when trying to stay safe ourselves we are penalized. Ridiculous! And when I called to discuss it I was hung up on!! King Neptune’s is off our our list of favorites.

name: Jeffrey Finney
text: The sweet potato casserole is the secret to world peace.

name: Phillip Casteel
text: The building is old they've been there a long time but still got a 98 health rating. And the best seafood in gulf shores...

name: Parker Barnett
text: Grouper sliders were on point. Fried shrimp po boy was excellent as well. Very friendly staff.

name: MARK HARTMAN
text: POOR WAITSTAFF TRAINING ! Been coming here for over 25 years . Walked in placed our order immediately and our appetizers quickly came out and then ......we waited and waited and finally our server told us he had never put our full order in ... we were the second table there at 11:10 AM . 12:19 we finally got our crab claws and he told us again he still had not put our order in ! Very nice young man , his second day and he was very confused ... poor training . Kitchen was also short handed and I’m not being ugly but no excuse . The manager came out and checked on every table and walked around my table .Never in my 25 years have I been here and it was so unorganized .

name: KOOL May
text: We were not expecting to see a bar as we walked in, the barmaid was snippy as she greeted us and treated the male waiter unfairly, the calamari was served  very cold!

name: Tyler Mason
text: My girlfriend ordered Crab Claws and they were entirely over-breaded and they tasted un-fresh. This was a complete waste of our hard earned money. This has truly ruined our experience with the company. I asked the waitress for some condiment packets and it took her 10 minutes which left my food cold. We will never return to this establishment.

name: Tyler Mason
text: My girlfriend ordered Crab Claws and they were entirely over-breaded and they tasted un-fresh. This was a complete waste of our hard earned money. This has truly ruined our experience with the company. I asked the waitress for some condiment packets and it took her 10 minutes which left my food cold. We will never return to this establishment.

name: Chennel Pace
text: It was a great experience

name: Jason Higgins
text: Great food .... great service and you can enjoy outside dining 😁

name: Erryl Mendenhall
text: I loved the raw oysters on the shell. The veggies were over cooked. The service was a little slow. There seemed to be locals eating there, so I think prices and quality were generally pretty good.

name: Jonathan Tairov
text: The prices may be high but the food and service is excellent! The dining room is a bit cozy but I plan to be back any time I'm in Gulf Shores!

name: Nely Aleman
text: The reds where so yummy and meaty! Definitely coming back. Traveled from bham. Also beignet where hot and crispy! Thank you Maple, she was the sweetest server and had great service!

name: James WATERSTRADT
text: Bar food but good oysters.

name: Jeanine Mallory
text: Seafood can be tough to cook, the kitchen staff made our shrimp like rubber. No kidding, they were tuff and chewy. Grilled shrimp was a let down, I was disappointed. Skip this place and save yourself some money disappointment.

name: Lisa Jones
text: Stopped in for lunch. Seafood gumbo was lukewarm at best and rice was leftover and hard. Boudin balls were good, although were heard a server tell another customer they were made from crab???Service was terrible!

name: Rachel Mitchell
text: Delicious local spot. Kinda pricey- no meals under $20 per person. I got a fish po boy. 2 huge peices of fish, fries & slaw $20.

resp.text: Thanks so much Rachel! We are so glad you enjoyed your flounder po boy, next time you come in check out the back page we have a full list of baskets and baked specials  for $12 and $10  also if you come in Monday through Friday from 11am to 2pm we have our wonderful  lunch specials  starting at $4.95! We look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Mark Powell
text: Great shrimp platter, great Royal Reds, crab claws. Waits staff & cooks A+ job.🤙💚

name: George Jones
text: Been coming to king Neptune’s for years, brought the whole family this time there were 13 of us and maliah did an outstanding job taking care of my family and keeping us laughing. Friendly staff all around and amazing food a bit pricy but I believe it is worth every penny!! Will be back next year no doubt thanks king Neptune’s

name: Elijah Orr
text: Fish chewy, scallops little rubbery, fries tasted like yesterday's leftovers.  Only thing good was raw and fried oysters.  Too pricey.

name: Dale Baughman
text: I am writing this as we are sitting here waiting on our food. It has been 2 hours and half of the plates came out stone cold. Our waitress was very nice and tried to help out. Waitress also said this is happening every night. The new owner needs to learn how to run a kitchen or get out of the business.

name: Christan Miller
text: Amazing food and service!

name: Jane Toole
text: Great food!

name: Scott Nickens
text: The grouper pool boy was spot on the bread was excellent. The atmosphere was a bit dated.

name: Tabatha O'neal
text: Not a fan.... got steamed shrimp and it did not have much flavor. Potatoes were bland as well. Not worth the money.

name: Anna Holland
text: The food is always amazing when we go. The service was great, our waiter’s name was Maple and she was very helpful with food selection and attentive to everything will definitely go again.

name: Katrisa Robinson
text: best crab cakes

name: Rod Montrose
text: Excellent gumbo. Food is very fresh.

name: Scott Nickens
text: The grouper pool boy was spot on the bread was excellent. The atmosphere was a bit dated.

name: Jonathan Tairov
text: The prices may be high but the food and service is excellent! The dining room is a bit cozy but I plan to be back any time I'm in Gulf Shores!

name: Dale Baughman
text: I am writing this as we are sitting here waiting on our food. It has been 2 hours and half of the plates came out stone cold. Our waitress was very nice and tried to help out. Waitress also said this is happening every night. The new owner needs to learn how to run a kitchen or get out of the business.

name: Craig Rewerts
text: Excellent shrimp at a good price!

resp.text: Hey Craig! Thanks for the great review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your shrimp! Come see us again soon.

name: Jason Higgins
text: Great food .... great service and you can enjoy outside dining 😁

name: Man Man
text: terrible experience trust me. we waited outside there for 2 hours not even over exaggerating. even then the bill was way too overpriced. gave us the wrong receipt twice! asked for oysters never got them had to cancel order. asked for ranch, had to go up there and even then got sent back to the table and told to wait longer (it had been almost 30 minutes). felt as if the waiter didn't care enough but she got scared when complaints started coming. overall don't recommend at all. save your money and time for christ sake. she was wearing a mask and she didn't give us her name so i can name anyone. dirty blonde hair though and she had a ponytail.

name: Jane Toole
text: Great food!

name: Tad Shields
text: Hidden gem, great service and food  had the fish taco (blackened) and it was excellent.  It wasn't just a bunch of stuff thrown together, but instead had a simple but unified taste.

name: Alayne Kendall
text: Food was okay, good priced lunch specials although fries were cold & over salted.

name: Jennifer Allred
text: Delicious food and wonderful,  friendly service! Recommended to us by a local and she was right! Great little hole-in-the-wall kind of place that was very clean. Great lunch specials-so inexpensive compared to other touristy places here! Get the shrimp and cheese grits-YUM!

resp.text: Thank you for such a nice review, Jennifer! We really appreciate the review and appreciate you coming in. Hope to see you again soon

name: Walter Crawford
text: Don’t go, at least for right now.  Food was slow to come out and taste was horrible.  Was told they were under new management and everyone is new since Covid happened.  Every table around us had issues and one walked out completely.  Took over and hour to get food and most of it was cold.  I don’t think they have changed the oil in the fryer since before Covid either.  Nasty burnt taste.  Need new kitchen staff and/ or manager.

name: Jason Bryant
text: First time visit tonight, absolutely great food and service! We sat at the bar and enjoyed quick, attentive service, amazing, food in a relaxing atmosphere,friendly staff! 5.5 stars. We also purchased a quart of gumbo to go for a friend he said it was very good as well.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice review, Jason. We are so happy to hear that you had a great experience dining with us. Come see us again soon!

name: Chelsanna Yager
text: We went to this place 8 years ago and have raved about the food since. This experience was disappointing with grease soaked food.

name: Lynda Brown
text: Killer food we are going again

name: Betsy Noll
text:
Great food and I’d say reasonably priced too!
We have been there twice now and would go again.  We also have to give a shout out to Kyra, our waitress, who was by far the best and friendliest waitress we have ever had here in our two years of being snowbirds!

name: Steven Nicholas
text: Service wasn't very good. Got our side salad after our entree. 3 out of 4 plates were not  right. Our 2 Fish and shrimp platters came without fish. My mahi came with out the crab and shrimp topping. Wouldn't  go back

name: Hannah Moore
text: the food tastes great, and Ms. Mabel was so sweet and welcoming. i will definitely be coming back!

name: Abbe Fannin
text: Great service, very busy, fries luke warm, oysters, crab cake very good.

name: ray dowling
text: Wouldn't recommend for the money.

name: Jason Hayes
text: Great staff, great food. Wait wasn't bad and good bar while waiting. Every staff member checked to make sure I was good while waiting for to go order, even though they were packed and busy

name: Tina Hill
text: On arrival we had to wait 10 min for them to find the right employee to seat us, then another 10 min before someone brought us menus, 15 minute wait to get our drinks, and only seating available for parties over 4 was outside at the wooden picnic tables. 😒 The food tasted great but is definitely overpriced...

name: Bradley White
text: The food is great and the atmosphere is casual.  I hope your server is Maple, she is super friendly.

name: Chad Kilzer
text: Awesome place love the food

name: Darryl Freels (Southern Soft Ice)
text:
We were told about this place by a local working at the condo we rented
Quite likely we would not have stopped here or even found this place otherwise,  well that said we were very pleased with the recommendation. Our food was wonderful and the staff were very kind
We will be here for 8 days and we will definitely visit this place again

name: Melody Hannah
text: AWESOME SHRIMP ALFREDO !

name: Lindsey Bein
text: Maple is the best server! So sweet. Neptune’s is pretty cool too.

name: Allison Brown
text: I don't eat seafood. Chicken with biscuits and gravy I had was good though! My SO had some kind of fish that was literally sitting in a pool of oil. He sent it back and just asked for a hamburger. That came out like a hockey puck. By this time we just cut our losses because we had three toddlers and two other adults with us.

name: Brooke Kimsey
text: It's a cute diner to eat at, but the food is overpriced. This seems typical of the area though, due to all the tourists. We decided to go to Lulu's, but the wait was 2.5 hrs. Instead we went here, where we waited about 10 minutes. Our food took insanely long to get to us. We saw people come in after we ordered get their food before us. I think it was the steak one of our guests ordered that held up our food. We got to try their bisque (on the house) for our wait. I don't eat animals, so I personally didn't try it. However, one of my guests said it was the best bisque they had while down in Gulf Shores. I had the salad with cajun/creole spiced balsamic vinaigrette, and that is probably the best dressing I've ever had. The garlic bread toast was delicious. My husband had the 42$ fried platter (can't remember the name of it, jimbo or something) and he said it was an overpriced Captain D's seafood platter. Noel, our waitress, was amazing. Talked with us and just made the night much better. She was probably one of the highlights of our dining experience.

resp.text:
Hey Brooke,
We are so glad that you loved our creole vinaigrette and your service from Noel. We are sorry to hear that you thought some items were overpriced, so we will look into the prices for you. We hope to see y'all back in the future.

name: David Vincent
text: The entire meal with the exception of the coleslaw what at room temperature or slightly warm at best. The green beans and black-eyed peas we're right out of the can. No seasoning added no bacon added and at room temperature. The etouffee was gloppy and had very little seafood. The gumbo was very dark, have no complexity of flavor.

name: Peggy Antunes
text: We stopped for appetizers and all the food was great. Coleslaw, french fries were hot, soup was good and raw oysters. We also had the coconut shrimp. I would stop if I were you.

name: Nathan Day
text: Don't let the exterior scare you away from Gulf Shore's best seafood restaurant! While it may look rough on the exterior, the food is outstanding.  From their fried calamari and fried pickle appetizers to their Baked Kings Seafood Casserole, Shrimp Alfredo, Seafood Platter and Queen's burger, they cook amazing flavors! And it was paired with outstanding service! Don't miss out! They are best known for anything shrimp!

resp.text:
Hey Nathan!
Thanks so much for the fantastic review. We are so honored to hear that you enjoyed your full experience dining with us. We can't wait to see you in the future!

name: Christina Evans
text: The Alaskan snow crab legs were seriously the best I've ever had!!! I highly recommend!

name: Jeff Starr
text: Delicious tacos, fast and great service. Our server Maple was amazing as well!!

name: Bill LaBarre
text: I’ve been here a number of times over the last 15 years. Today was not good. The wait to get our food was long. Had shrimp and fish lunch combination. It was very basic. My biscuit was a hockey puck. The service was good even though they mixed up our drink orders. My fried okra was lukewarm. Today was not up to par.

name: Erica Leach-Howard
text: I decided 2 have supper there because it was suggested by the hotel staff and store clerk. I went alone. I was initially seated at the bar and later requested a booth. The service was slow and I felt ignored most of my visit there. It took forever to have my appetizer and supper order taken. My meal was $50+. My entire visit was almost 2 hours. On the bright side my shrimp were HUGE. I had the coconut shrimp and bacon wrapped shrimp. The dipping sauce was better than the shrimp itself. I doubt if I will return but it seems 2 b a popular spot according 2 the people that reside here.

resp.text:
Hey Erica,
We appreciate your honest review. We are so glad you loved your two shrimp dishes, and we will work on the the speed in which food comes out to ensure that you have a much better experience the next time you stop in.

name: Woodriver Row
text: This place is amazing!  The red snapper is fantastic and the house made seafood sauce is the best I've ever had.   Will be back on my next trip to the Gulf!

name: scott harris
text: Really good. Nothing fancy, just great food all around.

name: Kathy Bohnet
text: Delicious!  Mahi mahi was fabulous and the scallops come as a fried or grilled platter.  Service was excellent (Savannah), restaurant was very clean

name: Wendy “The Southern Gypsy” Schmidlkofer
text: I had a horrible experience at King Neptune's. We had 3 different waiters and our food arrived cold. When I asked for the manager he said we were trying to get out of paying for the ticket. I just wanted hot food😕

name: Lee Blackburn
text: Over priced bigbox freezer food for unsuspecting tourists.

name: Thanh Tran
text: Hey came here the first had a great experience our server ms maple was so prompt and excellent sweet kind as can be so I recommend to keep an eye out for this girl cause she will blow your mind

name: ALICIA JONES
text: Service was slow, people were leaving without getting food took over an hour to get food, place has potential to be awesome just need adequate staff as it was obvious not enough people were there.

name: Cynthia Byron
text: Best shrimp and grits I have ever had!

name: Markius Perdue
text: Food and service was phenomenal

name: Robert Murphree
text: Small, cozy diner just past Walgreens on the right. Excellent food wether you want seafood or down home southern cooking. Great bar as well. Price are very reasonable. Its been in Gulf Shores forever.  Not a touristy place., but tourist live it.

name: Emma Eggart
text: Our waitress Maple was wonderful!! We enjoyed everything tremendously!!! Best fried shrimp ever!

name: Capt Diabe3tus
text: Food is decent, prices seem a little high. Overall not a bad experience.

name: Becky Benningfield
text: Food was just ok. Didn't match the price. Waiter got off to a really slow start but managed to redeem himself

name: Bonnie Dills
text: Had chicken 🐔 livers and had to send them back. Wasn't as good as usual.

name: M Davis
text: Great food!

name: stephen warren
text: Awesome!! Service was exceptional! Thanks Donny. Food was amazing!! No 2 hour wait. Go now!!

name: Michael Interbartolo
text: Had a bit of a wait due large party size, but food was excellent. Server was great taking care of us. The gumbo and etouffee impressed my Cajun father in law. Ladies enjoyed the drink specials and everyone left full and satisfied. Will definitely return while in town

resp.text:
Hey Michael!
This review makes us so happy. We are so glad that we even impressed your Cajun father-in-law with our gumbo and étouffée! We can't wait to have y'all dine with us again.

name: T Jessie
text: Food was good but not quite what it has been in years past.

name: George Singer
text: Its ok but don't be fooled by the sign for cheap lunch. If you don't drink tea then stuck with buying drink . only 2 items for 6 dollar meal. Then cost goes up as does the selections.

name: vaughn gallacher
text: Great service and even better vittles!

name: Tyler Mandac
text: Great place for under 10 dollar lunch. Never had dinner here but if Dinner food is as good as Lunch then this is an all around great local restaurant

name: Sharon Emmons
text: The best shrimp I have ever put in my mouth!

name: Randy V.
text:
Had a group of 8 which consisted of 5 adults, 3 small children. With a wait for the table outside, and waiting for the food, we were there almost 2.5 hours. Waitress Julia was pleasant and cordial but the wait for the food to get done was extremely extremely long.
Needless to say, my family members said they will not go back.
Food order was not that complicated either and taken off of their daily food specials.
Sorry, other places in Gulf Shores much better!

resp.text:
Hey Randy V.,
We are so sorry to hear that you had to wait so long to be seated and for your meal. Unfortunately on busy nights the staff does seem to get backed up, however, that is not up to our standards. We truly hope you give us another chance because we will not disappoint.

name: Kiko Herrera
text: Best seafood on the island i recommend the scallops yhey are amazing

name: Nik-Nik Pat
text: Maple was the best server ever! Great food and great time.

name: Reece Palmer
text: For what it was I guess it was ok. You have to remember Alaskan King Crab comes from Alaska, not Alabama.

name: Kristen Turner
text: Friendly service, cozy atmosphere and food arrived quickly.

name: pamela layton
text: Crab legs, royal red shrimp is delicious!  Cooked prefectly!

name: Leeann Walton
text: Was good

name: miles allen
text: Got yelled at by the waiter for “sitting in the wrong spot for our name to be called” then when we got sat down we waited 20 minutes and not one waiter came to give us our menus. We ended up getting up and leaving. Don’t go here.

name: garry sileven
text: Not nearly as good as in the past

name: William Murray
text: Best, fresh seafood in Gulf Shores. Small-town diner atmosphere with a wide variety of seafood options, all reasonably priced. Service was prompt, kind, and knowledgeable. Before arriving, though, take a bathroom break. I didn't see a restroom available to guests.

resp.text:
Hey William!
Thanks for the great review. Our restrooms are right outside the front door, but we will be sure to make them more noticeable for the future! We are so glad you loved your overall experience dining with us. Come see us again soon

name: Antoinette Sulya
text: Had very pleasant Monday evening, staff members are great, food was amazing. Had tuna nachos recomend by staff and bloody Mary was of the bestd had in long time. would definitely go back. Thanks

resp.text: We are so pleased with your visit!! See yuh ou again soon!

name: Angie New
text: Great local restaurant! Good food and Maple is the best server!!

name: jwhite452
text: The prices were extremely high for the quality of food that was served. The restaurant was small and overall very unclean. The quality of food was poor and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text:
Hey jwhite452,
We are saddened by this review. Although we are quaint, we pride ourselves on our cleanliness, staff, and food. We hope you give us another try in the future

name: Tanya calhoun
text: The drinks were good,

name: Kathy Lynch
text: How was King Neptune's?  Welll...the service was really good, the oysters very good,  the rest of the meal, meh. The "lump" crab cake were low high the crab, high on the cake, so, not great.  My fish tacos were a good size, but the fish was very fishy,  so not great. King Neptune's is just not what it used to be.  O well

name: John Norris
text: Terrific food!  Gulf Coast seafood at it's best!  And the lunch menu specials are reasonably priced for those on a budget!  This little, easy to miss eatery has been a local favorite for over 25 years.

resp.text:
Hey John!
Thanks for the great review! We are so happy you love our prices and our local seafood. We are lucky to call you a loyal customer!

name: Dallas Ismyteam
text: Great service and food!

name: stephanie sanders
text: Geeat food good servise and inside and outside dining lived it

name: Chris O
text:
I thought the food very good and the service was amazing.
I ordered the Shrimp Creole absolutely amazing.
Also got the 1/2 lb P&E Shrimp which was also very good.
Would definately eat there again

resp.text:
Hey Chris!
Thanks so much for the nice review. We're so glad to hear that you enjoyed your creole and our peel and eat shrimp! Hope to see you again soon

name: Belinda Tucker
text: Best local seafood place in the area!

name: Pat Stockdale
text: It was just what we were looking for!

name: Bill Bradley
text: We usually eat here at least once whenever going to the beach. Food has always been good. Service this time was abysmal. We were shown to a table and sat there for 10 minutes with no acknowledgement, waters, sorry I'm busy get to you in a second, nothing. We felt this didn't bode well for the service and we were on a schedule so we politely got up and left. The waitress made ugly comments about us to the host in front of us as we were walking out the door. Last time at king neptunes

resp.text:
Hey Bill,
As someone who has been coming to us for years, please understand we do have our bad days. We thank you for your loyalty and are taking this review seriously in order to better your experience with us in the future.

name: Cindy Dittman
text: Good service,  yummy food,  inexpensive lunch specials.  Our waitress, Katy, handled 5 separate checks with aplomb. They serve Coke Zero!

resp.text: Yes we do! Thanks so much for the great review, Cindy! We are so glad you loved dining with us and Katy.

name: Carol Roberts
text: A tiny little hole in the wall seafood restaurant recommended to us by a local. Whenever we are at the beach we are looking for the best seafood and this place didn't disappoint. Some of the bigger places look fancier but their food isn't as good as King Neptune's. My husband and daughter aren't big seafood lovers but they found something to like here. I like the fried scallops, which are enormous and super tasty.

resp.text:
Hey Carol!
Thank you so much for the awesome review. We are so happy to hear how much you enjoyed your scallops. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Mona Sloan
text: Prices too high for the quality of the food. Server was running from the table before she even asked how we were doing and the Gumbo tasted like it was made of muddy sea water instead of rue. Just wrong!

resp.text:
Hey Mona,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with us. This time of the year is busy, but we would like to apologize for your service and for your food. This experience was not up to our standards. We will look into the prices.

name: Lisa Rice
text: Been coming here a very long time. Have always had prompt service here. The soups are very good here. I love the fried scallops and fried onion rings. All of the different steamed crab legs are excellent. The lunch specials are very good too. I have always had a positive experience here. Nice casual atmosphere. Highly recommended!!!

name: Mark Powell
text: Great food, drinks and wait staff.

name: James Morgan
text:
Has great selection and everything is delicious. Best oyster prices in Gulf Shores. O
I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice review, James! We're so glad you love our oysters AND our prices!

name: Senyor Junyor
text: They charge a mandatory 15% tip on a ***TO-GO*** order... you decide.

name: Terri Reid
text:
We were late getting into Gulf Shores. We were looking for somewhere to eat and ran upon this little place. Food was great
It was there 25th Anniversary so we received 25% off our order. Very small building but food was big on flavor! Will be visiting again.

resp.text:
Hey Terri!
We are so glad you found our little building and we are happy you made it in on our 25th Anniversary and enjoyed your food! Can't wait to see you in again soon.

name: Natalie Nonie
text: This spot was absolutely amazing! The waitstaff was on it!

name: Zeke Yount
text: We visited this restaurant on the basis of our hosts recommendation. Our arrival time was fortuitous as 10 minutes later the place was filled to capacity. Our server was a young lady, who was pleasant and attentive. My wife had 3 fish tacos and I had an order of blackened Snapper filet, both of which arrived in a timely fashion. Both meals were accompanied by two new potatoes and a half (at most) ear of corn plus a slice of garlic bread. Both selections were tasty. Negatives about the visit are a very limited beer selection and walking away with the impression of the experience being over-priced (nearing $100.00 with tip) compared to our other experiences this week.

resp.text:
Hey Zeke!
Thanks so much for stopping in. We are so glad to hear that you and your wife enjoyed your meals. We are taking your review and learning from it in hopes that the next time you stop in, you won't have any negatives.

name: Debbie Smits
text: Our second time eating here this week.  Once for lunch which was amazing and now for supper it was equally as good!  We would definitely recommend King Neptunes in Gulf Shores!!

resp.text: Hey Debbie! TWICE in one week? We are honored. Thanks so much for the review and recommendation. We hope to see you in again soon

name: Keith Cain
text: Small comfortable place with excellent food.  They were nice enough to accommodate us by switching one of the TVs to the football game we were wanting to watch.

resp.text: We're so glad to hear that you had a great experience with us, Keith! We hope that your football team won, and we hope you visit us again soon

name: Anthony Naylor
text:
Seated very quickly.

Wait for our food was a little long but the quality of the food was worth it.

Fried green tomatoes and sauce was fantastic.

Fried wanton seared ahi tuna nachos was amazing.  Tuna was seasoned and seared perfectly.

Coconut shrimp so far is the best in town.

Everything was cooked perfectly.

The only knock against King Neptune.
The Chicken Alfredo was a little pricey at $18.99 and the sauce was lacking so the pasta was not covered well.

resp.text: Hey Anthony! Thanks for the nice review. We are happy to hear you had a great experience but we will look into the pasta issue! Stop in again soon

name: ken bubbett
text: If i could leave less i would. The waitress completely forgot me order. I sat at a table with 4 others who all got food and nothing at all. Amamda completely ruined my experience. Hopefully others have a better experience.

resp.text:
Hey Ken,
We appreciate your honest review. Our servers aren't perfect and do make mistakes, however, we are so sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience. We hope that our manager was able to help your experience a little and we do hope you give us another try in the future.

name: Ron Burcham
text: Great seafood

name: Leigh Boyington
text: Food is ok...nothing to write home about. Every time we go there the portions get smaller and the prices get higher. Finally had to say "byebye" to this place. There are so many better places to eat that are way more reasonably priced.

resp.text: Hey Leigh! We appreciate your honest review and are saddened to hear that you were disappointed in your visit. We are currently reviewing our prices, so we hope you give us another try in the future.

name: Andrew VanDam
text: best oysters I've evee had.

resp.text: Hey Andrew! We are so glad you enjoyed your oysters. Thanks for the nice review! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Deandre Boyd
text: Food was great and our server Ashley was very professional and quick. Came from out of town and tried this restaurant and pleased to say I wasnt disappointed.

resp.text: We are so happy you stopped in. We hope to see you in again soon, Deandre!

name: Tomodachi Timee
text: We ordered drinks and they never came after 20 minutes of waiting. The menu as it says $$ its actually $$$. Its expensive and the service is terrible

name: Julie Smith
