resp.text: Hey Matt! Thanks for the review. We are so happy you enjoyed your food. We will look into the prices for you :)

name: Katherine Ward
text: Old Gulf Shores. Love menu. Headed into G.S. it's on right on Hwy 59 next to dive shop.

resp.text:
Hey Katherine,
Thanks for the review. We are so glad to hear you loved our menu. Stop in and see us again soon

name: ruben pruitt
text: Great food and service

name: Jackie Hamilton
text: Nothing fancy, but always good.

resp.text:
Hey Jackie,
Thanks for the nice review!
We're lucky to call you a loyal customer. We hope to see y'all soon

name: Jonathan Nelson
text: One of the last "old school" establishments left on the island. A must try.

resp.text:
Hey Jonathan!
We are so proud of our 25 year old restaurant. We really appreciate your review as well as you stopping in to see us. Hope to see you again soon

name: Emmanuel Yarbrough
text: Great food . Great service.

resp.text: Thank you so much Emmanuel. We really appreciate the nice review and are so happy to hear that you enjoyed our food and service. Hope to see you in again soon

name: Amanda Eddington
text: This place is over priced and a bit cramped, but the seafood is well cooked and well seasoned. We enjoyed our peel and eat shrimp and crab legs.

resp.text: Hey Amanda, thanks for the review! We're glad you enjoyed your meal.

name: Nathan Strong
text: GREAT service and GREAT food!!!!!!

name: Rich Reisz
text: Small place with huge flavor. A favorite for us everytime we get down here.

resp.text:
Hey Rich!
Thanks for the great review! We are so lucky to call you a loyal customer. Stop in and see us again soon

name: Bill Gale
text: Great drinks and freash seafood. The shrimp was sweet and succulent.

resp.text:
Hey Bill,
Thanks for the great review! We're so glad to hear you enjoyed your shrimp. Hope to see you again soon!

name: sassyhipmom
text: Walking in the door, all of the sassy mouthed/sweet talking waitresses looked up and said hello and asked us (party of four) to sit wherever. Restrooms are clean but outside the building. After our hands were washed, we started with the hush puppies, Delicious and gone within 39 seconds.Served shrimp and sides with a smile. We'll definitely come again because the menu is huge!!!

name: Michele Vassar
text: Great food & service...big portions for reasonable prices.. Bar included...but kid friendly.

resp.text: Thank you! We hope we see you again soon!

name: Carol Britton
text: My husband and I always enjoy coming here. Servers are friendly and food is great. Today we brought friends with us after the Mardi Gras parade. The fried popcorn shrimp, halibut and shrimp tacos were delicious! We will be back.

name: CRYSTAL MERMAID
text: Lunch prices are great. Bloody Mary's have a weird seafood taste

resp.text: Hey Crystal! We are so glad you love our lunch prices. Come see us again soon

name: Jason Cambre
text: Great food at a bargain of a price. The service was very friendly and not overwhelming.

name: Yvonne Macdonald
text: Kind of expensive. It was great tasting though. Our waitress was very attentive.

name: Nathan Strong
text: GREAT service and GREAT food!!!!!!

name: Lindsey D
text: Wasn't impressed at all. Waited about 35 minutes for food after ordering. Food was a little cold. The fish tacos tasted like the fish has been sitting a little too long and was quickly covered up with too much salt to preserve the meat and cover up the taste. My husband ordered the steak burger that too was too salty. The only thing I could say that didn't have salt was the fries. Odd I would say.. My son loved the mini corndogs though!

name: katie hickman
text: Excellent food!

name: ruben pruitt
text: Great food and service

name: Katherine Ward
text: Old Gulf Shores. Love menu. Headed into G.S. it's on right on Hwy 59 next to dive shop.

resp.text:
Hey Katherine,
Thanks for the review. We are so glad to hear you loved our menu. Stop in and see us again soon

name: Barbara Corona
text: Delicious  as usual  we stop at least once  or twice a year!!!!

resp.text: We are so lucky to call you a loyal customer, Barbara Come see us again soon

name: Judith Hoover
text: Great service and good lunch specials.  You get FOUR sides with your meal, and the drink is included. May go back for lunch tomorrow!

name: Rich Reisz
text: Small place with huge flavor. A favorite for us everytime we get down here.

resp.text:
Hey Rich!
Thanks for the great review! We are so lucky to call you a loyal customer. Stop in and see us again soon

name: Susan J Arnold
text: Excellent "hole in the wall" restaurant. We always ate here when we came down for vacation and now that I live in Perdido, the temptation to go every day is almost hard to resist. The baked oysters, coconut shrimp, everything I've eated there is excellent!

name: jamie johnson
text: Absolutely wonderful! I dont like fish or crawfish and only so-so on shrimp but this place made everything taste good.

resp.text:
Hey Jamie,
Thanks for the fabulous review! We are so glad that you loved OUR seafood when you normally don't. Stop in and see us again soon

name: anita gray
text:
A.

AWFUL 12 small shrimp fries and a very small slaw fr $14 for lunch.
The shrimp should be larger.

resp.text:
Hey Anita,
We are so sorry that you had a bad experience dining with us. We will look into getting bigger shrimp for that meal.

name: Eric Howdeshell
text: Had a blast!! Great place to eat!! I'm a local...one of my favorite places on the island

name: Rhonda Atkins
text: I was given 2 $25.00 gift certificates by a visiting relative last summer. I put them away since I was working out of town, then forgot about them. Found the certificates this week so I went to lunch with friends. I did not read the certificate but when I tried to use it found it was only good for 6 months. I would expect a decrease in value but not to be of no value 8 months later. This is total profit for the restaurant and a legal way to rip people off. I will take my money somewhere else and will no longer recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Hi Rhonda - We understand your frustration. We will be sure to pass your concerns along to our management team.

name: Matthew Bankston
text: They have a g and eat all you can eat shrimp dinner!!

resp.text: Yes we do! We hope you enjoyed it! Stop in and see us soon.

name: Shana Bell
text: This used to be one of my favorite places on the island for seafood. But the staff was not friendly at all when we went last time, and we felt almost invisible as customers. The service is not up to par with many other restaurants in the area, and it is just as expensive. It's off our list of places to go now.

name: regenia hardin
text: Very, Very over priced. The shrimp was small the fries were cold, place is dirty. Sea N Suds is soooo much better. Have come here many times but never again without a bank loan.

resp.text:
Hey Regenia,
We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We are learning from your review to make our restaurant a better experience for you and everyone else who visits.

name: Jacob Schorr
text: Second time we've been here. Just as good as the first time. The portions are excellent and the calamari is delicious.

resp.text: We are happy to hear of your experience Jacob. Thank you so much for taking your time to give us a review and thanks for the 5*!  Hope to see you back for a third visit soon!

name: Mike Leimer Jr
text: We got seated quickly, but the food took a *long* time to come out and was "ok". The prices were appropriate for food that was better than just "ok". We felt like we overpaid for the food that we got.

resp.text:
Hey Mike,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We are taking your review and learning from it to ensure that your next experience is much better.

name: Jason Cambre
text: Great food at a bargain of a price. The service was very friendly and not overwhelming.

name: David Eads
text: Veteran owned and operated. We locals love it!

resp.text:
Hey David,
We sure are and they sure do! We hope you do as well. Come see us again real soon

name: Shannon Hyatt
text: Delicious food, reasonable prices, perfect proportions. I love it. We eat there a few times a week due to there rotating menu.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your visit, Shannon! We appreciate the five star review. We look forward to welcoming you all back again soon!

name: James Thomas
text: At one ti.e this was a must go restaurant,  now just so so.

name: eric bain
text: Very long wait. Staff was trying? Heard the “kitchen was in shambles” by one waitress.  We left after 2 hours and only a drink.

name: Elissa Monteiro
text: Cheap, fried food, good portions, and great service!

resp.text: Hey Elissa! Thanks for the review. Come see us again soon!

name: Cliff Bergman
text: Great food and service!!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Cliff!

name: Yvonne Macdonald
text: Kind of expensive. It was great tasting though. Our waitress was very attentive.

name: Melody McNeer
text: Expensive for what you get. Good food but nothing special.

resp.text:
Hey Melody,
We are sorry to hear that you thought we were a bit pricey. Check out our lunch specials or 4-close specials for great affordable options

name: Patrick Perdue
text: Good food.

name: Sherry Pritchett
text: Good Food...sad to see how much the prices have increased since our visit 2 years ago.

resp.text: Hey Sherry, Thanks for the nice review! We will take your review and learn from it to ensure that the net time you stop in, you have a much better experience.

name: Morgan Schulz
text: You can spend about as much or as little here as you want and still come away satisfied. I'll be back

resp.text:
Hey Morgan,
Thanks for the great review! We are happy you found our prices reasonable. Looking forward to seeing you in again.

name: April Morasco
text: Food was good.  Prices were high compared to other local seafood restaurants in the area, which are just as good.  I'd suggest Bahama Bob's or Ribs and Reds over King Neptune's.  Also, they don't allow substitutions so you're stuck with fries and coleslaw with most of their dishes.  Our family of 5 (3 adults and 2 kids) ate for $70.  The previous two days when we ate pretty much the same dishes at other places, we only paid around $40.  Combo po boy (oysters and shrimp) was $16 and only had 4 shrimp and 4 oysters on it.

name: Max Dombrowski
text: Good food great happy hour

resp.text:
Hey Max!
Thanks for the review. We're so glad you love our food and happy hour. Stop in for a drink with us soon.

name: stephanie lammert
text: They have yet again changed the rules on specials and taken things off the menu. The last two times we have been there the service was a lot to be desired. The waitress seemed to be bothered by us and never brought all we asked for. Used to be our favorite place.

name: Lance Moore
text: The shrimp was best ever.  I loved the batter.  Go during a less peak time for quicker service.

resp.text: Thanks for dinning with us, we can't wait to see you again!

name: ruth grinstead
text: We have lived here 14 years.  Through Ivan and Katrina.  Plus an Oil Spill... Through all adversity You will get s great meal at a great price!

name: j h
text: Really inexpensive lunch menu...great food and great value

resp.text:
Hey J.H.
Thanks for the nice review! We're so glad you think highly of our food and prices. Come see us again soon!

name: Tim Hadaway
text: Excellent food and service at a great price.

resp.text:
Hey Tim!
Thanks so much for the great comment. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your food and our service. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Cole Reece
text: Higher prices and bathrooms outside but the food and service were good

resp.text:
Hey Cole,
Thanks for the honest review. We're learning from your review to ensure that you have the utmost best experience the next time you stop in.

name: Steve “Pyro” G.
text: After reading 2 different publications naming this establishment as the #1 Bushwhacker around we decided to add the establishment as a mus stop on our "must visit" list!   Upon being seated at the bar and attempting to order a bushwhacker we were told they had no icecream and couldn't make a bushwhacker.  With multiple locations within 5 miles to purchase ice cream, it was a very disappointing visit!

name: Janis Stanford
text: Food was delicious great place to eat will come back

resp.text:
Hey Janis!
Thanks for the great review. See you again soon!

name: joshua williams
text: Nice restaurant, big portions, only thing I didn't like was the food was bland, & prices are very high.

resp.text: Hey Joshua, thanks for the review! We will learn from it to ensure a better experience the next time you stop in.

name: Alysia Wilhide
text: The only reason I'm giving two stars is because I felt sorry for the server. The all you can eat fried shrimp is a joke when you wait an hour for the first basket. It takes 3 min to fry shrimp, folks. Our table order nothing fancy- everything was raw or fried..... I'm not sure how you handle the July rush when we spent an hour and half here in late December with a less than full restaurant when we arrived.

resp.text: Hi, Alysia- We hate to hear about your wait. We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and letting us know about your experience. We would like to get some additional information from you. If you would, for your privacy, please private message us on our Facebook page with your contact information. We would like to forward your information over to our management team. Thank you again.

name: Joshua
text: Blackened shrimp were hard and rubbery, steak was way over cooked. Prices are ridiculously high. We will not be coming back, and we will tell our friends and family to actively avoid this place. Too many better options nearby to over pay for bad food. Would rate lower than 1 star if it was possible.

resp.text:
Hey Joshua,
We are so sorry to hear that you had such a bad review. We will review all of these complaints and try to fix them in order to have a better environment and experience overall.

name: Brian Daniels
text: My girlfriend and I love this place

resp.text:
We are so glad to hear that Brian!
Thank y'all for being loyal customers

name: Steve Shaver
text: Ordered drinks, looked at menu chose my meal, waiter informed me meal did not exist. Supposedly menu was new. Next selection I was considering was $28.00  on menu, waiter said was now $32.00. We paid $17.00 for our soft drinks and left. We will never be back.

name: Patricia Armstrong
text: Best food but very pricey.  They had specials but no one told us about them.

resp.text:
Hey Patricia,
We are so glad that you loved your meal. We will pass this on to proper management to look into the prices. Check out our online menu, all of our specials are on there as well!

name: Jose Sanders
text:
I worked there as a dishwasher unfortunately i got fired due to miscommunication if i could do it all over again i would.. they where some nice people
I was homeless and the owner had a heart and gave me a chance and i blew it..

name: Johnny Little
text: Classic.  Always good. But sometimes they can be a little slow.   I don’t care. It’s worth it

resp.text: We are sorry for the delay, but we are glad you continue to come in! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Mark Neff
text:
Good food AND good service, not use to that.
Thank you

resp.text: No, thank YOU Mark! Thank you for the great review as well as coming in. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your entire experience dining with us. We hope to see us again soon

name: Danny Smith
text: First of all the food is delicious, Had a great time, Our waitress Kat has such a big personality its contagious, I would encourage everyone to try this place out..

name: Gatlin Mole
text: terrible food my fish jesus caught so old

name: Dakota Maples
text: Great restaurant and great food!!!

name: mary phebus
text: The bestest ever bloody mary , SPICY!!

resp.text: Yum! We are so glad you loved your Bloody Mary, Mary!

name: Tim Wyatt
text: Very disappointed in what used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Gulf Shores. Little piece of fish for a premium price. A piece of soggy corn on the cob and 2 cold potatoes. Last trip there for me.

resp.text:
Hey Tim,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We are taking your review and learning from it to ensure that the next time you stop in, it will be a much better experience, guaranteed.

name: Tammy Harris
text: I was in Gulf Shores for the AISA Track and Field State Tournament and visited King Neptunes during the lunch timeframe after hearing how good the food was from some friends. It did not disappoint. I ordered fried catfish and jumbo shrimp which came with fries, coleslaw and hush puppies. The food was very fresh and hot. Very satisfying for what I had a taste for which was authentic seafood. I noticed that some patrons also ordered vegetables and meat and three dishes.  It is self-seating and not very big on the inside.  They were also consistently busy but my wait was not long.  I would recommend this place to others visiting the area.

name: Jason Jamison
text: I have been going to King Neptunes for a long long long time. Probably about 18 years. We have always had great food and great service. Their seafood is some of the best on the Gulf.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jason, we appreciate your comments and the 5 stars! We love our repeat guests and can't wait to see you again!

name: Lindsey D
text: Wasn't impressed at all. Waited about 35 minutes for food after ordering. Food was a little cold. The fish tacos tasted like the fish has been sitting a little too long and was quickly covered up with too much salt to preserve the meat and cover up the taste. My husband ordered the steak burger that too was too salty. The only thing I could say that didn't have salt was the fries. Odd I would say.. My son loved the mini corndogs though!

name: James Adams
text: Good food and great prices. Recommend going early to avoid waiting.

name: Johnny Little
text: Classic.  Always good. But sometimes they can be a little slow.   I don’t care. It’s worth it

resp.text: We are sorry for the delay, but we are glad you continue to come in! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Tim Willingham
text: Recommended by a friend. Wife chose stuffed tilapia which was excellent. I chose fried seafood platter. Shrimp and clam strips were great, crab cake was good, but the fish was not. Hush puppies were great also. Slaw was so-so. Would eat there again just for the stuffed tilapia.

name: Tim Wyatt
text: Very disappointed in what used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Gulf Shores. Little piece of fish for a premium price. A piece of soggy corn on the cob and 2 cold potatoes. Last trip there for me.

text:
the only restaurant during the whole shrimp festival we visited that had delicious fresh food, I had the salt and pepper fried shrimp which was juicy and fresh and a bowl of awesome full of this and that gumbo, not too pricy and the staff pulled it all together to make a wonderful evening in a small homey place. Thanks we will be back.
Vickie

resp.text: Thank you Vickie, we apprciate your kind works and look forward to seeing you with us again!

Overpriced for sub-
Par seafood..

text: Very good food

text: A hidden gem.  They had the best mixed drinks we found after a week of trying to find the best.  And the fried calamari hit the spot.

resp.text: Wonderful to hear, Jim! We appreciate the great feedback and the 5 stars! We hope to welcome you back soon!

name: Dustin Martin
text: Extremely unprofessional towards my group. Ignored us the entire night while we waited for our good for over 30min before she told us she forgot our order. I would definitely not recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting gulf shores

the only restaurant during the whole shrimp festival we visited that had delicious fresh food, I had the salt and pepper fried shrimp which was juicy and fresh and a bowl of awesome full of this and that gumbo, not too pricy and the staff pulled it all together to make a wonderful evening in a small homey place. text: Blackened shrimp were hard and rubbery, steak was way over cooked. Prices are ridiculously high. We will not be coming back, and we will tell our friends and family to actively avoid this place. Too many better options nearby to over pay for bad food. Would rate lower than 1 star if it was possible.

resp.text:
Hey Joshua,
We are so sorry to hear that you had such a bad review. We will review all of these complaints and try to fix them in order to have a better environment and experience overall.

name: Philip Miley
text: Our favorite seafood place.

resp.text: That means so much, Phil! Come see us again soon

name: William Greenlee
text: To go order. Pretty simple blackened chicken sandwich with French fries. Fries not cooked all the way and the chicken sandwich was supposed to be plain. I'm allergic to onions, but of course had plenty of onions.

resp.text:
Hey William,
We are so sorry to hear that your to-go order wasn't exactly what you wanted. We hope you give us another try in the future.

name: Tricia Baker
text: Very disappointing!!  Crowded, small,dirty restaurant.  Food was not quality.

resp.text:
Hey Tricia,
We are so sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience with us. We do have a small restaurant and unfortunately in the summer months it does tend to get a little crowded. Try coming during lunch to avoid the crowd!

name: Brent Mowery
text:
Overpriced for sub-
Par seafood..

resp.text:
Hey Brent,
We are so sorry to hear that you feel that way. We hope to change your mind in the future.

name: Jim Wehler
text: Although we wanted fried crab claws and they were out they still get a 5 star for service, price and food!  It is my fault we came late to the party on the crab claws.  Always a good sign if they selling out

name: Robbie McPeek
text: Food is fresh & excellent!! Got the shrimp basket. Got coleslaw with it which was awesome!

resp.text: We are glad you had a great time! We hope to see you again soon !

name: Katharine McGiffin
text: Been coming here for my entire life. Going on 34 this year, and we just came down for family vaca this week and this was the first place we chose to go for our seafood fix. Ordered shrimp po boys and I got a fried oyster po boy. Bread was hard, fries soggy, and drinks just OK. Not sure where the disconnect is. Maybe trying to save $$. But, it’s all in the details, and we don’t plan on going back again this trip. Also, prices have risen, again..

resp.text:
Hey Katharine,
We are so sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your experience or food with us. We will take your review and learn from it to create better food and an overall better experience for you in the future.

name: Felicia Crum
text: Amazingly awesome

name: Gregory Cowper
text: Great food and atmosphere. Locals eat here which is good sign.

name: John Cole
text: Food was good but the price had doubled since same time last year , nobody else in the area has gone up that much , will not be back , been  eating here for 20 plus years , too bad , was one of my favorites

resp.text:
Hey John,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We value your loyalty and will do our best to review these concerns.

name: dale andrews
text: Great place for reasonably priced sea food.  Get there early for lunch -- tables can fill before noon.

name: Jeana Louis
text: Ridiculous prices for such little food!! Definitely never returning!!! The table next to us was complaining also about their dessert that was equivalent to one bite!! The best part was our server, she was very nice!!

resp.text:
Hey Jeana,
We're sorry to hear that you had such a bad experience. We are glad that the service was great, however, we are taking your review and learning from it to better the experience for everyone.

text: Service was not friendly.  Didnt want to take time to explain some things on their menu

resp.text:
Hey Carla,
We appreciate the honest review. We will pass this on to ensure that our service is nothing short of exceptional in the future.

name: Alabamas Best Mobile Mechanic
text: Way way way too expensive, considering the atmosphere is equal to a whole in the wall diner. Servers were lackluster and the food is just ok. 3 ppl appatizer, 3 entres and 3 dozen oysters..$200 with tip.

resp.text: Hey R.P. We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We will look into our prices to create a better experience for you and everyone else.

name: Abi Renninger
text: The food is absolutely amazing, the service was great, overall a really great restaurant!

resp.text: Hey Abi!  We appreciate your kindness so much. We are so glad to hear that you had a fabulous experience with us. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Ginny Lynch
text: Great little restaurant. Wonderful staff

resp.text: Hey Ginny! We are so happy that you had a great experience. Thanks for the great review! Hope to see you soon

name: Kasi Beck
text: The first place we go to when we arrive.  Try the salt and pepper shrimp.

resp.text:
Hey Kai!
We are so lucky to call you a loyal customer and that you love the salt and pepper shrimp! Hope to see you soon

name: David Gunter
text: Service was excellent! Food not so much. Two people had very hard to peel shrimp. My dish, Zydeco Penne, was supposed to have crawfish, shrimp, and andoullie sausage with onions and peppers. NO CRAWFISH! I was give a piece of KeyLime pie. One person ordered Grouper and it was an extremely small fillet.

resp.text: Hey David, we are so sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your food. We will take your review and learn from it to ensure that you and everyone else has a much better experience.

name: Greg Silvestri
text: Just ok to me. I ordered the fish tacos with grilled tilapia and received one with tilapia and one with shrimp. The broccoli was cold and the service was slow. Somebody in my party had a cold baked potato also. The key lime pie was very good though. Maybe just a bad day.

name: Capital
text: Waited so long for the food and the the staff wasnt even nice. Dont eat here.

resp.text:
Hey Capital Knight,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience dining with us. This is uncharacteristic of our restaurant and our standards in which we train the staff. We hope that you give our local restaurant another chance in the future because we guarantee you will have a much better experience.

name: Debbie King
text: Yummy food,  VERY friendly staff! We'll definitely be back!

name: Alexis Brooks
text: This was the last stop on our trip to Gulf Shores and man do I wish it was the 1st stop. I would have never ate anywhere else! The service, the food, the drinks! Everything was right on point. The food is a little pricey to be a little dive in place but it is SO worth it.

name: Virgil Văduva
text:
King Neptune used to be our favorite place to visit while vacationing to Gulf Shores, but we were shocked by the prices this year.  $19 for a Poboy? I don't think so.

I had the red snapper and it was OK, but not worth $25.  The rest of the family said the same thing about their dishes.  There is nothing that justifies walking away with a $120 dinner bill from this place. They are clearly gouging customers, not to mention the quality of service barely passed for decent as the waiter literally visited our table twice: two take our order and drop off the food.

Save your money and go to Fiddlefish, Live Bait or Mikey's.  You will get more food for your money, same quality and better service.  Sorry King Neptune, but you guys are going in the wrong direction. We used to love you, but we will not be back.

name: Ignacio Aizcorbe
text: Love this place great prices. Great food and service. A must for me in gulf shores.

resp.text: Thanks, Ignacio! So glad you enjoyed your visit with us and we hope to welcome you back soon!

name: Todd Crain
text: Great food just to far to drive from home. Next vacation

name: GodzillaandGigan
text:
Great food
Good service too. Great for tourists.

name: Chris Smith
text: Everything had a good flavor but both my coconut and grilled shrimp where a little over cooked though. Friendly staff and great service.

name: Bethany Aden
text: Food was over priced for the quality. Fish was okay but not worth the price. Our sides were 2 small potatoes and corn. Service was not good. Calamari was covered in too much sauce. We will not be back.

resp.text: We hate to hear that, Bethany. We strive to provide our customers with excellent service and food. We will send this information to our management team. We truly appreciate your feedback and hope that you will give us another try in the future.

name: Hope Trinidad
text: Mable was great!

name: sue cole

name: christine aden
text: I advise not to waste your time! We were seated immediately(which should have been a sign) but had to wait forever to be served. The food was nasty and extremely overpriced for its quality. Waiters were impersonal and impolite! Definitely won't go back and advise others to save yourself the time and money!

resp.text: Christine, we are sorry to hear about your experience with us. We strive to provide our customers with excellent service and food. We will send this information to our management team.

name: Rebecca Sole
text: My grouper was very small and dried out for $24.  Took for ever to get our food. I would suggest sticking with fried items.

name: Eric Cotney
text: Would never eat here again! Way overpriced and food was terrible. Really disappointed since it was recommended by locals. Eat here at your own risk!

text: The food and staff are amazing. Great lunch specials.

text: We love this place our family looks forward to eating here every summer...food is always great. We were sad not have our favorite, shrimp Alfredo on the new menu, please bring it back.

resp.text: Hi, Sylvia! We will certainly pass your concerns along to our team. Thank you for being a loyal customer! We hope to welcome you back soon!

name: Coots Lures
text: We had all you can eat peel and eat shrimp, AWESOME

resp.text: We are glad you thought so!! Come back and see us!

name: Jennifer Barrett-Tatum
text: As long as you are Into fried seafood and good dessert this place is for you

name: Tee Renne
text: Worst place to eat here! Was recommended by locals, will NEVER eat here again! 130$ for four people to eat?! I don't think so. Ridiculous! That's not even including a tip. Waitress was so terrible that I had to ask a different waitress to get us our refills on our drinks. Was so entirely crowded, that they were stuffing people in, felt like a birthday party in a garage. If you stretch your arms you might poke someone's eye out on the otherwise of the restaurant. This place is a joke! Waitress was lucky to even get the ten dollars we gave her! She was rude even with that. If you don't do your job you don't get a tip. The workers were surrounding the door standing cause there was nowhere to walk, felt like if I didn't leave a tip that I'd get jumped.

resp.text: Hello Toni, we appreciate your taking the time to let us know about your experience. We are sorry to hear about your experience with us. We strive to provide our customers with excellent service and food. We will send this information to our management team.

name: Cory Rash
text: Best place I ate the week I was in Gulf shores! I love the shrimp and crab quesadilla!

name: chad schmidt
text:
The food come out at different times and screwed up over half the food.
They are supposed to be a seafood restaurant and the fish I got you could buy ,at a grocery store and the shrimp taco was boiled  shrimp when I asked to have grilled shrimp. First they broighy,out blackened shrimp and it was so hot it burnt my mouth it was so seasoned!
Awful service  too

name: Stacey Key
text: went during slower time of  night after snowbirds had left....ordered steamed crab and broiled shrimp...crab ice cold..shrimp cool and dried up like they'd sat for to long on hot plate...which is probably the case since it took forever to get it...we ate and paid then mentioned disappointment on our way out to which the response was...hmmm that's funny that guy over there said it was one of the best meals he'd had in town.  maybe we should have had what he had...  lousy customer service skills...if they'd cared at all we'd go back...but since they didn't care neither do we.

name: Allison Milford
text: HORRIBLE!! I've been going to King Neptunes for 15+ years! It was always the go to spot for my family when we would come to the Gulf! But the last two times have been absolutely horrible! Horrible customer service and food! Flavorless and overly priced menu! Salad worse than a bag salad from the grocery store, seafood pasta dishes flavorless, greasy and disgusting! Rice and sides absolutely disgusting and my 14 year old can make a frozen dinner taste better than this! I'm sad to say but my favorite restaurant is a lost era, I will have to say goodbye and the sad thing is I recommended this as the hands down best resteraunt at Gulf Shores, but now I will tell them to steer clear!

name: Stacie Carter
text: We had heard great things about this place, so we were really disappointed.  The food is so overpriced! $33 for a pound of crab legs and $19 for 1/2 lb shrimp. The service was mediocre at best. Save some money and go to the shrimp basket.

name: Kinsey Merrell
text: Outrageously expensive for bad service and small portions. Definitely won't be back anytime soon.

resp.text: Thank you, Kinsey, for reaching out to us and letting us know about your recent experience.  If you would, for your privacy, private message us on our Facebook page with details and contact information, we will make sure to pass along your review to our management team. We truly regret hearing that you had an unsatisfactory experience with us and we hope that you will return in the future to give us another chance.

name: Angie Seal
text: The food was good, the restaurant is too small, bathrooms are outside and it's a bit pricey for the amount  of food you get.

name: Michael Yoder
text:
oof
.
ooooop
.

.ooooooooooooooaaay

L

You

,x

resp.text: Ha! Thanks for the great review Michael. Hope to see you soon

name: Greg Wilson
text: Wonderful food great place to eat

resp.text: Hey Greg! Thanks for the great review. Stop in and see us soon.

name: Gary Harper
text: One of the very best local seafiid restraunts. Been in business for year's.  Always fresh and good.

name: Garbanzo 9000
text: Awesome food that will make your knees buckle! Very laid-back and family-friendly. I've had the bacon wrapped stuffed shrimp, the zydecco penne, key lime pie, and fried cheese cake. They are all to die for!

name: Natalie Mayfield
text: Best calamari ever. Good corn dog. Great service.

resp.text: Hi, Natalie! Thank you so much for the 5 star rating and your review! We always love to hear from a happy guest! We hope you can join us again soon!

name: Mike Mercer
text: Horrible service, but good good.

resp.text:
Hey Mike,
We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with us. Normally, we receive great reviews about our service, but that aside we will look into it for you. We are glad you liked your food and you give us another try in the future.

name: Michelle Boyd
text: Food was nasty and the wait staff was worse

resp.text:
Hey Michelle,
We are so sorry too hear that you did not have a good experience with us. We pride ourselves on our local seafood and great staff so we are shocked to hear that these were not up to our standards. We will learn from your review and guarantee that the next time you stop in, you have a much better experience.

name: Jason Goans
text: Broiled seafood platter, seafood gumbo, and shrimp and andouille creole. . . . .All were great, fast, and fresh. Come early, smaller place.

name: Barbara Roca
text: Friendly environment  and fast service.  Cons the price per portion size not worth it although food very tasty.

name: James Lacey
text: Not fancy, but great seafood.

name: Don Crow
text: Price too much. Better meals other places.

resp.text:
Hi Don,
We hate to hear you didn't  enjoy  your visit.  Next time you come back around  make sure to check out our special page! We have lunch  specials Monday through Friday 11am till 2 pm starting at $4.95 with a meat and 4 fresh made side with a free iced tea!  Also special baskets,  plates and sandwiches all day ranging from $7 to $9 ! Dont forget to ask your server about our all  day drink specials  and tapas menu!

name: A. C.
text: Great food, friendly staff

resp.text:
Hey Amanda!
Thank you for the nice review! We pride ourselves on our food and our staff so we are so glad that you also enjoyed both! Stop in again soon.

name: Amy Thomas
text: Not fancy at all but good food and our waitress, Noel, was super sweet and made a great suggestion for my mom. We would come back.

name: Tyler Rosenwald
text: Food was salty as hell as if they used the salt to preserve the spoiled fish. It tasted so gross and upset my stomach

name: Matt Garrett
text: We eat at this restaurant on the last day of our family vacation to Gulf Shores. When we walked in the door there was no wait which was great but I begin to wonder beings it was on a Friday night. We should have left but we didn't we set down because it came recommended. I ordered the grouper, and my son ordered the mahi mahi, my wife had a hamburger, and my younger son had chicken tenders. The mahi-mahi was tough the grouper was great the hamburger was not done and who can really screw up chicken tenders. The two fish dinners came with exact same sides undercooked broccoli and rice with some red sauce on it( the hair in mind was complimentary I told the guy that he acted like those were free). After paying the $87 with tip, I just wanted to chalk it up as a bad experience, but I know the only reason these places are in business because they keep getting new clients. There was a reason it was not busy on a Friday night at dinner time. Don't never eat at this restaurant, you will regret it I promise!!!

text: Used to be great! $58 later we learned it wasn't for two people with two waters. 3 weeks under new management with a new menu with only option of fried foods. They were out of crab claws and no ice cream for my bushwaker. Should have known and left when the first two items we ordered they didn't have. My husband got the combination platter which was 6 jumbo fried shrimp, 1 large fried fish filet, 3 fried scallops, 2 tiny fried oysters, 2 tiny hard stale hush puppies on a large bed of French fries. That is not worth $32. Mine was 18 jumbo fried shrimp on a small bed of fries and 1 tiny hard hush puppy. The cole slaw was nasty too. 15 mins after leaving out stomach hurt and we didn't even eat it all. We mainly tasted and asked what happen. Well the new management is running it into the ground hard and fast. Don't waste your money go to bahama bobs

name: Bill Parker
text:
Ate at Neptunes 1st week of July.  Had tried to get in on other visits to Gulf Shores, but it was always too busy.  The atmosphere was laid back, not super loud music or t-shirts.  Ordered the baked oysters with parm-cheese and garlic butter and they were awesome (wish I had some now).  Then had shrimp and grits (good).  Son had popcorn shrimp(good)  Wife had seafood casserole (fair).  Service was outstanding.  Prices were about average for the area.  I will definitely be back and recommend the oysters here.  4 stars only because I save the 5-star rating for the perfect meal experience.  Maybe on the next trip.

UPDATE:  Ate at Neptunes again (Dec.31), around 1pm, the place was packed, but we were able to get a booth.  Service was a bit slow, but looked like they were a bit overwhelmed.  I ordered the corn and crab bisque (which I had never had before) and instantly added it to my favorite foods list.  Wish I had cancelled the crab and shrimp quesidilla cause it was a disappointment after that bisque.  Wife ordered the Greek Fish and Salad and she said it was excellent.
I visit Gulf Shores 3-4 times a year.  I will be back for more Corn and Crab Bisque!
UPDATE:  Another visit 12/26/17  arrived shortly after they opened, so not busy at all.  Ordered Corn and Crab Bisque (5-stars again) as well as soft-shell crab sandwich (excellent).  Food and service was 5-star!  Can't wait to go back and order this again!  Neptunes is slowly becoming my go-to in Gulf Shores!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Bill!  Glad you enjoyed your visit and we can't wait to see you back again!

name: Lorrie s
text:
I ate at this establishment about 2.5 years ago and had the crawfish etouffee.  It was the best etouffee I had ever eaten.  Visited recently again and could not wait to try the same dish again.  They did not have the crawfish but did have seafood etouffee on the menu.  I ordered it and it was the absolute worst etouffee I've ever tasted.  Not sure what happened but somebody dropped the ball on the new recipe.  It tasted like they used Campbell's soup out of the can as their base and just dumped in some sea food in.  I could only get about 1/2 of it down and I was really hungry.  We also ordered the fried mushrooms and they were soggy and very undercooked.  We asked the mushrooms to be removed from our bill, which they were.  My wife was only able to eat a few bites of her meal.  She ordered the baked spinach Florentine tilapia which was extremely fishy due to the brown meat being left on the bottom half of the fish.  One of my kids burgers had a section that appeared to be undercooked as the meat was still red.

All in all, not a good experience for us at all.

resp.text: Thank you, Lorrie for reaching out to us and letting us know about your recent experience. We're happy to hear we took care of the mushrooms on your bill. Did you speak with management while you were here about your other meals? We will make sure to pass along your review to our management team. We truly regret hearing that you had such an unsatisfactory experience with us and we hope that you will return in the future to give us another chance. We appreciate your valuable feedback and hope you will continue to be a return customer of King Neptune's!

name: Cornelia Thrash
text:
Boi did I have to work for this food! 3 times I ordered the fried fish and shrimp and 3 times they brought out a partial order! I must say, "They weren't even worth the wait! The only seasoning I could taste was the pepper. The onion rings were free due to the constant order mix-up. I'm glad cause if I had paid for them the level of disappointment would have been overwhelming. They are the low quality frozen onion rings that has the very thin supposedly sliced onion that has no onion flavor that's breaded in breading that has no flavor! I also ordered the crawfish that's boil-in-bag with potatoes,  sausage,  and corn. I imagine it would have tasted alright if I could have eaten it! There was so much grease in the bag and on the food I was afraid to try it! I don't know if the grease came from the cheap sausage that was included or if they added margarine thinking that would add flavor. The corn literally had to be rung out with paper towels before it was edible!
All-in-all the jewel in this experience was the waitress Ashanti! Her patience and her professionalism spoke volumes! Not once did she even sigh amidst the order mishaps. Thank you Ashanti! I only wish that all those who work in customer service had your attitude,  patience,  and humility!

resp.text:
Hi,Cornelia.
Thank you for your time to give us a feedback.

first of all,I’m glad you like Ashanti’s work! We’ll pass along the kind words.”

Secondly,I’m sorry your experience with us didn’t go well.

We use Conecuh original smoke sausage,I think it is pretty good quality and it’s local favorites.
And Our fried onion is one of our popular items ,that’s why we gave it on the house as we made a mistake on your foods. I’m sorry you didn’t like it.

Our seafood served in the bag,It’s kinda a trend in big cities like New York and Atlanta.I understand that some people not familiar with it,since it is different from local .

And also Our seafood boil is served with our house sauces,which contains butter,And they all taste great,It’s new and different from local ,but we have confidence that our seafood boil soon will become a favorite to the local.

name: Eric Richardson
text: We had fried oysters and calamari appetizers as well as steamed King crab and shrimp with corn, potatoes and sausage. The menu says steamed, which I usually equate with bland. Royals great seasonings and spices, however, make it more like the great boiled seafood South Louisiana is so famous for, and far from bland. We especially liked that Royal offers several different seasoning combinations levels as well as heat levels. It was all very fresh and delicious. Service was great -attentive but not bothersome. Very clean and spacious. I highly recommend Royal Seafood.

resp.text: We are grateful for your kind words and your time to leave us this amazing reviews,Thanks for sharing your review with us and the community.

name: Matt Simon
text: This is a hidden gem!! The food and service was great. If you are looking for great seafood, go here!!  Better than all the other places on Airport Blvd. (And better prices). We had a great mix of food and it was all great and cooked perfectly.

resp.text:
Thanks for leaving our business a 5-star rating, Matt. I’m glad that you had wonderful experience with us.

Your review,WAW! one of my favorites,it means a lot to our team,thank you so much,it’s truly appreciated!

name: Kendall Navstar
text: I've managed to have the Prime Rib on Tuesdays twice now and all I can say about is "Hell Yeah"!!!  This place knows how to cook delicious food for a fair price.  The Dock is located on the edge of a lake with bay style windows and an outside eating area that gives you a great view of it.  Now, if you been reading my other reviews of great places to eat, I'm REAL big on how the staff treats me.  The staff here are young, pretty, and friendly.  I can forgive a cook for over cooking my steak but I may never return if the staff are rude or just don't care about me so when I say this place nails all the right traits I mean it.  Go eat here and enjoy yourself!!!

name: Nathaniel Hammersmith
text: Not that place that I remember. May be the virus but, this place used to be a go to destination when on the road. Service was good, not excellent. Food was good not great. View is always spectacular. Would still recommend but with some reservations. Would love to go back without everything happening to see if its better.

name: Chris Cunningham
text: We visited The Docks this week 2 times during our play and stay golf package. We have be regular visitors 2 times a year for years. Last year was not very good but we just thought Covid was the the reason. The 4 of us ate there and not 1 plate of food was even remotely warm. Food was very slow arriving at the table, both nights, was right at a hour getting food. Our experience was so bad that we checked into different places to eat during our next stay. When the Seafood Platter is the special of the day and the corn had not been even warm for sometime and the crab legs were cool to the touch for $24 that is unexceptable.

name: True southern Accent
text:
Great place to eat with beautiful views of the water. My Rib eye steak was great. Live music.
We will be back on our boat.

name: Brandon Lee Majors
text: Great service, food, and bar. The pasta was amazing and their burgers are as well. The locals are as friendly and welcoming as the staff. Well worth a visit.

name: Michael Hickman
text: The shrimp and the new potatoes were great!! Friendly and very efficient servers, highly recommend you trying at least once. They take reservations which I loved, no waiting for us.

name: Aaron Larson
text: We were sent to The Docks by our fishing guide, who turned out to be a pretty good restaurant guide as well. On Gunthersville Lake in Alabama, back off the road a piece, sits this great eatery. We were told "Don't go there unless you have the shrimp and grits". He was so right. We started with the gumbo, do have this. We followed with fried green tomatoes.  I'm sure the were good but we don't like them. The on to the shrimp and grits. All I can say is yummmmm. We finished with key lime pie and I had the bread pudding. Once again yummmmm.

text: One of the highlights of this town is this hidden restaurant. Good people, good food. Atmosphere ranks a 20 out of 10. Despite the isolated appearance, It's less than 10 minutes from town, one of the restaurants  on Goose Pond golf course. Went on a Wednesday evening, sat on the patio and chatted with a few locals as the sun set. Ordered the snow crab and gumbo and have no complaints.  If you hate bugs, sit inside. Great experience!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: cindy rasch
text: The service and food at The Docks is excellent. When you combine this with a water view, it is a great place to get together with family or friends. If you're hungry for seafood, try the seafood platter - can't miss.

name: Megan Lee
text: If waiting for 2 hours for food and filling up on refills is your thing, this is the place for you. Even if you have reservations, you best believe that doesn’t even matter. And to make matters worse, they brought out wrong orders and then had the audacity to argue whether or not the order was wrong. “Had you not eaten any of it, we could have removed it from your bill”. Excuse me? We waited for 2 hours for food. We were hungry. Then the owner refused to come speak to us regarding the wrong orders. Drink refills - 5 stars. Customer service - 0 stars.

name: Pat Sweeney
text: Nice place  Food was good

name: Debra Chappel
text: I LOVE the outdoor deck. Sunset is amazing. The full service bar makes delicious cocktails and has a good beer selection. The food is always good not sure why there wasn't a single shred of coconut in the coconut shrimp last time, but I'll give the pass because it's the 1st time the food wasn't just right, and everyone else's food was delicious. There's nowhere I'd rather be on any night for dinner.

name: Doug Sweet
text: Excellent food, service and view!

name: Gus Miller
text: Home away from home...great people...especially on dock 3

name: Cameron Padgett
text: Great staff. Tip them well.

name: Courtney Richardson
text: Gorgeous views right on the water!  Wonderful and friendly staff!  Awesome food (save room for the key lime pie)!

name: Josiah Thomas
text:
Our food was great, the waitress was friendly, and our wait was minimal.
The Shrimp & Grits is without equal!
Their salads are good. The bread they bring out at the beginning is really nice and the honey butter is GREAT!

name: Margaret Ellis
text: Love this food & views of the river too.

name: Lisa M. Armstrong-Little
text: Best fried shrimp & strawberry cake! So good!

name: Isaac
text: Amazing food, and a beautiful view of the water! Will be back.

name: Doug Eby
text:
Went the fire works. Great show
Easy exit.
Scottsboro P.D. did s great job. Directing us out.
Hats off to all those that put the show on

name: Anita Hudson
text: Friendly family restaurant. Only issue I had was large groups of people at a table was served there food before just the 2 of us.

name: Rain Braswell
text: It was awful from beginning to end!  It was my husband's birthday and we're from out of town.  We rode the boat from our campground to have dinner.  When we get there we didn't have a reservation but they still seated us inside when we wanted outside.   We were there for 2 1/2 hours!  We waited on our food that was terrible btw for over an hour!!! I am 8 months prego and have to get all my food well done.  Well my burger was pink in the middle!  Took forever for them to take our order, bring our drinks, bring our appetizers, just really do anything!  It was the most awful experience I have ever had at a restaurant!  We will never be coming back!

name: Debra Bradford
text: Excellent service, excellent atmosphere, and the views are spectacular. Great food.

name: Pia Sweeney
text: Food was great staff was great

name: Heath Gist
text: Everything was on point! Impressed

name: Pia Sweeney
text: Food was great staff was great

name: Heath Gist
text: Everything was on point! Impressed

name: Janice Swearengin
text: Great experience.

name: Kim Morton
text: Thanks for the great meal!

name: Josh Holcomb
text: Great food and good service

name: Patricia Duncan
text: Made reservations. After being seated Almost 30 minutes before we saw a waiter although he walked by our table 6 times.

name: Kristy Griggs
text: If you enjoy good food, friendly service and relaxed atmosphere, it is a place to visit. Crab cakes, go for the crab cakes.

name: janice chambless
text: Excellent great food and the staff were very helpful

name: Rosie
text: Good food and nice environment

name: Loren Hunter
text: Great food and service...view was incredible

name: Mark Moss
text: View was great. Server was nice. Food was ok. Service was not good. Had to wait on in food for over an hours. Other customers had same experience. Go on a weeknight. Not weekend. Or don’t go hungry and just enjoy the view from the deck.

name: Collis Sims
text: Waitress, Jessi was great. The food was delicious. The only negative was that after 2 attempts the chef still couldn't cook a ribeye medium rare... but the steak was still good.

name: Anthony Monroe
text: Very nice place to eat... Seems like a place you would see on the beach..  very laid back atmosphere with live music on some nights... you can eat inside or outside and I would recommend making reservations.Wide menu option from shrimp to Philly cheese steak and excellent salad..  nice scenery right next to the river with access for boats to pull in and eat .  Overall we enjoy eating here

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Jim Reid
text: Good good, good service.  Did not get to sit in back room so poor view.  Place was busy so fairly slow getting food

name: shaun mclaughlin
text: Good food, great service

name: Gregg Danielson
text: Good food with a great view overlooking the water.

name: Deborah Hughes
text: We had our 40 year class reunion here and had a great time. There was an awesome band. The food was great.

name: Chimney Pro
text: Have never had a bad meal here. Great!

name: Destiny Talley
text: The docks has a great atmosphere and the food is good.  I wasnt to pleased with my side salad though.

name: Anthony Monroe
text: Very nice place to try... right next to the Tennessee river.. you can eat inside or outside and watch the boats come in.. looks like a place you would see on the beach.. live music some nights also.. nice menu options... steak.. shrimp.. steak.. philly cheesesteak etc... pirce is kinda on the high side but is worth it

name: Teresa Morrow-Handy
text: The grouper fish fingers are the best I have ever had! The homemade keylime pie was delicious! The server (Jessie) was great and gracious.

name: Gus Miller
text: Home away from home...great people...especially on dock 3

name: Donna Lafine
text: Would NOT recommend this place! I ordered a rib eye steak, well done, got a filet burnt. Sent it back and ate only salad. Long wait on food.

name: Karlee Blair
text: Awesome food. Amazing environment. Drinks from the bar were delicious

name: Phillip Rigsby
text: Great restaurant on Guntersville lake.  The food was great and service was too.  Had the riveter and it was good.  Also had tuna bite appetizer and it was very good.  Gets very crowded on Friday and Saturday night.  They do take reservations.  Worth the drive over from Huntsville.

name: Wesley Mitchell
text: Very good food, warm, cozy

name: Deborah Frazier
text: you can get better food at  DQ than at the >>>> docks

name: Michael Cohran
text: Views are awesome.  Food selection was adequate.  Prices are a bit high for quality and amount of food served.

name: James Martin
text: The food was great. I got the seafood platter and forgot to order it blackened. The crab legs were amazing! Our waitress said she was filling in. She was great. I think we had a bit of a wait because she had no seniority getting orders from the kitchen. Live music was excellent.

name: DANA PARKER
text: We ate at the Docks two times, while on our Anniversary trip, both times were fabulous! We did call and make reservations to sit outside and we were sat very quickly and had a perfect view of the Lake while we ate! The service was great and the food was even better! We will definitely return and we recommend The Docks!

resp.text: Thank you so much Dana! We appreciate your visit and can’t wait to see you again

name: jimmy williams
text: Food was excellent. Service was friendly but slow but I attribute that to them being so busy.  Be sure to make a reservation, it was a packed house.

name: Hailey H.
text: The bread pudding here is absolutely to die for.

name: Jennifer Combs Minyard
text: Our meal was so good! I can't wait to return!

name: Darin Clark
text:
I ordered the herb crusted chicken with red potatoes, seasonal vegetables and gumbo. The chicken was very good and tender. The potatoes tasted as if they had been warmed under a heat lamp for hours.  The gumbo was good but had more of a beef stew taste. I like beef stew though so that wasn't a problem. Overall a good meal.
Update: Went back with my sister and her husband. My wife had the fillet mignon. My brother in law had ribeye. My sister had the herb crusted chicken. I had chicken fettuccine. The food and service was great. The waitress knew from last time that I am a thirsty eater so she left a pitcher on the table for me.

name: Candy Teague
text: Good food. Love the desserts (they are homemade daily) and the soup. Great place to take family for dinner; or out of town guests.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: John Mark McGullion
text: I made a reservation for my rehearsal dinner and had to wait 45 minutes. It was quite embarrassing to have my future in-laws wait for a table for an hour. When I made my reservation I asked for inside seats to avoid getting bug bites for my bride, but they tried to seat us outside. The food is hit or miss. The shrimp in grits are great, but some members of my party complained about the food. There is no excuse for the poor management and service.

name: Lacy Berry
text: Great atmosphere, consistently wonderful food, and an amazing view. Nearly everything on the menu is home made ( I think chicken fingers are the only exception ). Good restaurant/bar on the water feel. Happy people, good music. And cold beer :) What more could you want? Try the cheese fritters, or gumbo. And definitely the shrimp and grits!

name: Bubba Ivey
text: Tuesday night special - prime rib. Staff was really good.

name: Zebbo Leppo
text: Pretty respectable service, be prepared to pay a bit of a premium for the location (which is gorgeous, so that's no issue). Shrimp and grits were great EXCEPT that the shrimp was cooked until it was rubbery, about the worst example of overcooked shrimp I've eaten so far. I did stick around for the strawberry cake though, and the desserts are supposedly baked by the owner herself. Absolutely delicious. Would go back again just for dessert.

name: Sean McCormick
text: We waited at the hostess station for over 10 minutes  to even be acknowledged, when at long last we were seated,  we waited almost 15 more minutes for the wait staff to ask our drink order.  When that never happened, we left and went somewhere else.

name: Dustin Hamilton
text: Great food and good service

name: Timothy Aaron
text: Great food affordable  prices laid back atmosphere

name: Ryan Tillery
text: I recommend The Docks to everyone. In almost ten years, I've never had a single visit here in which the food and service were anything less than top notch. Great folks, great food, great view... nothing beats The Docks.

resp.text: Thank you Ryan!

name: Faye Hulsey
text: No nice place to eat

name: S M (BBKS)
text: Beautiful restaurant and outside seating area!  We enjoyed an exceptional dinner then topped it off with a fun night of music with old friends! If we lived in the area, this would be my go to restaurant, no doubt about it! The owners, Mark & Linda, make this place a solid 11 on a scale of 1-10, you won't meet better people!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!

name: Bethany Hogan
text: We love coming every time we are I'm town. Delicious food with great and friendly service. Beautiful views.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Clint King
text: Great atmosphere, food and people!

name: Ali Crow
text: This place was absolutely amazing!!! Great service! Even better food! And don't even get me started on the view...it's to die for!! This was a great dining experience and I will definitely be coming back for many years to come:) superb job you guys!!!!

name: William Ivey
text: Always a blast. Great atmosphere, service, and prices and if it gets to hot you can just go cool off in the river. Some nice scenery too.

name: Randy Hall
text: Excellent food, friendly staff and beautiful location.

name: Kim S
text: Best place eve. Great food and atmosphere!

resp.text: Thanks you!!

name: Nick Pettengill
text: Views were beautiful and band was good, service was not good and food was ok.

name: Tony Cox
text: Great food and great service. Everyone was very friendly and waitress was great.

name: Bambi Smith
text: We had reservations. Took 30 minutes past reservation just to be seated. Then took another hour to get drinks with waitresses passing us multiple times. Our food order was taken and we waited another hour....... make sure you have plenty of time if you are stopping by.

name: Crystal Ball
text: This place has a great location and view that is just beautiful.  I have came 3 times hoping to get something worth eating and it's terrible every time, maybe I am just ordering the wrong thing. I love the atmosphere, and always been great service. It's a shame the food isn't as good.

name: W Merritt
text: Food was ok.  Food service at the bar... the man seemed bothered to have to serve us.  An older woman kept appearing behind the bar to get her own drinks but never stopped to help the bartender even when he was clearly backed up.  Overheard the older woman conversation that she gets her food from Costco.  So much for fresh food...  The fried green tomatoes with remoulade were decent enough though.

name: Bart Goodwin
text: Great food and excellent service. Good place for family and friends or to dine alone

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Crystal Murphy
text: The food was okay, but the wait was HORRIBLE. We got there, it took 15 min to get seated, we didn't see a waitress for 15-20 min, it took another 20 min to even get drinks. We ordered appetizers and that took an hr to get out,  then another 30 min until the food came. Drinks were not kept filled and apparently, you have to make reservations if you want to sit outside 😑. The wait staff was friendly but they obviously need more help.... I definitely won't be going back.... 2.5+ hr dinner experiences with a toddler are like waiting for a bomb to go off....

name: Gary Davidson
text: Great food, great service.

name: Wayne Lee
text:
Unexpectedly a great seafood place in the area. I had never eaten grits until I came here. After eating their shrimp and grits, I was blown away.
Also, the bar tenders are friendly and casual. Good spot to hang out.

name: shauna Finley
text: The food is pretty good but the service is horrible.  We have eaten here 5 or 6 times and the service is always bad.

name: Donna Shawver
text: Needs updating.  Atmosphere was not up to par. Could see a cabinet where we were sitting that was falling apart. No valances on windows and no shades from sunlight. The lights were out at the table we were sitting.

name: Shawn Baine
text: Great food and atmosphere, I very much enjoyed the selection of food being I'm from Florida, I don't run into a lot of the same options for seafood as I'm accustomed. Nice selection, I'll be back for sure!

name: Selina Pittman
text: This place is worth the drive. The food is great and the staff is always on their game. Ask for Stepanie when you go. The only reason I left off a star is the lack of draught beer. They do have a decent bottle selection, however.

name: Michael Campbell
text: Fantastic seafood. Large menu selection. Live music on Friday and Saturday nights. Best restaurant in Scottsboro.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Gabe Goggans
text: Can’t beat The Docks for excellent food with and an excellent view.  Staff is great and the atmosphere is awesome.

name: Jan Phillips
text: Fun friendly place.

name: Greg Machen
text: This is one of our favorite restraunts! Steaks and seafood are awesome. We live in Madison and no problem making a road trip to eat here!!

name: Bart Goodwin
text: Good food at a reasonable price with excellent service

name: Bassproduction 284
text: The service was great, the food was really good i liked the shrimp and grits the most really recommend it if your with your family. Overall really good place.

name: Pamela Wirth
text: Good, fresh. Seafood

name: David Davis
text: The staff was great and the atmosphere was good. The only downside is the food is pricey for the mediocricy of it. Definitely getting something different when I go next time, but there will be a next time definitely.

name: Deborah Hughes
text: Great atmosphere!! They always have awesome entertainment on the weekend. Jerry Bloom is a must see if he's performing.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Michael Givens
text: We have been here twice the place is absolutely amazing my personal favorite is the fried crab claws and my wife is in love with the shrimp and grits

name: Carl McGuire
text: Probably a 4.5. Food was good, view is better. Service was very good.

name: Bob Parker
text: Fried green tomatoes,  shrimp fettuccini alfredo and  shrimp and grits- all were superb as usual!!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Darryl Bailey
text: Great food, great service and a great place to eat. I would recommend this resturant to anyone.

name: Brian Everett
text: High quality food

resp.text: Thank you!

name: mike mccollum
text: When we walked in at 6:00 on a Saturday evening, the server acted unfriendly and and lacked any kind if enthusiasm whatsoever. I felt as if it was a chore for her to get something for me. I ordered an old fashioned and was immediately informed that the bar doesn't have bitters. Odd to not have bitters at a bar. She took forever to ever check on us. She seemed irritated to have to do so. I never recieved my ceasar salad that I ordered. The only reason they get three stars was the food. Ribeye was cooked perfectly. I have eaten here every year I visit and everything has been great previously. Get a reservation. If you don't than you will be treated as if your wasting they're time.

name: Rus Wallace
text: Love the shrimp and grits!!  One of a kind!!

name: Jim Harkness
text: Great food. Good service.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Shain Rufus
text: Amazing service! Amazing food! Worth the trip there!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Rich Chapman
text: Mark's take on shrimp and grits is a truly wonderful experience.  What a great restaurant and staff.  Thank you!!

name: Troy Bell
text: Got there really early. Sat at bat. Had a few beers. Was fine.

name: John Burton
text: Great food great service. We come back year after year.

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Keith Rutledge
text: My mom and I are from Atlanta GA we have a relative that lives in Fort Payne so we drove over for a one-night visit to Fort Payne and we were going to go down to Top O River in Gadsden but I was looking on the web and found the docks in Scottsboro so we decided to drive from Fort Payne to Scottsboro to eat when we got to the docks The View was amazing all the outside seating was full so we did get a window seat we made our order and we ordered an appetizer cheese fritters they came and we're very good then 45 minutes past still no food finally we hear the waiter Yelling to the kitchen staff table number 45 is about to walk out and and then 5 minutes later our food comes out and we took one bite and it was just nasty two of us got the D's southern fried fish and one person got shrimp all the meals tasted like it had been cooked in old grease and then had the old grease poured over it after it was cooked so everyone ate about half their dinners and we paid for the overpriced food then went outside walked around looked at the water got in the car and drove back to Fort Payne the view is amazing but the food isn't good!!!!!

resp.text: I’m sorry about your experience, we strive to deliver the best food and service as we possibly can! It was an extremely busy night and we were under staffed and over booked! If you will give us another chance will will go out of our way to try and exceed your expectations! Please ask for Linda or Derek, Linda is the manager and she will make sure you are well taken care of!

name: Katherine Wooten
text: Great food and excellent service

name: Mahamed Heban
text: Great food and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Collin Reed
text: overall disappointed with the service and food. i could have eaten better at McDonalds at a much lower price and gotten better food, and more of it.

name: Cheryl Harrell
text: Had the blackened mahi, outstanding

name: Gabriel Haroldson
text: We went here for dinner on our anniversary. the food is ok.

name: Debbie Fanning
text: Great food and service.

name: Rickey Martin
text: Great atmosphere! Singer was awesome!

name: Catherine Berryhill
text: I can only give 1 star because we didn't even get to eat. We waited 15 minutes for a table for 2. finally left because we were tired of waiting. Not sure I would even make a reservation to go back. They were kinda snobby

resp.text: I’m sorry but when we are busy we usually have 15 to 30 min wait times on the weekends of you don’t have a reservation, if you would like to come back, please call and ask for Derek or Steff and we will gladly get you a table and give you 5star service!

name: Chris Robertson
text: Service was poor and charged our party 20%. Really? Poor service and charge us that much? Food was good, but never look at their kitchen.

resp.text: We are sorry for your bad service! Did you ask to speak with a manager? We would been more than happy to rectify the situation before you left, and unfortunately this weekend we were short staffed in the kitchen. When it’s that’s busy lettuce tends to fly, and we did have a huge stack of dishes to be washed because our dishwasher left in the middle of the shift! I do apologize and if there is anything we can to help in future please don’t hesitate to call and ask for either Linda or Derek, and we will make sure you are well taken care of!

name: David Jason Bruno
text: I think there is a nice atmosphere being situated on the river bank and most of the time there's good live music on the weekend which is nice while you're having drinks and or dinner.

name: Dorothy Andrews
text: Our first time there. The atmosphere was great and the food very tasty.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Deirdra McCrary
text: Great food! Great view and atmosphere! Tuna bits and cheese fritters are amazing!

name: R R
text: This was our first trip. The food was delicious. Our waitress, Heather, was very good and attentive. Her suggestions were spot on. Ask for her when you go. The only thing negative I have to say is that they were evidently getting ready for some type of party and we kept getting looks from the manager and a male worker and even heard her ask another table if they were about through. So my advice to the manager. Don't seat people in an area where a party has been planned. You just never know who may be listening to comments and reviewing your restaurant . Your waitress and the food and the view make up for the rudeness.

name: robbie brown
text: Services was bad but food was still good

name: Ellen Pecoroni
text: Great place. Food was fantastic. Service was good.

name: Jeremy Witt
text: Best shrimp n Grits you'll find in the area!

name: Crystal Mason
text: The prices are high, and the food is not that great. I'd definitely recommend a different BBQ place before this one.

resp.text: Ma’am me we are not a BBQ place! We are a casual fine dining establishment. If there is anything we can do to make your experience better please let us know.

name: Travis Wood
text: This place is awesome and the food is good too!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: DGS DGS
text: Good menu but I removed a star because the wait is way too long. 105 minutes to serve 6 people is a tough one to swallow.

name: D C
text: Amazing Place .. Great Food and the Atmosphere was great..The Service was phenomenal .. The staff go out of their way to make sure you are taken care of.  Shrimp and Grits was perfect!

name: Rick Terrell
text: Great , music, service, food A(

name: Zetta Jones
text: Food and service was premium!

name: Cory Snyder
text: Great atmosphere, food and service! Twelve of us guys came down for a golf trip from Knoxville, TN and really enjoyed The Docks.

name: Verlin Cox
text: Best fish I have eaten in a long time. Try the fried catfish!

name: Curt Bean
text: Good food and a good view.

name: Floridanatureman
text: Great views from every table, outside dinning available as well. Ordered ribeye steak with garlic mash potatoes and cheesey grits with a cup of gumbo. Steak was ordered medium but came out very well done. First cut into this steak I realized there was not a drop of moisture left.Before I could complain the server took noticed, oppologised and quickly went to replace the meal. Within minutes a perfectly cooked steak returned. Everything tasted fabulous. I will be returning..Thanks for the great food and hospitality!

name: Ann Craft
text: The hubby & I had the steak and lobster. The best filet mignon I've had since Dale's Steakhouse closed!!!

name: Marvin Betancourth
text: We spent about 5 weeks in Scottsboro and found The Docks . From day one We went back every week once or twice. Destiny is more than awesome ..down to earth ..sincere friendly very helpful We all love her! She is awesome! Food is exellent..I love their prime rib..went there every tuesday ! Service from everybody  is  fast friendly made you feel at home! Thank you very much Destiny from all of us! . loved the view from the outside patio. If I ever come back to Scottsboro I know my firts choice for dinner !! Enjoyed everything very much!

resp.text: Thank you! We will pass along the message to Destiny!

name: Lynda Kent
text: Very good food and service,highly recamennd.

name: Bobbie Cannon
text: Shrimp and Grits is definitely one of their signature entrees! A must gastronomic experience!

name: Eric Mullins
text: Service was a little slow, but good was great.

name: Maria Ivette Rivera-Del Valle Anaya
text: Fantastic place, great ambience and excellent food

name: Perry Raines
text: It's a nice place but the service sux. Great atmosphere, just bad service.

resp.text:
I do apologize for your service not being up to par, if I could convince you to come back I promise we will give you the best service!!  If may ask, do you recall who your server was? We will go above and beyond to give you the best service if you will let me know when you are coming back! Please ask for Derek! Once again I apologize and hope we can correct it in the future!

Derek
Manager

name: Lynn Ester
text: Great food and service. The shrimp onion soup is a real winner.

name: Maria Ivette Rivera-Del Valle Anaya
text: Fantastic place, great ambience and excellent food

name: Marvin Betancourth
text: We spent about 5 weeks in Scottsboro and found The Docks . From day one We went back every week once or twice. Destiny is more than awesome ..down to earth ..sincere friendly very helpful We all love her! She is awesome! Food is exellent..I love their prime rib..went there every tuesday ! Service from everybody  is  fast friendly made you feel at home! Thank you very much Destiny from all of us! . loved the view from the outside patio. If I ever come back to Scottsboro I know my firts choice for dinner !! Enjoyed everything very much!

resp.text: Thank you! We will pass along the message to Destiny!

name: Glenn Kerce
text: Of course I love it I work there.and like all the team at the docks we give 100% to our customers  to make their dinning experience the best.thats how we got into the top 10 in the state.

name: Bobbie Cannon
text: Shrimp and Grits is definitely one of their signature entrees! A must gastronomic experience!

I do apologize for your service not being up to par, if I could convince you to come back I promise we will give you the best service!!  If may ask, do you recall who your server was? Derek

name: Curt Bean
text: Good food and a good view.

name: Jennifer “Nikki” Brownfield
text: Currently enjoying the fresh seasonal salad alongside a plate of crab cakes, mashed potatoes, and rice pilaf. Delicious!

name: Todd. Hughes
text: Outstanding food in a beautiful atmosphere.

name: Neo2369
text: Always good.

name: Betty Lewis
text: Excellent food, strawberry cake, snow crabs dinner was delicious and  everyone was so kind and friendly.

name: Frankie Reynolds
text: Food and service were great!

name: Richard M thomas
text: Great food but under staffed

name: Corey Mayfield
text: Excellent Tilapia, grits were superb and Haley was an equally excellent server. For my first dining experience in Scottsboro AL. I would have to say I am very impressed.

name: Kirill Korshunov
text: Nice view on the lake, good food

name: Angela Thomason
text: Off the beaten path but a great, freindly place to eat. Food is delicious and does break the bank.

name: John Nicholson
text: Awesome food guys!!! Shrimp N Grits was off the chain!!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Tina Warren
text: The beautiful views are only the beginning, the food amazing!

name: Tennessee Trawlerman
text: Busy spot due to good food.

name: Ken Coe
text: Very good food at a beautiful lakeside location.

name: charles avans
text: Good and view of the water was good

name: Jessica Mundt
text: Shrimp and grits...yum....

name: stanley doegg
text: Food and service was Great.

name: Chris Williams
text: Food and band we're good

name: Kim Sullivan
text: Excellent food and service

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Jason Shavers
text: Awesome resturant

name: Collette Bowman
text: Beautiful view, food was fair but in my opinion overpriced is more of a bar scene

name: Sherry Thomas
text: Do not go without a reservation. Waited over 2 hrs for 2 salads, tea and appetizers . Food was good but the wait was terrible.

name: Cindybuse Cisco
text: Loved it we had a lot of fun !!!!!

name: David Valentine
text: Great local gem on the water.

name: Trish Strawn
text: Amazing atmosphere and food!

name: Matthew Ashmore
text: Good live music

name: Katy Gibson
text: Beautiful view

name: Kenny Maynor
text: Just not that good. Period

name: Nora Swords
text: Love the Shrimp and Grits!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: mike clinard
text: Love this place

name: Delora Winfrey
text: Wonderful food ! Terrible service no refill on drinks started eating ice !

resp.text: So sorry for your bad service! Please contact us and if you You come back, which I hope you will, I will set you up with one of our more experienced servers, and give you a couple off free appetizers.

name: gary winner

name: Alicia WAYLEN Smith
text: Closed but when open had Amazing food!!!

name: Tracy West s
text: Ever since they were on "Restaurant Impossible" nothing is the same! Their trademark used to be hush puppies. Who in their right mind would have a seafood place and after being featured on the television show..... THEN stop offering hush puppies to go with a meal. Instead.... They make you pay extra for hush puppies! This is absurd! No wonder no one ever goes there any more! There's a new seafood place by Food Giant that is always so crowded that you have to wait 30 or 45 minutes just to place an order. But most of my Facebook friends go there because it's worth the wait! Bryant's Seafood is so sad because 20 or 30 years ago it was the place to be! Not anymore.

name: Ashely Bryant
text: Me an my dude ate here no it wasn't Bryant seafood but better the new name is till I soul food restaurant an its good omg the best on a Sunday but she told us its open wed thru Sunday trust me your money is worth every bit its not because I'm black but her food is lit thank you girl for the food for your soul baby you did that

name: Emily Butler
text: Not worth the money. The lady at the drive thru had the worst attitude. I'm pretty sure the three cars parked there were workers so it wasn't like they were busy and frazzled. We got a lot of attitude and snarky replies. We've gone here for years and dealt with the crazy wait time at the drive thru because it was usually good food. Not anymore. The food would have had to been the best thing ever for us to ever want to come back for such service. 3 so so meals for almost $50 and terrible service? No thank you.
